Simon O. A. is thirty-three years old, married, and has two children aged seven and three years old. His business is located at Majengo market in Mombasa, Kenya. 

Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling fish for ten years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is storage. Fish is highly perishable. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more fish to expand his business. He hopes to own a room with a refrigeration facility where he can store fish. He is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Kirmany Ole

texts.en:
Kirmany Ole N. is 48 years old, married to Nasarusaru N. and a father of four school-going children. Kirmany is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for fifteen years.

He learned about KADET from other members within his locality who had already registered as members in Kadet. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to plant more wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kirmany's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat planting

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
Rosa B. de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Es madre soltera, ella tiene una niña que estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Rosa empezó hace 6 años visitando la casa de sus vecinos y conocidos ofreciéndoles carnes a un bajo precio, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación implemento nuevos víveres para ofrecer, al ya tener un negocio establecido pudo construir la parte delantera de su casa y convertirla en un pequeño local.

Rosa trabaja en su tienda desde las 07:00 am hasta las 19:00 pm todos los días, vende carnes, bebidas, cereales, arroz etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener la tienda mas surtida y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa B. is 36 years old. She lives in the urban zone Guasmo, in Guayaquil (it was named after the species of trees Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of a humble class, although it used to be a farm). She is a single mother, and she lives with one daughter who studies in a school for taxes. 6 years ago, Rosa began visiting her neighbors' and friends' homes to offer meat at a low price. Little by little with effort and dedication, she began offering additional foods, and now has an established business that she was able to construct alongside of her house to convert it into a small shop. Rosa works in her store from 7am until 7pm every day, selling meats, drinks, grains, rice, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, sugar, and drinks for her store. In the future she wants to better stock the store, and to be able to better construct her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and drinks for Rosa's store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is forty-six years old, married, and has four children aged between twenty-two and two, and they hope to give their children a good education. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega and it is well-known by the name 'White Star Dress Making'. He sells dresses and materials to the local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now. 

Julius says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are have a lot of choice. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more materials. He hopes to open a tailoring school in the future and also to buy cows. He is very hard-working and visionary.

loans.use: Materials for resale and dressmaking

loans.name: Wakiso Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Cotrida N. is a good-humored 43-year-old married woman with seven children who take after her character. She has a pedigree of not being half-hearted in whatever she gets her hands on. It’s for that reason that her eight-year-old retail shop in Wakiso is a melting pot of customers intent on partaking of her good service and bonafide goods.

Cotrida has been downright hardworking ever since she began her business. Her high spirited children are now all in school as a result of her devotion to her work. In a month she makes profits amounting to 150,000 shillings.

Cotrida’s dream is to broaden her business to become a wholesale operation. With this loan she wants to buy retail merchandise, to wit: flasks, flashlights, exercise books and sugar.

loans.use: To buy new retail merchandise to help her in her quest to go wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo Madre Tereza está conformado por tres personas un de ellas es  M. S.M.O de 52 años  quien desde 1980 vende cosméticos al por mayor y al detalle. Ella con el préstamo surtirá su negocio con distintos y novedosos productos.
Sus compañeros de grupo son E. A. L. que comercializa todo tipo de producción y L. B. M. tiene una fritanga desde hace quince años.
texts.en:
The group Madre Tereza is made up of three women. One of them is M.S.M.O., a 52 year-old who has been selling cosmetics wholesale and retail since 1980. With this loan, she would increase her business with different and novel products. Her partners are E.A.L., who sells all kinds of products, and L.B.M., who has had a shop selling fried foods for the past fifteen years.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
Jaria Ramadhan, age 51, is married with 7 children.  She has been having a kiosk business (selling juice, water, sodas) for one year.  She works from 8am to 8pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $306.

This will be Jaria’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the capital and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase stock of her business. 

Jaria will share this loan with her loan group Waukee, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Jaria is in the middle with an orange dress, front row.

loans.use: To increase stock of her business

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface L. hails from Kakamega. He has a business at Shitoli in Kakamega. The business is well-known by the name 'Afya Bakery' and he specializes in selling doughnuts. He has been in this business for the last four years and he hopes to grow it into a real bakery someday. He says this kind of business is very profitable and the main challenge is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are have a lot of choice. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase chickens from which he gets eggs for his business. Besides this precious business, he also rears chickens for sale. He describes himself as hard-working and visionary. Bonface is married. His wife is a farmer and they have one child.

loans.use: to buy chickens for their eggs for baking

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar L. est un commerçant  de 43 ans qui évolue dans l’achat et la vente de ciment et de fer de construction depuis 10 ans aujourd’hui. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis décembre 2009. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Monsieur L. a d’abord démarré  ses activités par l’agriculture avant de se lancer dans le commerce de ciment et de fer. Par ce biais il parvient à satisfaire ses besoins immédiats  tels que la location, la nourriture. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu  pour  l’achat de 7 tonnes de ciment destine a la vente. D’après  lui le prêt lui permettra d’avoir une certaine stabilité  dans son travail et de mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar L. is a 43-year-old retailer who for 10 years has purchased and sold cement and iron for construction. He has been a member of the credit union in Bambilor since December 2009. He has already received a previous loan. Mr. L. first started his activity in farming before launching himself in the sales of cement and iron. Through this activity he manages to provide for his immediate needs such as rent and food. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 Francs planned for the purchase of 7 tons of cement intended for resale. According to him, this loan will allow him to have some stability in his work and he will be better able to take care of his expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo sortilegio está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de D.S quien aprendió desde pequeña el arte de hacer pan y reposterías ya que proviene de una familia de panaderos la cual ella ha continuado. Con el préstamo comprara materia prima como harina, huevos, leche etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son E. D quien vende tropigas y alquila sillas y C. G. A. tiene una pulpería. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group Sortilegio ("Charm") is made up of three hard-working women. One of them, D.S., learned at a very young age the art of making bread and pastries. She comes from a family of bakers and has continued in their footsteps. With this loan, she will buy ingredients like flour, eggs, milk, etc. Her partners are E.D., who sells propane tanks and rents chairs, and C.G.A., who owns a small convenience store. They will invest the money into their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients like flour, yeast, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mazingira Kiburuga Group

texts.en:
Rashid M., age 25, is married with one child of 8 months.  He has a butchery and also sells video cassettes, DVDs, and CDs since 2002.  He works from 7am to 7pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 75. This will be Rashid’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to increase the inventory of  his  businesses. 

Rashid will share this loan with his group Mazingira Kiburugwa, which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Rashid is the only man.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of meat and DVDs, CDs, and cassettes

loans.name: Natividad De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Natividad L. es casada y con un hijo bajo su cargo el cual esta en secundaria, ella es maestra de educación primaria desde hace 28 años y labora en la Escuela Lucrecia Martinez en una comunidad llamada Valle las Mayorgas. El esposo de ella es técnico en artes graficas y trabaja en una tipografía desde hace mas de 20 años.
Doña Natividad ha obtenido 4 créditos que se los ha otorgado Ceprodel y en los cuales ha demostrado ser muy responsable, y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda porque le han permitido mejorar su nivel de vida y a la vez mejorar sus condiciones en el hogar.
texts.en:
La señora Natividad L. es casada y con un hijo bajo su cargo el cual esta en secundaria, ella es maestra de educación primaria desde hace 28 años y labora en la Escuela Lucrecia Martinez en una comunidad llamada Valle las Mayorgas. El esposo de ella es técnico en artes graficas y trabaja en una tipografía desde hace mas de 20 años. Doña Natividad ha obtenido 4 créditos que se los ha otorgado Ceprodel y en los cuales ha demostrado ser muy responsable, y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda porque le han permitido mejorar su nivel de vida y a la vez mejorar sus condiciones en el hogar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Láminas de Zinc, Hierro, Cemento, Malla, Tubos)

loans.name: Norma Irene

texts.es:
Norma T. de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia). Su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera, pero ya todos sus hijos están casados. 

Norma hace 10 años construyo su casa y también la parte delantera la reubico para un pequeño local, pero por falta de ingresos no la pudo terminar y dejo unido el local con la sala y ubico una pequeña tienda. 

Norma ahora tiene una pequeña tienda, trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días, en la tienda vende cereales, bebidas, dulces, golosinas, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, cereales para su tienda y poder así surtirla más. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor el local de su tienda, y tener su tienda mas surtida.
texts.en:
Norma T. is 52 years old. She lives in an urban area of Guasmo, which was named after the type of tree Guazuma ulmifolia. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is a single mother, but all her children are already married. Ten years ago, Norma built her house and set aside a space in the back for a small business. Due to lack of funds, she was not able to finish and left the space attached to the living room and put in a small store. Norma now has a small store, where she works from 7:00AM until 8:00PM every day. She sells cereals, drinks, candies, sweets, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, drinks, and cereals for her store to be able to stock it more fully. In the future, she wants to build a better space for her store and have it more well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, drinks, and cereals

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en el 11º ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y esta integrado por 19 señoras, las mismas tienen diversas actividades en común e independientes.

La señora Catalina G. una de las integrante se dedica a la venta de bijouterie (joyas de plata) y solicita el crédito para la compra de aros, gargantilla, anillos para su reventa.
Catalina es ama de casa y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, ella sale a ofrecer sus joyas por las casa de amigas especialmente, quienes adquieren sus productos a crédito y al contado. Ella comenta que la venta de joyas deja un buen ingreso y ayuda para algunos gastos de las casa.
Agradece a la Fundación y a KIVA por la ayuda crediticia que le brinda a las mujeres de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
This group is on it's 11th loan cycle with the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women. It is comprised of 19 women who have diverse activities, some shared and some independent. Ms. Catalina G., one of the members, works selling silver jewelery and requests the loan to purchase earrings, necklaces, and rings for resale. Catalina is a homemaker and in her free time she works selling silver jewelery. She goes out to offer her jewelery in the houses of her friends who acquire her products on credit or for cash. She comments that the sale of jewelery provides a good income and helps pay some of the household expenses. Thanks to the Foundation and to Kiva for the credit assistance provided to the women of limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of earrings, rings, necklaces, bracelets, all silver.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita T. is 45 years old and married with two grown children. She lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband, Rogelio. For almost 12 years, Angelita has been engaged in a dressmaking business. She is hardworking, determined, and dedicated.

Angelita would like to receive a loan to purchase additional materials for her dressmaking, including cotton fabrics and other inventory. She enjoys spending the income from her dressmaking business. Profit from this kind of business is quite good compared to other businesses that Angelita has tried before. That is why she wants this to become more stable and profitable. She has been able to support the needs of her children in school and improve their life.

Angelita has been a very active member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006. She has been a model member demonstrating a 100% credit rating on previous loans – the basis of loans. Angelita’s dreams are for her two children to complete college. Additionally, she hopes to continue the dressmaking business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. A. is fifty years old.She is married and has eight children between the ages of twenty two years old and thirty five years old. Her business is located at Musoli, a busy market place in Kakamega. She sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics to the local people. She says although this business is good there is a lot of competition and low purchasing power of the people in the area. This is the reason why she has decided to diversify her business by getting into the motor cycle transport business(Boda boda). 

She is using her loan of KES 85,000 to purchase a motor cycle. She, however, hopes that in the future she will be able to open boutiques in other areas and to make more income to educate her children at the university. She also hopes to purchase a plot of land of her own. She is a very hardworking person and describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike

loans.name: Samarik

texts.en:
Samarik N. is 26 years old, single, and a young man who is focused on farming. He has been in the farming business for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff members in his area of residence. This will be his  first loan with which he is planning to plant more wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for farm produce.

He has dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer and havinghis own farm machinery. Samarik is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat planting and buy sheep

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments,  de  bouillie de céréales  et  de médicaments.
Maïmouna C.  qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires (tomate et oignon frais + de l’huile + sel + gombo + poivre +  cube maggi +  concentrée de tomate etc. ) Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les condiments sont revendus au  marché du quartier SANOUBOUGOU I et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA group are married women, on average 45 years old with three children, living in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs in Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They conduct several activities, among which the sale of food condiments, cereal mush and medication. Maïmouna C. is one of the group members who trades in food condiments. Her loan will enable her to buy four packages of food condiments (fresh tomatoes and onions, oil, salt, gombos, pepper, Maggi cubes, tomato paste, etc.). She gets her supplies from the main market in Sikasso and from the surrounding area. The condiments are resold by family members at the SANOUBOUGOU I borough market to women customers, and mainly for cash. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 15,000 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Wassomagni Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe WASSOMAGNI (7 femmes mariées, deux célibataires et une veuve) ont en moyenne  26 ans,  ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités qui sont entre autres la préparation vente d’encens (tels CHATA D.),  de condiments alimentaires,  de chaussures, de vêtements  pour enfants,  des boissons,  des bazin teintés, de  l’atiécké et   bien d’autres produits alimentaires.
CHATA D.  comptent acheter avec son  prêt 25kg de guénni (graines ) + 5 types de parfums + autres petits ingrédients et une trentaine de bouteille pour préparer son encens et les embouteiller . Pour se faire  elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.  L’encens est vendu,  la plupart au comptant,  en famille, au  marché du quartier SANOUBOUGOU et dans les structures professionnelles le plus souvent sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the WASSOMAGNI group (seven married women, two unmarried and one widow) are on average 26 years old with two children, living in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs in Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They carry out several activities, among which the preparation and sale of incense (for example group member Chata D.), food condiments, shoes, children’s clothing, beverages, dyed “bazin” fabric, atiécké (dried cassava preparation), and many other food products. Chata D. wants to use her loan to buy 25 kilos of guénni (seeds), five types of perfume, several other ingredients, and about 30 small bottles to prepare and present her incense for sale. She gets her supplies from the main market in Sikasso. The incense is sold mainly for cash, by family members at the local SANOUBOUGOU borough market and on order to professional retailers, to both men and women customers. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 18,000 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of incense

loans.name: Butaale Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
She has three well-rounded years of experience in plying a fuel-selling business in Kawomya. Success has not been easy to come by on the grounds of some clientele refusing to pay her after taking her fuel products. She hastens to add, however, that such setbacks are part of any business and it’s only an individual’s resilience that can help them bear the pain in such situations.

Such is the notion of a young 23-year-old mother of four school-going children. Her name is N. Hadijjah. For this young businesswoman, a paltry monthly profit of 25,000 shillings has helped her a great deal, despite the fact that it’s little money vis-à-vis what her friends are earning.

Hadijjah’s plan for the future is to expand her fuel-selling business. She is looking at being in a position to sell six jerry cans a week. With the aid of this loan, she is optimistic everything is on the cards.

loans.use: To purchase more jerry cans of fuel to sell

loans.name: Scorpion Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SCORPION ( 7 femmes mariées  et une célibataire) ont en moyenne  38ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités qui sont entre autres la vente de tasses, de tissus,  de poissons,  des boissons et  des médicaments.
KADIATOU C. est un membre du groupe qui s’est spécialisée dans l’achat et la vente de boissons non alcoolisées appelées   sucrerie. 
Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 casiers de boissons (sucrerie : Fanta Orange + Coca-Cola + Cocktail, Sprinte, etc.) 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au dépôt de Boisson à Sanoubougou dans la ville Sikasso. Les boissons sont revendues après les avoir mis au  frais, dans le quartier à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.750FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The eight members of the SCORPION group (seven married women and one unmarried) are on average 38 years old with two children, living for the most part in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They carry out several activities, among which the sale of cups, clothing fabric, fish, beverages and medication. Kadiatou C. is a group member who specialises in buying and selling soft drinks called “sucreries”. With her loan she will buy 12 cases of soft drinks (Fanta Orange, Coca-Cola, Cocktail, Sprite, etc.). She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the Sanoubougou drink depot in Sikasso. The drinks are resold after cooling to both men and women customers, for cash. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 12,750 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy non-alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 37 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona que tiene por principal actividad económica la agricultura, se caracteriza por tener una baja densidad de población y queda ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta ambulante de salchipollos (fritura de carne de pollo y papas) en un carrito sanguchero. El negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional con el cual pueda ayudar al sostenimiento familiar , ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no les bastan para mantenerse.

Marlene ofrece sus productos todos los dias a partir de las seis de la tarde, durante el día se encarga de comprar los insumos que necesitará para realizar su labor y de prepararlos. Ella es consciente de lo importante que es preparar alimentos en las condiciones de salubridad necesarias por lo que siempre pone mucho cuidado al respecto.

La buena sazón con la que prepara la comida que ofrece y el trato amable con el que atiende a sus clientes han hecho que su negocio tenga muy buena acogida y ahora ella no se abastece para atender a todos los clientes que llegan a consumir su producto. Por este motivo ha pensado en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar más platos de comida, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Marlene es una mujer trabajadora y que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada.
texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old and lives with her family in the district of Nueva Arica, an area where agricultural is the principal economic activity. This area is characterized by its low population density and is located an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year she has been peddling salchipollos (a chicken and potatoes dish) on a food cart. This business came from the necessity to add another income to sustain their family since the earnings of her husband, a farmer, could no longer support them.

Marlene offers her products every day after 6 in the evening. During the day she is responsible for buying the necessary ingredients and preparing the food. She is aware of the importance of cooking in sanitary conditions and she always is very careful.

The tastiness of the food she offers and the kindness with which she treats her clients has made her business very welcome and now she is not able to serve all the customers coming to eat her food. Because of this she has been thinking about expanding her business by buying more supplies so that she can prepare more plates of food. She has decided that to do this she needs to take our her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 700 nuevos soles.

Marlene is a very hardworking woman and day by day she better the situation of her family. Her biggest goal is to be able to grant her family a better quality of life. In the area where she lives she is very well known and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Iii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY III”; Ellos son 14 miembros  entusiastas y muy trabajadores; los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen una vez al mes en el local de Arariwa en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Srta. Joysi tiene 24 años de edad, ella es estudiante de administración hotelera en un instituto, la socia vende por catálogos perfumes y maquillajes, entre otros productos de belleza, ella solicita el préstamo para hacer pagar todos los pedidos de su catálogo que le hicieron sus clientes y una vez que ella pague recibo los productos para que los reparta a sus clientes y esperar a que ellos le paguen en dos partes, Nuestra socia desea a futuro trabajar en hotelería.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con la venta de carne, transporte, venta de chompas, elaboración de soya, venta de huevos, abarrotes, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, profesora. Nuestros socios requieren el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “WAYNA TAUCARAY III”; They are 14 enthusiastic and hardworking members. The members live in the city of Cusco and they meet once a month in Arariwa in the district of Huanchac in the department of Cusco. One member, Srta. Joysi is 24 years old. She is studying hotel administration at secondary school. She sells perfume and makeup among other beauty products by catalog. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for all of the orders from the catalog that her customers have made and upon receiving the products she will deliver them to her customers and hope they will pay her in two payments. Srta. Joysi wants to work in a hotel in the future. Our members work in various jobs including selling meat, transportation, selling sweaters, producing soy, selling eggs, groceries, selling food, selling fruit, and teaching. Our members need the loan to reinvest in their different businesses. The members are thankful for the loan and promise to continue making their payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products ordered from catalogs.

loans.name: Alahou Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe ALAHOU (5 femmes mariées et deux célibataires) ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 1 enfant. La plupart  vit dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Les  membres du groupe mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de savon,  de lait en poudre,  de sucre,  de vêtements  pour enfants (tels Assanata Lassine Traoré)  et  des chaussures.
Assanata Lassine Traoré  compte acheter  avec son  prêt,  9 douzaines de vêtements  pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Les vêtements sont revendus dans les différents marchés et quartiers de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour devenir grossiste afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the ALAHOU group (five married women and two single women) average 28 years of age with one child. The majority of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out in order to satisfy their customers' needs. The members of the group have a variety of businesses, which include the sale of soap, powdered milk, sugar, children's clothing (as in the case of Assanata Lassine Traoré) and shoes. With her loan, Assanata Lassiné Traoré is planning to buy nine dozen clothes for children. She gets her supplies at the large market in Sikasso Town. The clothes are then resold in different markets and on a door-to-door basis in the various districts, to a customer base made up of men and women, mainly for cash. She envisages making a monthly profit of 17,500FCFA, of which part will be saved for social ends and the rest invested in her business. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to become a wholesaler and satisfy her customers more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Kambuga Bakyara Kwekamba, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking K. Crenereo started his hardware business thirty years ago dealing in general building merchandise. Being strategically located in Kihihi town, he gets many customers, earning him a profit of 286,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. His main drawback is having a small amount of stock that cannot match the demand from his customers.

With this loan Crenereo hopes to buy more stock for his business. This will help him expand his business market and also earn more sales revenue. This, in turn, will enable him to cater for the requirements of his three children, who are still undergoing school, and also enable him to progress economically.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Limaniya. Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe LIMANIYA (8 femmes mariées et 2 célibataires) avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants  vivent dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Les membres du groupe  mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus,  d’huile alimentaire,  de friperie, de chaussures,  de fruits et légumes, de tubercules,  des produits de beauté,  des produits alimentaires et la restauration tels Wassa O..
Wassa comptent acheter avec son  prêt 1 sac de 100kg de riz + 3paquets de condiments et 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Elle  vend au  marché du quartier à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group LIMANIYA (eight married woman and two unmarried women) average 29 years of age and three children living in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  These women are on their first collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. The group members have various businesses, which include selling cloth, vegetable oil, second-hand clothing, fruit and vegetables, tubers, beauty products, and food products, and they work in food catering, as does Wassa O.. Wassa intends to use her loan to buy a 100-kg sack of rice, three packets of condiments, and a cart load of firewood.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso City and neighboring towns.  Accepting cash most of the time, she sells at the local market to a customer base composed of men and women.  She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,500 francs CFA.  Part of the loan will be put into savings for societal purposes, and the other part will be invested in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for cooking food

loans.name: Mbague

texts.fr: Madame Mbague K. est une femme mariée  de 36 ans. Elle habite à Sangalkam et est sociétaire de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre  2009. Madame  K. a 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 8 et 25 ans. C’est une commerçante  qui s’active dans l’achat et la vente de légumes (tomates, chou carotte, aubergines  etc.) depuis plus de 10ans. Après son mariage elle a pense  a avoir une activité.  Et c’est aujourd’hui cette occupation qui lui permet d’assurer la dépense  quotidienne mais aussi d’autres dépenses  liées aux besoins de la survie de la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour acheter des légumes  et renforcer son activité. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de roulement et   ses revenus pour, mieux  gerber  la famille
texts.en:
Ms. Mbague K. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Sangalkam.  She has been a member of U-IMCEC since December 2009.  She has eight children, ranging from 8 to 25 years of age.  She is a merchant who has been active in buying and selling vegetables (tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, eggplants, etc.) for over ten years.  After getting married, Mbague thought about having working.  And today, this occupation allows her to ensure that day-to-day expenses are covered, as well as other expenses related to the family's survival.  Mbague is requesting a loan of 200,00 francs for buying some vegetables and for bolstering her business.  This loan will enable her to increase her working capital and her revenues, so as to do better in running the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting her funds

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is widowed with one child. She rents space in a department store and sells women's clothing. Svetlana has been in this business for 11 years. She inherited it from her parents. At that time, the business was located in the market. Svetlana was able to move the business into a store where she has better work conditions and more clients.

Svetlana would like to borrow 10,000 hryvnia to increase her assortment. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Marcia Gregoria

texts.es:
Marcia M. de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (llamado así por sus lomas, lugar muy humilde con calles de tierra y la mayoría de las casas son de caña) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad, ellos tienen dos hijos de 7 y 2 años.    

Cuando Marcia era pequeña su mama tenia una pequeña tienda ella le ayudaba y le compraba los víveres para venderlos. Cuando se caso invirtió sus ahorros víveres para vender y arreglo la parte delantera de su casa para ubicar su pequeña tienda. 

Por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene su tienda, trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 21:00 pm todos los días, con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados y galletas para su pequeña tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket y tener a su cargo empleados para ella poder dedicarse a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia M. is 29 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. (Fortín is named after its hills. This humble place has dirt roads and most of the houses in the area are made of reeds.) Her husband works as a security guard and they have two children, ages 7 and 2.

When Marcia was a young girl, her mother had a small shop where she helped her buy and sell food. When she got married, she used her savings to remodel the front part of her house so that she could open a small store selling groceries.

That turned out to be a good decision. She now works at her store between 6am and 9pm every day. Her loan will be used to buy rice, canned goods, and cookies for her small store. In the future, she wants to open a mini-market and hire employees so that she can dedicate her time to raising her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods, and cookies

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana L. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo para pagar  la universidad de su hija. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder colocar el piso de concreto que le esta haciendo falta a su casa ya que cuando llueve se inunda y no hay paso. Quien se encargara de realizar la mejora será su esposo el señor Esteban Baristo, que se dedica a la construcción. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como cajera de un centro comercial,
texts.en:
Sra. Adriana L. is very grateful for the assistance provided from her previous loan, which was used to help pay for her daughter’s university expenses.

She is requesting a new loan in order to lay down a concrete floor that is lacking in her home. Her house floods when it rains and there is nowhere for the water to go. Her husband, Sr. Esteban Baristo, works in construction and will be the person responsible for making this improvement.

Adriana plans to repay the loan from the salary she receives working as a cashier at a shopping center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lay down a concrete floor

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Patricia Q. esta agradecida con su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual decidió poner la cocineta a su casa ya que le estaba haciendo mas falta.
Nueva mente solicita un préstamo para poder empezar la construcción de una cuarto el cual será para su pequeño hijo que tiene pocos mese de nacido y necesita espacio en la casa y como esta muy pequeña, desea ampliarla un poco más.
Quien le ayuda ha cuidar a su bebe es su mama ya que ella tiene que trabajar para salir adelante, ya que con una parte del sueldo que recibe es para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Patricia Q. is grateful for the assistance of her previous loan, which was used to install a kitchen that her house was lacking.

She is requesting a new loan in order to begin construction of a room for her young son, who is only a few months old. Ana Patricia needs extra space in her small house, so she wants to expand it a little more.

Her mother helps with taking care of the baby because she has to work in order to stay ahead. Part of her salary will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of a room at the back of her house

loans.name: Jaime Fernando

texts.es:
El joven Jaime R. es casado y con 2 hijas y un varón todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa. Jaime es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace 11 años se desempeña en el cargo de Responsable de Administración Tributaria.
El trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2006 y ha obtenido tres créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que se le otorgo fue para gastos médicos, ya que su señora tiene problemas de salud.
texts.en:
El joven Jaime R. es casado y con 2 hijas y un varón todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa. Jaime es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace 11 años se desempeña en el cargo de Responsable de Administración Tributaria. El trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2006 y ha obtenido tres créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que se le otorgo fue para gastos médicos, ya que su señora tiene problemas de salud.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos Médicos (exámenes médicos, medicina)  y otros.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio R. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito, el cual le ayudo a mejor su negocio. 
Es nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para comprar herramienta que le esta haciendo falta y material. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario y tiene varios trabajos pendientes para entregar y no cuenta con el materia para terminar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio y que es la fuente de ingresos del su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio R. is grateful for the assistance from his previous loan, which helped to improve his business.

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy tools and materials that he is lacking. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds. He has several pending jobs that needed to be completed, but he does not have the materials to finish them.

José Antonio plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from his business, which is his family’s source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & materials for his business

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally R. is married and lives in the province of Rizal, in the Philippines, with her husband and two children. Sally is a hard working entrepreneur with her food vending business. She has been in business working as an entrepreneur for almost 10 years. Sally would like to receive a loan to purchase additional inventory for her food selling business. She is planning to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, starch, rice, coconut, cooking oil, eggs, chicken meat, banana, sweet potato, pasta and other supplies. Sally believes that having a greater variety of inventory will help her to retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. 
 
Sally is grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund the continued education of her children. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Sally is determined to achieve business success to build more long term financial security for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products such as sugar, starch, rice, coconut, cooking oil, eggs, chicken meat, banana, sweet potato, pasta and other supplies.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married with two adult children. He owns a retail business selling food at one of the open markets in Uzhgorod town. Victor has been in this business for 16 years. Hard work and persistence helped him to develop his business well and make it a stable source of income for his family. Victor would like to borrow 6,500 hryvnia to increase his assortment and make additional income.

loans.use: To increase his assortment

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 29 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector La Compuerta del distrito de Oyotún, un zona caracterizada por tener la mayor parte de su geografía muy accidentada debido a la cercanía a la sierra norte del país, su principal actividad es la agricultura aunque no cuenta con muchas areas fértiles, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona y durante ese tiempo ahorró el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir su propio terreno agrícola con el que ahora puede obtener ingresos seguros y ya no eventuales como los percibía anteriormente. 

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno y se encuentra dedicado a labores de cuidado y mantenimiento de su sembrío, el pone mucho cuidado en su cultivo por lo que desea asegurarse una buena producción. Luis desea brindarle a su cultivo mantenimiento aplicándole fertilizantes y pesticidas por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Luis es bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empersario y poder adquirir mas hectareas de terreno. En la zona donde vive el es considerado alguien tranquilo y de confianza
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 29 years old and lives with his family in the La Compuerta section of the Oyotún district, an area known for having a rough terrain due to its proximity to the mountains to the north of the country. The principal activity is agriculture even though there are not too many fertile areas. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young, he has been performing agricultural work. He started as a farm hand at various farms in the area. During that time, he saved enough money to be able to buy his own farm land, where he can now make a secure living, rather than what his previously temporary employment afforded him. He has planted corn in his fields and finds himself taking care and maintaining his crop. He puts a lot care into maintaining his crop because he wants to ensure a good production. Luis wants to apply fertilizer and pesticide to his fields and because of this he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 new soles that will help him achieve his objectives. Luis is hard-working and responsible. His main goal is to continue growing as a businessman and be able to purchase more farm land. In the area where he lives he is considered as a quiet and trustworthy man.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Application of fertilizers and pesticides for his crop.

loans.name: Dalias Lindas Group

texts.es:
Josefina T. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Dalias Lindas que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, tiene 31 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, viven en la zona Pasankeri hace 6 años aproximadamente.
Josefina tiene el negocio de venta de fruta en la zona Satélite, cuenta con su puesto propio y vende hace 12 años aproximadamente.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como costura de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de CDS, venta de ropa y frutas.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.

Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Collpani.
texts.en:
Josefina T. is a member of the “Dalias Lindas” (Beautiful Dahlias) Communal Association, which is part of the Collpani Community Center. She is 31 years old and a resident of the city of El Alto, specifically in the Pasankeri district where she has lived for approximately for six years. Josefina has a business selling fruit in the district of Satélite. She has her own vending post and has been working in this business for approximately twelve years.

The other members of this Communal Association engage in different business activities such as sewing jackets, selling food, selling CDs, selling clothes, and selling fruit. They all need this loan in order to acquire merchandise, supplies, and raw materials according to their respective businesses.

They meet every two weeks at the Collpani Community Center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, supplies, and raw materials

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo D. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo obtener su vivienda. 
A su casa le esta haciendo falta algunos detalles pero el quiere empezar con los acabados del exterior, ya que cuando llueve hay mucha humedad en la casa y sus pequeños hijos se le enferman. 
Esta solicitando su cooperación nuevamente en este crédito y planea pagarlo con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de pintor de carros, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Esther Ortiz esposa del señor Juan Pablo D. ya que el se encontraba en su taller, cuando se realizo la visita.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo Diaz is very grateful for the assistance from his previous loan, which he used to obtain his home. His home is lacking a few details, so he wants to begin with the exterior finishes. When it rains, it becomes very humid inside his house and his young children become sick. He is requesting your cooperation with another loan which he plans to repay using part of his earnings from his business painting cars. This is his family’s source of income. The person in the photo is Sra. Maria Esther Ortiz, Sr. Juan Pablo Diaz's wife. Juan Pablo Diaz was not available for the photo since he works during the day at his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the exterior of his house

loans.name: Abdou Karim

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou Karim N. est un jeune couturier de 33 ans qui a adhéré à la caisse de Bambilor depuis septembre 2009. Il habite à Bambilor. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 4 ans. Monsieur N. a évolué dans la couture et la confection de prêts a porter depuis plus de 10 ans. Après avoir quitte l’école  son père l’a envoyé  apprendre le métier  de tailleur. C’est ainsi qu’il a progresse jusqu'à  accéder  a 2 ateliers  de couture. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect créatif  et en même  temps lucratif de son activité, ce qui lui permet d e subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu’a ceux  de sa famille. Il emprunte 150 000 frs pour acheter des tissus en vue de confectionner  des habits prêt a porter qui seront destines a la vente. Ce crédit pourra permettre une croissance de ses revenus pour une meilleure gestion de ses dépenses  quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Karim N. is a young tailor, 33 years old, who has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since September 2009. He lives in Bambilor. He is married and the father of two children (one and four years of age). Mr. N. has been working in tailoring as well sewing ready-to-wear clothing for more than ten years. After he had left school, his father sent him to study the tailoring trade. This is how he started his progress to the point where he is running two tailor shops. What interests him most is the creative aspect of this business, as well as the financial aspect permitting him to support himself and his family. He is borrowing 150,000 West African francs in order to purchase fabrics for sewing ready-to-wear clothing for sale. This credit will allow him to increase his revenues and better manage his everyday budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the business

loans.name: Lukwago

texts.en: At 25 years of age, Lukwago is the father of two children, ages 4 and 2. He is the breadwinner for his family of five people and he has managed to construct a permanent home for them. He currently has a motorcycle he rides for business. He says he is okay with the business because the returns he makes are worth the effort. In his area of Katikara, Uganda, the motorcycle business is profitable due to lack of better means of transport and bad roads. He would like to expand the motorcycle business by buying another motorcycle using the loan funds.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying local brew for resale

loans.name: Alirio Josè

texts.es:
En el barrio la Luz de la ciudad de Barranquilla, vive un hombre muy trabajador él es Alirio José B. de 41 años, muy dedicado a su negocio de elaboración y venta de almuerzos y a su vez comidas rápidas; su grupo familiar lo conforman  su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos entre 4 y 14 años, que son la razón por lo que esta familia se esmera trabajando para salir adelante. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un monto de $1.300.000, con él planea comprar mesa y materiales para la elaboración de sus almuerzo y  comidas rápidas, tales como arroz, aceite, margarina, carne, pollo, queso, salsas y embutidos.

Alirio es proveniente del departamento de Córdoba, localizado al norte, en la Región Caribe Colombiana, frente al mar Caribe, donde las ciénagas, ferias ganaderas, los festivales como el del burro, reinados y sus tierras fértiles, aseguran un agroturismo de belleza inigualable; este es el escenario donde hace 5 años  inició su negocio de venta de sopas y almuerzos, que hoy continua en Barranquilla, y al que le agregó comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, hamburguesas, arepas rellenas, chuzos y maíz desgranado. Alirio tiene una ayudante todos los días para preparar los almuerzos de sus clientes  y adiciona otro los fines de semana para vender los ya famosos perros calientes, hamburguesas y carnes frías. Como su  negocio funciona en su residencia, su familia es bien reconocida en la comunidad. Su meta principal es organizarlo muy bien, ofreciéndoles a sus clientes mayor comodidad con más sillas y mesas, porque eso es precisamente ser oportuno en sus preferencia,  y es también, prestarle  un mejor servicio a quienes le compran. Su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital para que su negocio funcione con las herramientas requeridas y la excelencia en el servicio.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of “La Luz” (The Light) in the city of Barranquilla lives a hardworking gentleman named Alirio José B.. He is 41 years old and dedicated to his business selling lunches and occasionally fast food. His family consists of his wife and three children between the ages of 4 and 14, who are the reason why he strives in his work to get ahead. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he has requested the amount of 1,300,000 COP. He plans to buy a table and ingredients for preparing lunches and fast food such as rice, oil, margarine, meat, chicken, cheese, sauces, and sausages.

Alirio is from the Department of Córdoba, which is located to the north in the part of Colombia facing the Caribbean Sea. This area is known for its swamps, livestock fairs, festivals (such as the one celebrating the donkey), pageants, and fertile soil. Here he started his business five years ago selling soups and lunches. He continues his business in Barranquilla and has since added fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, stuffed “arepas” (corn bread), skewered meats, and kernelled corn. Alirio has an assistant who help every day preparing lunches for his customers and on the weekends sells his famous hot dogs, hamburgers, and cold cuts. Since he operates his business out of his home, his family is well-known in the community. His main goal is to be well-organized, so he provides his customers plenty of chairs and tables to make them more comfortable. Alirio prefers it this way because it allows him to provide better service to his paying customers. His greatest challenge is not having enough capital to run his business with the necessary tools so that he can provide excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a table & ingredients for preparing lunches and fast food

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a youth aged 26 married to a peasant wife and together they have three children aged 7, 2 and 1 years of age. He is the income earner for the family and his family resides in a rented house in Katikara, Uganda. He has a retail shop in which he sells sugar, salt, soap and other domestic requirements. He says his business has grown in size over the five years he has operated it. 

Hillary faces a transport problem for his purchases due to poor roads that are common in the upcountry areas of Uganda. The purpose of the loan funds is to buy sugar, rice, salt, and soap for selling in his shop.

loans.use: buying sugar, rice, salt, and soap for selling in his shop.

loans.name: 1 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Marina Máxima A. de  33 años es casada y vecina de la  ciudad de El Alto, Villa Adela  hace 6 años aproximadamente.
Marina tiene el negocio de venta de abarrotes (alimento seco) en la zona 12 de Octubre, donde tiene un lugar propio de venta. Ella vende desde hace 15 años y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor y minimizar costos.

Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal 1 de Julio, tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de bañadores, carne, abarrotes, dulces, CDS, pollo, celulares, elaboración de calzados y atención de tienda de barrio.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.

Ellas se reúnen mensualmente en el Centro Focal Collpani.
texts.en:
Marina Máxima A. is 33 years old, married, and a resident of the city of El Alto. She has been living in the Villa Adela neighborhood for approximately six years.

Marina has a business selling groceries (dried foods) in the October 12th District where she has her own vending post. She has been in this business for 15 years and needs a loan in order to buy merchandise in bulk so that she can minimize costs.

The remaining members of the “1 de Julio” (July 1st) Communal Association have their own businesses selling products such as swimsuits, meat, groceries, candy, CDs, chicken, and mobile phones. Other members manufacture shoes and manage neighborhood stores. They all need a loan in order to acquire merchandise, supplies, or raw materials according to their businesses.

The members meet on a monthly basis at the Collpani Community Center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa de 50 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos: Estrella de 23 años la que actualmente esta estudiando su ultimo de año de la universidad y esta en el proceso de la defensa de su titiulo, y Freddy de 20 años quien ya trabaja, y el menor esta estudiando la escuela primaria. Se desempeña como consejal en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años. 

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de kiva para terminar la construccion de sus cuartos, la que inicio con los creditos anteriores, pues este seria su 3er solicitud con kiva, ademas desea construir un porche, ya que con las lluvias se le mete el agua y desea hacer este trabajo antes que inicie el invierno.  

Su mayor sueño es poder ver su casa amplia para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia, pues es el patrimonio que les dejara cuando falte.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 50 years old, single, and has three children. Estrella is 23 years old and currently in her final year of university. She is in the process of earning her degree. Freddy is 20 years old and working. Maria’s youngest child is in elementary school.

Maria has been working as a councilor for the Municipality of Juigalpa for the past two years. She is requesting her seventh loan and hopes to continue receiving support through Kiva to finish the construction of the rooms in her house. Her previous loans were used to begin the work and this will be her third request through Kiva. Maria also wants to build a porch to take in water when it rains. She hopes to begin the work before winter begins.

Her greatest wish is finish the expansion of her house in order to make her family comfortable. She plans to leave it as an inheritance when she is gone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room & build a porch

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 27-year-old man, married with one child. He is a big business dreamer who wants his retail shop to prosper to big levels of sustainability. He currently lives in a mud and wattle house with his family of two in Katikara, Uganda. In his retail shop, Robert sells sugar, soap, salt and other domestic requirements. He is the breadwinner for his wife and child, and is dreaming of constructing a permanent house for the family one day because the mud one he is living in now is not comfortable or safe. He is to use the loan funds to buy sugar, soap, beer to sell in his shop.

loans.use: buying sugar, soap, beer for  his shop

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Pradera de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad conocida a nivel nacional como Ciudad de la Amistad, es uno de los principales ejes comerciales del norte peruano, dado su movimiento comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo, empezó en este negocio debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitieran ayudar al sostenimiento familiar. Empezó buscando sus propios clientes y durante este tiempo ella se ha esforzado por salir adelante y poco a poco sus ventas se han incrementado, actualmente ha logrado ascender al cargo de coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras, esto la llena de orgullo y ganas de seguir trabajando.

Virginia desea instalar en su vivienda un pequeño puesto de venta donde pueda mostrar un stock permanente de productos, siguiendo este objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a adquirir la mercadería que necesita. Esta acción le permitirá vender productos de belleza cuando el cliente lo necesite, sin necesidad de que tengan que esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando el pedido llega a sus manos.

Virginia es una mujer entregada a su familia y que se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para sacarlos adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 44 and lives with her husband and 2 children in the La Pradera area of the city of Chiclayo, a city known at the national level as the City of Friendship. It is one of the main commercial axes in northern Peru. Given its commercial activity, it is the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has sold cosmetics and beauty products by catalog for more than 5 years. She started this business due to the need to obtain additional income to allow her to help sustain her family. She started looking for her own customers, and during this time, she has strived to get ahead. Little by litte, her sales have increased. Currently, she has managed to assume the role of coordinating a group of saleswomen. This fills her with pride and the desire to keep working. Virginia hopes to install a small sales stand in her home where she can display a permanent stock of products. To accomplish this objective, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN, which she will use to acquire the merchandise she neeeds. This will let her sell more beauty products, which her customers need, without the need to wait until the end of the month, which is when her delivery arrives. Virginia is a woman who is devoted to her family, and she has decided to work to take good care of them. She has already worked previously with our institution, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to intall a small sales stand in her home

loans.name: Lusiano

texts.en: Lusiano is a young man living in the remote town of Katikara, Uganda. He is married to a peasant farmer and together they have two children aged 3 and 1. Though he is young, Lusiano owns a residential house already. He deals in produce (groundnuts, beans, and maize) as his business. He says transport of his purchases is his major hardship, and he hopes to address it one day by buying his own vehicle. Aat 26 years of age, he says he can achieve that feat over time through hard work in selling dry foods. This is his third loan from HOFOKAM and he is to use the loan funds to buy groundnuts, beans, and maize for selling.

loans.use: buying groundnuts, beans, maize for resale

loans.name: Pablo Eliecer

texts.es:
Pablo Eliecer R. B., tiene 38 años y vive en el barrio la Magdalena al sur de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 19 años, él es un hombre muy inquieto que vende  queso desde cuando quedó sin empleo y un amigo le enseñó las bases de este negocio;  ahora vende por encargo este producto en un fin de semana  y en el otro vende frutas como cerezas,  manzanas y uvas chilenas, pero como buen comerciante ofrece a todo el que conoce  mercancía al detal, especialmente calzado para damas y caballeros que también maneja a crédito. Esta es una de las razones por la cual solicita su segundo crédito por valor de $1.700.000 para invertir  la  mayor cantidad de queso que es su producto estrella, otra parte en los encargos de cerezas frescas y la otra en calzado para damas y caballeros.
Su negocio de queso empezó hace 12 años cando solo vendía una o dos libras, ahora tiene más cliente y vende 120 kilos, él lo compra en los cuartos fríos, su esposa lo apoya porque trabaja en una empresa y también está atenta a conseguirle clientes. Su meta principal es educar bien a sus hijos ofrecerles estudios de calidad y este es su más grande reto, más adelante  sueña con tener un carro propio, para llevarle la mercancía a sus clientes pues en la actualidad se  transporta en moto y paga su pasaje.
texts.en:
Pablo Eliecer R. B. is 38 and lives in the La Magdalena neighborhood in southern Barranquilla with his wife and 4 children, who range in age from 1 to 19 years. He is a very enterprising man who has sold cheese since he was once left without a job. A friend taught him the basics of this business. Now he sells his product by making deliveries on the weekend. On the other days, he sells cherries, apples, and Chilean grapes, but like a good merchant, he retails every kind of merchandise with which he is familiar, especially men's and women's shoes, which he sells on credit. This is one of the reasons he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 Colombian pesos: to invest mostly in the purchase cheese, which is his star product. He will also invest some in the purchase of cherries and strawberries and in shoes for men and women. He started his cheese business 12 years ago when he only sold 1-2 pounds. Now he has more customers and sells 120 kilograms, which he buys in cold, 1/4 kilogram blocks. His wife helps him because she works at a company, and she is also thoughtful and tries to earn new customers for him. His main goal is to educated his children well and to offer them high-quality studies. This is his biggest challenge. Later on, he hopes to have his own car so he can take his merchandise to his customers. Currently he transports his goods on a motorcycle that he pays to use.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, his main product, as well as fresh cherries and men's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut grains to sow

loans.name: Luis Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Luis L. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 varones y una niña todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa, don Luis es trabajador de la Compañía Licorera desde hace 23 años en donde se desempeña como Blendificador.
El nos expresaba que todos los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que han mejorado las condiciones del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
El señor Luis L. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 varones y una niña todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa, don Luis es trabajador de la Compañía Licorera desde hace 23 años en donde se desempeña como Blendificador. El nos expresaba que todos los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que han mejorado las condiciones del hogar y de su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Láminas de Zinc, Cemento, Arena, Clavos)

loans.name: Abla Rosaline

texts.fr: Cette  dame s’est lancée depuis 1998 dans le commerce de charbons de bois,  elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays ainsi  elle réalise de plus grands profits sur ses ventes. Elle voudrait rehausser son stock en baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 9 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady launched a charcoal business in 1998. She gets her supplies inland, so that she makes higher profits on her sales. She would like to increase her declining stock and is thus requesting a loan from WAGES to buy nine sacks of charcoal. She is married and mother to three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of yam heads

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua F. sells fresh garden eggs (small eggplants), tomatoes and other foodstuffs at Abura.  Efua has received senior high education.  She is married to a farmer. Efua has been selling garden eggs and fresh tomatoes for about a year now. She helps her husband in paying for their rent and other expenditures that may occur. Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more garden eggs, tomatoes and other vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more garden eggs, tomatoes and other vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
A la vivienda D. la señora Magdalena G. le está haciendo falta la barda perimetral, para que este mas segura. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara D. realizare la mejora.
Desea que sus dos hijos estén seguros cundo ella y sus esposo se encuentren  trabajando.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene D. su trabajo en una fábrica en el área D. producción, ya que su esposo el señor Pablo Hernandez se encargara D. los gastos D. la familia con el sueldo que recibe D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
Magdalena G.'s home is lacking the perimeter wall to make it safer. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the material and to pay the person who will carry out this improvement. She wants her two children to be safe when she and her husband are working. She plans to pay this loan back from the income she makes from her job in a factory. Her husband, señor Pablo Hernandez, takes care of their family's expenses with the wages he receives from his job.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.es:
Arcenia tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos menores hijos. Vive en la hermosa selva cusqueña, en la localidad de Kimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa.

Empezó a trabajar desde muy jovencita, recuerda que ayudaba a sus padres en la chacra y se sentía cómoda con lo que hacía. Pero nunca imaginó que el curso de su vida iba a cambiar de manera repentina, pues actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Generalmente trabaja todos los días desde las 5:30 AM hasta las 9:00 PM y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. No contento con ello, Arcenia anhela en un futuro cercano incursionar en la agricultura, cultivando cacao y café para tener ingresos extras.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos en las fechas estipuladas. También agradece a la institución por las facilidades de crédito que le están, otorgando. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de apalear las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arcenia is 31 years old. She lives with her partner and their two minor children. They live in the beautiful forest lands near Cusco, in the village of Kimbiri, where they have their own home. Arcenia started working when she was very young. She remembers that she helped her parents in the fields, and she was satisfied with what she did. But she never imagined that the course of her life would drastically change: she currently operates a grocery store. She usually works every day, from 5:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., and sometimes she receives help from her husband and children. Not content with this alone, Arcenia wants to start farming in the near future, cultivating cocoa and coffee to produce extra income. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on the specified dates. She also thanks the institution for the credit terms it is providing to her. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy more products for her grocery store, in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying additional merchandise

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es:
Cayo tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y tiene una hijita. Vive en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su motivación es vender los productos en su localidad y en otros lugares estratégicos y visualiza oportunidades a futuro, eso caracteriza al visionario Cayo. A su corta edad ya tiene un negocio de abarrotes y la vez está en la actividad agrícola, exclusivamente al cultivo de cacao.
En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general tiene a cargo a dos peones para el cuidado de su chacra, ya que regularmente está en su  negocio de abarrotes. Generalmente atiende todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con respecto a su producto agrícola, la vende en los centros de acopio de localidad. 
En el futuro espera ampliar su negocio de abarrotes y también adquirir un motocarro, para que no gaste en el transporte a su chacra.
