Este el primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir con sus cuotas de pago, además agradece a su banco comunal por el buen desempeño que tuvieron en la primera reunión grupal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad captar más cliente.
texts.en:
Cayo is 22 years old and unmarried, and has a little daughter. He lives in the village of Palmapampa, in the Peruvian high jungle, where he owns his own home. Cayo is a visionary who wants to sell merchandise in his town and other strategic locations, and he sees a lot of opportunities in his future. At his young age he's already established a grocery store and is also a cacao farmer. He sometimes receives help from his family, but he generally relies on two day laborers to tend his farm, since he spends a lot of time at his grocery business. He's usually there every day from 5 in the morning till 9 at night. He sells his cacao harvest in the local wholesale markets. In the future he'd like to expand his grocery business and also purchase a car so he doesn't spend so much on transportation to his farm. This is his first loan from MFP, and he is determined to make all his payments on time. He's grateful to his village bank for their excellent work at the first group meeting. Cayo will use the requested loan to buy more product for his grocery store in order to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Cuatro Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Dafne Maria Gomes de 43 años, casada con Roberto Paco, vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Paraíso hace 3 años aproximadamente, tiene domicilio propio y vio la necesidad de que las personas realizan con frecuencia pequeñas compras, entonces, decidió abrir una tienda de barrio, cuando compró su domicilio, desde entonces estos ingresos ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ahora quiere mejorar y estocarse mayor cantidad de mercadería.
Sus demás compañeras de la Asociación Comunal 4 Estrellas, también tienen actividades económicas como la venta de fibra de vidrio, condimentos, ropa de bebe, plásticos, conservas, leche y serigrafía.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.

Ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal Collpani.
texts.en:
Dafne is 43 years old, married to Robert and lives in the city of El Alto in the Paradise Zone. She has had her own house for the past three years. She noticed that people needed to make small purchases frequently so she decided to open a neighborhood store when she bought her house. The earnings from the store have helped pay for the basic necessities for her family. Now she would like to improve her business by stocking a larger quantity of merchandise in her store. The other members of the Four Stars Community Association also have economic activities such as selling fiberglass, condiments, baby clothes, plastics, preserves, milk or serigraphy. They meet in the Collpani Center.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 36 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus seis hijos. Reside en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su deseo siempre fue apostar por un negocio que sea rentable, por lo que se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café, para ello tiene pensado ampliar su terreno cultivo, además de arrendar terrenos de otros productores. Eusebio trabaja en su chacra desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, donde labora de manera independiente, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de pareja y sus hijos; sin embargo en los tiempos de cosecha requiere de trabajadores para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de sus productos. Asimismo, sus productos los vende en su misma localidad, a precio de mercado.

te es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar de manera puntual y oportuna sus respectivas cuotas. A su vez agradece a los socios que conforman su banco comunal y asegura que continuará, ya que le otorga muchos beneficios. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en darle mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 36 years old and lives with his partner and mother of his six children. He lives in Palmapampa, which is located in the jungles of Peru. This is where he has his own house. His always desired to begin a profitable business. That is why he grows cacao and coffee. He would like to expand his cultivable land. Also he would like to rent land from other farmers. Eusebio works on his farm from six in the morning until six in the evening. He usually works alone but sometimes he gets help from his partner and his children. In harvest time he needs to hire workers in order to facilitate harvesting his crops. He sells his crops locally at market price. This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to pay his loan on time and according to the payment schedule. He is thankful to the members of the communal bank and wants to be sure that they continue to exist as they provide many benefits. He will invest the loan money in the maintenance of his cacao plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining his plantation

loans.name: Annia De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Annia B. de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso (lugar muy humilde, con casas de caña y los caminos son de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es albañil ellos tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Annia empezó como vendedora ambulante vendiendo lapiz y plumas en los sectores que mas conocía, pero por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio y para evitar el cansancio de caminar decidió invertir sus ahorros en un pequeño local y papelería. 

 Annia ahora tiene una papelería muy surtida, trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, papeles etc. En estos meses ha tenido buenas ganancias debido a que la temporada escolar empezó en abril. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería y plumas para su negocio.

En el futuro quiere que su negocio sea mucho mas grande y poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Annia B., 34 years old, lives in a peri-urban area in Paraíso (a very modest place, with reed houses and dirt roads) in Guayaquil. Her husband is a construction worker. They have two children who are studying in public schools. Annia began as a street vendor, selling pens and pencils in the areas she knew best. However, with the desperate wish to have her own business and to avoid the exhaustion of walking, she decided to invest her savings in a small stationery shop. Annia now has a wide assortment of stationery. She starts work very early selling notebooks, pens, paper, etc. Lately she has had good earnings, due to the school season beginning in April. With the loan, she wants to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens for her business. In the future, she wants her business to grow much bigger and wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pencils, stationery

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. prepares tea and fried eggs with bread for sale at Abura. (It is like breakfast in the evening; she prepares it for those who wish to take in light food in the evening.) At the time the picture was taken it wasn’t time for her to start working.  

Esi has junior high educational background.  She is a single parent. She is responsible for educating her child and paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more Milo (a cocoa drink), sugar, eggs, coffee and other ingredients for her food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop to sell in.

loans.use: buy more Milo, sugar, eggs, coffee and other items to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Freddy Ricardo

texts.es:
El Señor Freddy A. es casado, es técnico agrónomo y labora para la Alcaldía de Posoltega desde hace 6 años desempeñándose como responsable de Proyecto Agrícola, es originario de la Comunidad llamada el Tanque jurisdicción de Posoltega.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cinco créditos, los que cuales le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último es para siembra por riego de pipianes y chiltoma, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura, vale mencionar que en los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
El Señor Freddy A. es casado, es técnico agrónomo y labora para la Alcaldía de Posoltega desde hace 6 años desempeñándose como responsable de Proyecto Agrícola, es originario de la Comunidad llamada el Tanque jurisdicción de Posoltega. Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cinco créditos, los que cuales le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último es para siembra por riego de pipianes y chiltoma, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura, vale mencionar que en los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos de siembra por Riego ( Pipianes Y Chiltoma)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Masese Group, Jinja

texts.en:
W. John is a 25-year-old married father of two. He is a carpenter by profession and operates from Masese in Jinja.

John started his business six years ago after trying his hand unsuccessfully as a fishmonger. He started off as an apprentice carpenter at a neighborhood workshop and it is from there that he nurtured his skills and, as well, started doing carpentry on his own.

John’s determined attitude pushed him to start his own workshop and he has never looked back. Currently he earns monthly profits to the tune of 150,000 shillings, and his customers are mostly students and hotel business people. He mostly sells beds, sideboards, chairs and doors.

With this loan, John says his business will expand as he will be able to buy more timber to make chairs and sideboards.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Mercedes Maria

texts.es:
MERCEDES MARIA, TIENE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS MAYORES QUE YA SON INDEPENDIENTES. HACE 15 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA BEBES. INICIÓ  DE FORMA AMBULATORIA CON LA VENTA DE TELAS AL VER QUE ERA MUY RENTABLE, CAMBIÓ DE GIRO E INICIÓ CON LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA BEBE EN UN PUESTO QUE LOGRÓ ALQUILAR EN EL MERCADO, DONDE LE FUE MUCHO MEJOR.
CON´ESE TRABAJO HA LOGRADOI AVANZAR LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DE SU CASA.
SE HA PLANTEADO COMO META COMPRAR MÁQUINAS PARA CONFECCIONAR SU PROPIA MERCADERÍA, SIEMPRE ESPECIALIZANDOSE EN BEBES.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA PARA BEBES Y AUMENTAR SU STOCK.
 
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Mercedes Maria is 52 years old. She is married and has 2 children who are grown and independent. For the past 15 years, she has worked selling baby clothing. She began as a mobile vendor selling fabrics. Seeing a profitable opportunity, she changed her focus and began selling baby clothes in a stand which she was able to rent in the market, where she achieved much better results. With this work, she has been able to make progress with the construction of her home. She has set herself the goal of buying sewing machines in order to create her own merchandise, continuing to specialize in babies. She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying baby clothing and increasing her stock. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying baby clothing

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Reside en el barrio de Pampahuasi, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su negocio inició cuando detectó una oportunidad en su comunidad, ya que existían pocos agricultores que se dedicaran especialmente a la producción de cacao y ahora está logrando buenos resultados económicos. Para ella el factor clave es darle un valor agregado a sus productos, por el cual ofrece su producto a menor precio con respecto a la competencia. 

Generalmente se despierta antes de que el gallo cante, con eso demuestra que le gusta adelantarse ante los hechos; por lo general le gusta tomar acciones preventivas para no tener problemas en su terreno de cultivo, ya que es su fuente principal de trabajo. 
Su familia lo apoya en el sembrío y cosecha y vende su producto en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Para el futuro quiere adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para producir en grandes cantidades y poder cumplir con todos sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y de todas formas promete seguir pagando las cuotas pactadas, además confía en que llegará muy lejos con el apoyo de grupo comunal. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de que su producto sea de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 35 years old, married and has three children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the Pampahuasi neighborhood in the jungle of the Ayacucho region. She started her business when she saw an opportunity in her community, there were only a few farmers dedicated to growing cocoa, and it has paid off financially. She believes that the key factor is to provide an added value to her products, so she sells her products at a lower price than the competition. She usually wakes up before the rooster sings so that she can be ready for anything. She believes in taking preventive action to avoid any problems with her land since it is her main source of income. Her family helps her with the sowing and harvesting of the products. They then sell them at their community’s collection centers. In the future, she wants to buy more land to have larger production and meet the demand from her clients. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments agreed upon. She is confident that she will accomplish a lot with the support of the communal group. She will use this loan to provide the necessary maintenance for her cocoa plantations, aiming to produce a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cocoa plantation maintenance

loans.name: Richard Yoel

texts.es: Richard tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos, la casa es de material noble, el apoya a su menor hermana con sus estudios, con los ingresos que obtiene con su mototaxi, la cual adquirio con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, el presta el servicio de manera muy cordial y amable, solicita el credito para hacerle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, también para poder actualizar el SOAT y poder adquirir el permiso de circulación, el sueño de Richard, es brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su familia y poder tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his brothers and sisters in the home of his parents, which is of good construction. He supports his younger sister in her studies with the income that he gets from his motortaxi, which he acquired with much effort and work. He offers his service in a very polite and friendly manner. He is applying for the loan to perform maintenance on the motortaxi and also to get his insurance up to date and acquire his driver's license. Richard's dream is to offer security and well being to his family and to have a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his motortaxi

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita L. y su esposo el señor Jorge Álvarez son padres de familia y tienen tres hijos pequeños que están actual mente estudiando, pero les están exigiendo que tenga que pagar la colegiatura y comprar útiles escolares que les está haciendo falta para poder terminar el siclo escolar de este año. 
Solicitan el préstamo ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo como operaria de una fabrica, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que percibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes en el área de despachador.  
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación y el estudio necesario para su futuro.
texts.en:
Margarita L. and her husband Jorge Álvarez are the parents of 3 small children. The children are currently in school, but the school is demanding that they must pay the tuition and buy school supplies if they want to be able to finish out the current school year. They are requesting a loan, as they do not have the money needed to cover these school expenses. They intend to pay off the loan with the income that she earns from her job as an employee in a factory, since her husband will take care of the household expenses with the salary he earns working for a transportation company as a dispatcher. They want their children to have the education and studies that they will need for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school expenses

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de sus tres hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Es un hombre muy sencillo y con los pies sobre la tierra. Se dedica a la producción de ladrillos a base de arcilla desde hace 10 años, los cuales distribuye en su misma localidad (la mayor parte), pero ocasionalmente también vende a otras comunidades. Para su trabajo contrata a dos personas que le ayudan en la fabricación y a veces recibe ayuda de su familia.
La mayor parte de su vida experimentó más derrotas que triunfos, pero hoy siente que está dirigiéndose por un mejor camino, además ya tiene una visión y las estrategias para alcanzar sus metas propuestas; es por ello que en un futuro próximo anhela expandir su negocio en otras localidades para obtener mejores ganancias económicas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago. A su vez, agradece la oportunidad que le están brindando y en efecto, planea acceder a futuros préstamos para invertir en su negocio. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en materia prima para su fábrica de ladrillos, pero en grandes volúmenes, así atenderá los requerimientos de sus clientes de manera oportuna.
texts.en:
Hector, 37, lives with his partner who is the mother of his 3 school-aged children. They live in the locality of Quimbiri, located in the Cuzqueñan rainforest, where they have their own home. He is a very unassuming man who has both feet on the ground. He has been producing bricks made of clay for 10 years, which he distributes in his area (mostly), and which he also occasionally sells in other communities. He has 2 employees who help him with the production, and at times he receives help from his family. In his life he has suffered more defeats than triumphs, but today he feels that he is going down a better path. In addition, he already has a vision and strategies to reach his proposed goals. In the future he wants to expand his business to other locations in order to obtain better earnings. This is his first credit with MFP, and he is committed to fulfilling his payment obligations. At the same time, he is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided. In fact, he plans to access future loans to invest in his business. With the money requested he will invest in raw materials used in his brick factory, and he will buy in large volumes so that he can meet the needs of his customers in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to produce bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tienen su casa propia.

Para él la vida es un regalo, ya que le brinda muchas oportunidades y ahora es agricultor exitoso, a pesar de los problemas ocasionados por el terrorismo en esa zona. Él sacó fuerzas para darle buen rumbo a su familia, es por ello que ahora se dedica por entero al cultivo de cacao, con el que le está yendo muy bien y se siente contento con el trabajo que está realizando. 
Regularmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general, en temporadas de cosecha, tiene a cargo algunos peones para que le puedan agilizar la extracción de su producto.
Para el futuro anhela extender su chacra, con el propósito de que produzca en grandes volúmenes y mejor calidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece la confianza que le está otorgando su grupo comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento continuo de sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad  de su producto agrícola.
texts.en:
Hernan is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho, located in the town of Palmapampa, where they have their own home. To him, life is a gift, as it has offered him many opportunities. He is now a successful farmer, despite the problems caused by terrorism in the area. He finds strength in providing for his family, which is why he is now devoted entirely to the cultivation of cocoa. The cocoa is is selling very well and he is happy with the results. He regularly gets help from his family, although during the harvest seasons, he usually hires some men so they can expedite the process. In the future, he hopes to expand his farm, with the aim of producing better quality and larger volumes. This is his first loan with MFP and he is committed to fully comply with the payments. He appreciates the trust granted to him and the communal group. The money requested will be used for the ongoing maintenance of the cocoa plantations, in order to improve the quality of the product.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of the plantations

loans.name: Cherifatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Gbodjome qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé.il  y a 15 ans elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques, ce commerce lui réussit bien et la plupart des femmes de son quartier viennent acheter chez elle. Voulant augmenter son stock pour mieux satisfaire ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Cherifatou A. is married and the mother of two children. She lives in the neighborhood of Gbodjome, a suburban area of the city of Lomé. Fifteen years ago she started a cosmetics business. She is very successful and most of the women in her neighborhood buy in her store. Since Cherifatou wanted to increase her inventory to better satisfy her customers, she came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy various cosmetics.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Pay Quick Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Pay Quick II” group from the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. In this way, they can make more sales, better profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Adama K. who pictured in the middle receiving the loan from loan officer Zainab Bangura. Born in Makeni, the thirty-three-year-old is married and has two children – one in primary school and the other in secondary school. For five years now, Adama has been selling clothes for babies. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the more baby clothes to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more baby clothes to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos mayores. Reside en la localidad de San francisco, ubicada en la exótica selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su casa propia.

Doña Josefina se caracteriza por ser atrevida en la vida, ya que siempre le gustó asumir riesgos a la hora de abrir un negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café, pero no producía lo suficiente por falta de capital, por ese motivo implementó una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinda buenas ganancias económicas y emocionales. 
En ocasiones la ayuda su esposo, pero por lo general trabaja sola, su esposo tiene un carro con el que realiza servicio de taxi. En el futuro, piensa ampliar su negocio de abarrotes con la finalidad de atraer más clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece la facilidad de crédito que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, con el propósito de aumentar su rentabilidad con el pasar de los meses.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old, married and has five grown children. She lives in her own house, which is located in the town of San Francisco in the exotic Peruvian tropical jungle. Doña Josefina is known for being bold in life. She has always taken risks when starting businesses. She used to grow cocoa and coffee, but she didn’t produce enough due to lack of capital. She then started a grocery store, which brings her good financial and emotional gains. Her husband sometimes helps her at the store, but she usually works by herself. Her husband works driving a taxi. In the future, she wants to expand her store in order to attract more clients. This is the first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments. She is thankful for the opportunity provided. With this loan, she is going to buy more products to increase her grocery store’s inventory and hopes to improve her earnings in a few months.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tiene su casa propia.

A base de un esfuerzo constante y a pesar de varios obstáculos que se cruzaron en el camino, él siguió con su propósito de tener su propio rubro agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de cacao y café. Por lo que general trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo algunos peones que le facilitan el trabajo. 
Normalmente labora desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad y su precios varían de acuerdo a la cantidad que entrega a sus compradores. No contento con ello, en el futuro quiere abrir una tienda agropecuaria, ya que casi todos sus clientes son agricultores y necesitan de insumos como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc.; para sus respectivos terrenos de cultivo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pago, además felicita a su banco comunal por el buen grupo responsable que se formó. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento de su terreno de cultivo, con la finalidad de que no aparezca algún daño en sus plantaciones cacao.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old. He has a domestic partner and three children. He lives in his own house, which is located in the Peruvian jungle in the Palmapampa community. With vigorous effort and in spite of many obstacles that crossed his path, he focused on his goal to have his own farm dedicated to the production of cocoa and coffee. He usually works by himself, but during the harvest he hires some workers to help him with the work. His regular working hours are from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. He sells his products at the community’s collection centers and his prices vary according to the quantity he sells. This situation is not satisfactory for him, so he wants to open a store for farming products. Most of his clients are farmers in needs of products such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for their farmland. This is his first loan with MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time. He congratulates his communal bank for forming such a responsible group. He will use this loan to maintain his farmland hoping to prevent any damage to his cocoa plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cocoa plantation maintenance

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh T. T. is 35 years old. She has two young children. She has a 1.700 sqm paddy in which she grows rice to support her family as far as their food goes. She also raises 3000 chicks for eggs and 8 pigs. The products from her livestock raising are sold retail in the local market. She makes 100.000 Vietnam dong per day. Her husband helps her a lot with her livestock. She has participated in SEDA's microfinancing program since 2003 and repaid punctually. She is the group leader of 6-member group loan through SEDA. In this cycle,  she wants to get 6.322.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock and buy a rice-husking machine.

 About the other members in her group:

 Quy T. Q.  is 27 years old. She has two young children.  She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast . She can earn 50.000 Vietnam dong profit per day from this activity. Additionally, she raises 8 pigs for meat. Her husband is a carpenter  with an income of 3.000.000  Vietnam dong per month.  But their total income is not enough for all expenditures.  Their living standard is not good. She wants to get 5.886.000 VND to buy some furniture  to improve her restaurant.

 Huong T. N. is 45 years old. She wants to get 7.194.000 VND  to expand her livestock business such as improving the pigpen and buying feed. She will rebuild her house next year.

Trung T. N. is a 36-year-old businesswoman. She has  one son and one daughter.  They are  in secondary school. She has a shop that sells  fresh shrimp  and fish  for wedding parties.  She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to  buy more seafood products to meet the demand of her customers.

Phuong T. H. was born in 1966. She has two children who  study pharmacy at the university and attend high school. Every day, she runs a small restaurant  for breakfast.  She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to pay school fees, with a part invested in her shop.

Lam Q. T. is a  40-year-old businessman. He has a small wood workshop to make tables, armchairs etc. in the traditional style so he always is busy with  many new orders from clients. Now he needs to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy a new cutting machine to improve productivity to try to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock and buy a rice husking machinne

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja y fruto de su unión tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Vive en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su casa propia.

Para ella no existe lo imposible, es por ello que su deseo de ampliar su tienda de abarrotes es un objetivo próximo. Para ello, se ha propuesto trabajar de manera constante, por lo que sus ventas están mejorando con el pasar de los meses. Por estas satisfacciones agradece a su padre, por lo buenos consejos que lo dio cuando empezó a independizarse. 
Sus horas de trabajo se incrementaron con respecto al año anterior, trabaja desde las 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM; por lo general atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja y de sus hijos (en tiempo de vacaciones).

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tal motivo agradece el respaldo que le están brindando, además confía en que ser parte de un banco comunal le será muy beneficioso. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mariza is 29 years old and lives with her partner and their two young children. They live in Palmapampa, which is in the Peruvian jungle, and they have their own home. For Mariza nothing is impossible. Her next goal is to make an addition on her grocery store. In order to reach this goal she is working constantly. This has helped her increase her sales over the course of several months. She thanks her father for her success because he gave her good advice when she left home and became independent. She has extended her business hours over the last year and is now open from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM. She generally works alone, but sometimes she gets help from her husband or from her kids when they are on vacation from school. This is her first loan with MFP and she is thankful for the support they have offered. She believes that being part of the community bank will be very positive fore her. She will use the loan money to stock up her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores. Vive en la selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tienen su propia casa.

Desde su niñez acompañaba a sus padres con la finalidad de brindarles ayuda, pero a la vez aprendía las técnicas de sembrío y cosecha; sin embargo, al crecer se inclinó por la venta de carne de res y no se arrepiente de ello. Usualmente se levanta a las 2:00 AM para llevar el ganado al camal, hacer la distribución de la carne y también llevarla a su propia carnicería.
Generalmente atiende desde las 4:00 AM hasta las 3:00 PM, actividad que le brinda buenos resultados, además ya tiene clientes ganados debido a su actitud cariñosa y alegre.
Para el futuro, planea adquirir varias cabezas de ganado con la finalidad de criarlos ella misma e incrementar sus ingresos, pues por el momento compra los animales para la de la carne.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, en efecto, se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos durante las fechas pactadas; además agradece a su grupo comunal por la confianza que le brindan. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos animales para vender la carne a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maura is 55 years old. She is married and has four older children. She lives in the ayacuchana jungle in the Palmapampa area where she owns her own house. Since her childhood, she accompanied her parents in order to provide them with help and learned the skills of sowing and harvest. Nevertheless, when she grew up, she turned towards selling beef and has not regretted it. Usually, she gets up at 2AM to take the cattle to the slaughterhouse, distribute the meat and also take it to her own meat shop. Generally, she tends the shop from 4AM until 3PM, an activity that provides good results. Additionally, she already has won customers with her caring and happy attitude. In the future, she plans to acquire various heads of cattle with the goal of raising them herself and increasing her income. But for now, she will buy the animals for the meat. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to complete her respective payments faithfully on the promised dates. In addition, she is thankful to her community group for the trust they instill in her. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy some animals to sell the meat at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals for meat sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que es por medio de los financiamientos que ha progresado. Samuel tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio a este negocio porque no tenía un trabajo que le proporcionara un salario diario, esto lo motivo a establecer lo que actualmente tiene. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, gaseosas y granos básicos. El desea obtener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Samuel has worked with the Foundation for a long time, and it is by way of financing that he has made progress. Samuel has 2 children and they are both studying. He has a local store. He has had this business for more than 5 years. He says he started this business because he did not have a job that provided him with a daily salary and this caused him to set up what he currently has. He is requesting this financing for working capital to buy candy, fruit drinks, bread, soda and basic grains. He wants to have better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tiene su casa propia.

Apenas terminó la escuela primaria debido a que su familia no tenía recursos económicos y por le problema de inestabilidad debido al terrorismo en su zona. Años después logró establecerse con tranquilidad en su comunidad, se casó y tuvo hijos; pero pasó mucha necesidad y falta de dinero antes de lograr implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 
Ahora se siente contenta por lo que viene realizando, pues la experiencia vivida le enseñó a visualizar las oportunidades frente a los problemas. Establecida en su negocio, anhela ampliar su tienda de abarrotes obteniendo nuevos productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para vender al por mayor y menor. 
Su tienda está en su propia localidad y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes son la razón de seguir esforzándose con el pasar del tiempo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas; además agradece a su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen cada uno de sus socios. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 31 years old, a single mother and has three children. She resides in the beautiful Ayacuchana forest, located in the Palmapampa locality, where she has her own home. She barely finished primary school due to her family's economic resources and the instability caused by terrorism in her area. Years later, she was able to establish herself in her community. She got married and had children, but she went through many years of turmoil and challenges before she successfully opened her grocery store. Nowadays, she is happy with what she has accomplished. Her experience taught her to visualize the opportunities when confronted with problems. Well-established in her business, she hopes to expand her shop by obtaining new products but in larger bulks, in order to sell more at a cheaper price. Her store is located in the same locality where she lives and on occasion she receives help from her children, whom are the reason for why she continues to work hard. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the opportunity that the bank gives her and she promises to pay back the determined loan payments. In addition, she is grateful for the responsibilities that the communal bank gives to each one of its members. She plans to invest the money that she is applying for on purchasing basic products to stock her store with.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
Nicida tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente vive en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa propia.

Se caracteriza por ser una persona innovadora, a pesar de que sus allegados se oponían a que realice su proyecto porque ya había varias tiendas del mismo rubro. Pero aun así decidió incursionar en la venta de abarrotes, incorporando nuevos productos que su competencia no ofrecía. Nicida sabe muy bien que el financiamiento es el primer desafío para iniciar cualquier negocio, por lo cual lo tomó con mucha responsabilidad y seriedad para que su nuevo proyecto se convierta en realidad. También tiene experiencia en agricultura, ya que desde su adolescencia ayudaba a sus padres, pero desde que tuvo su primer hijo decidió independizarse, aunque sus padres la siguen apoyando en su negocio.
Por lo general atiende desde las 6:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM y a pesar de que su negocio tiene pocos años de funcionamiento, está obteniendo buenos resultados de manera paulatina.

Este es su primer ciclo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos en las fechas determinadas.  Asimismo, tiene confianza en su banco comunal por la seriedad con la que todos trabajan. El dinero solicitado le servirá para comprar más mercadería y surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Nicida is 20 years old, single, and has two children. Currently, she lives in the Palmapampa locality, located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, where she has her own home. She is known for being an innovative person. Despite being advised by her close family and friends to not sell grocery items because there already existed shops that did, she decided to anyways, incorporating new products that her competitors didn't have. Nicida knows very well that financing is the first challenge to starting any new business. As such, she took on this new project with a lot of responsibility and seriousness in order to make it a reality. She also has experience in agriculture, having helped her parents since she was an adolescent, However, after having her first child, she decided to become independent, even though her parents continue to support her and her business. In general, she works from 6 am to 9 pm and even though her business has only existed for a few years, it is slowly obtaining very positive results. This is her first cycle with MFP and as such, she promises to continue paying her determined payments within the deadline. She also has a lot of faith in her communal bank by the seriousness with which everyone works. She plans to use the money that she has applied for to purchase merchandise with which to stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Petrona Otilia

texts.es:
Doña Petrona G. es madre soltera y con 4 hijos bajo su cargo, tres son mujeres y un varón los cuales están en edad escolar, el hijo que tiene la edad de 23 años tiene el oficio de contador pero aun no esta laborando y la mayor de todas esta en Costa Rica. Doña Petrona  trabaja como domestica y aparte de su salario recibe remesa familiar cada quince días de parte de su hija la que esta en Costa Rica.

Con nuestra institución es primer crédito que se le otorga, el cual le han servido para realizar mejoramiento en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona G. es madre soltera y con 4 hijos bajo su cargo, tres son mujeres y un varón los cuales están en edad escolar, el hijo que tiene la edad de 23 años tiene el oficio de contador pero aun no esta laborando y la mayor de todas esta en Costa Rica. Doña Petrona trabaja como domestica y aparte de su salario recibe remesa familiar cada quince días de parte de su hija la que esta en Costa Rica. Con nuestra institución es primer crédito que se le otorga, el cual le han servido para realizar mejoramiento en su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Cemento, Cerámica, Puerta, Ventanas)

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Reside en el barrio de Pampahuasi, ubicado en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Siempre le ha gustado diferenciarse de su competencia en cuanto a precio, calidad y buen servicio, por ello tiene 25 años dedicada al cultivo de cacao y café.
Pero no se queda contenta con lo que ha logrado, pues aspira extender sus plantaciones a otras zonas, donde pueda vender su producto desde la misma chacra y minimizar el gasto de traslado.
Cada día se despierta con las mis ganas de siempre y conjuntamente con su esposo se dirigen a sus tierras para el cuidado respectivo de sus cultivos. Por lo general trabajan 12 horas y sólo descansan los fines de semana para dedicarse de lleno a sus hijos, quienes están en etapa escolar, pero en tiempo de vacaciones les brinda su ayuda en el campo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos en fechas oportunas, además agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia y veracidad con que se desarrolla. Con el dinero que solicita le dará mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo, con la finalidad de mejorar su cosecha en los futuros meses.
texts.en:
Odilia is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Pampahuasi, located on the fringes of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house.

She has always liked to differentiate herself from her competition through her price, quality and good service. She has dedicated 25 years to the cultivation of cacao and coffee. However, she isn’t content with what she has achieved, because she aspires to extend her plantations to other zones where she can sell her product from the same farm and minimize transportation expenses. Each day she wakes up with the same will as always, and together with her husband, they manage the lands and the respective care for the crops. In general, they work 12 hours and only rest on weekends to fully dedicate themselves to their children who are school-aged. During vacation time, they help them in the fields.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she promises to be on time with her respective payments. In addition, she is thankful for her communal bank for the transparency and honesty with which it is developed. With the money requested, she will provide maintenance to her cultivation lands with the objective of improving her harvest in the future months.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tienes 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su único objetivo es “salir adelante”, de niña estaba en la chacra de sus padres y los ayudaba en las tareas y de jovencita vendía los productos que cosechaban, ganando sus primeras propinas.
Hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, específicamente en la producción de cacao, por el cual agradece profundamente a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que lo dieron. 
Pero Victoria aspira a más y no es codicia, sino que le encanta trabajar. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, y una vez terminados sus quehaceres se va a su chacra conjuntamente con su esposo desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, casi todos los días de la semana, solo ocasionalmente los domingos deja de laborar. 
Su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad y obtiene buenas ganancias con las que logra cubrir sus gastos familiares. 
Para el futuro quiere ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de producir en grandes cantidades y venderlos a precio de mercado.

Este es el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago; además agradece a su banco comunal por la buena acertada dirección de sus compañeros. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el manteamiento de su terreno de cultivo, para preveer riesgos de contaminación de su producto.
texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of Palmapampa, located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho, where they have their own house.

Her only objective is “to get ahead”. As a child, she was on her parents’ farm and she used to help them with the chores. As a young girl, she used to sell the products that they harvested, earning her own tips. Today she has her own cultivation land, specifically for the production of cacao, for which she is deeply grateful for her parents for the support and teachings that they gave to her.

However, Victoria aspires for more and she is not greedy. Rather, she loves to work. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast and once her chores are finished, she goes to her land together with her husband from 7:00am to 6:00pm almost every day of the week. Only occasionally does she not work on Sundays. She sells her products in the stock centers of her community and obtains good earnings with which she is able to cover her household expenses. In the future, she wants to expand her cultivation land with the objective of producing in greater quantities and selling them at market price.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time. In addition, she is grateful for the good leadership of her fellow partners. With the money requested, she will invest in the maintenance of her farmland to prevent risks of contamination of her product.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her crops

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Reside en la majestuosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad  de Palmapampa, donde tiene su casa propia.

Para Vidal, el trabajo que realiza lo rejuvenece, tiene mucha energía y con ella trabaja en su carpintería, pues a pesar que le faltan algunas cosas se las ingenia de manera creativa y eficaz para cumplir con sus compromisos. Lleva 20 años laborando de manera constante y nota que sus ventas vienen mejorando con respecto a los meses anteriores. 
Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar estratégico de su comunidad, trabaja solo, pero cuando le hacen grandes pedidos contrata a personas que le puedan facilitar la fabricación de muebles en tiempo record.
Para el futuro planea adquirir máquinas para su carpintería con el propósito de cumplir con sus compromisos de entrega y producir muebles variados, según los gustos y preferencias de cada cliente.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual confía en cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, durante las fechas pactadas. A su vez, toma en cuenta a la transparencia y buen trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará madera de quinacho, tornillo y caoba para la producción de más muebles.
texts.en:
Vidal is 46 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in the majestic jungle of Ayacucho, located in the town of Palmapampa, where she has his own house.

For Vidal, the work that he does rejuvenates him. He has a lot of energy and with that, he works in his carpentry. Although he lacks some things, he figures out how to complete his work in a creative and efficient manner. He has been working constantly for 20 years and notices that his sales are improving with respect to the previous months.

His business is located in a strategic place in his community. He works alone, but when he has big projects, he hires people that can facilitate the manufacture of furniture in record time.

For the future, he plans to acquire machines for his carpentry with the objective of completing his work and producing various pieces of furniture according to the likes and preferences of each customer.

This is his first loan with MFP, for which he is confident in making his loan repayments on the established dates. At the same time, he takes into account the transparency and good work of his communal bank. With the money requested, he will purchase quinacho, tornillo, and mahogany wood for the manufacture of more pieces of furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años,  es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, y juntos viven con su mama en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 15 años que tiene una tienda en su casa, en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, paralelamente a ello, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, en donde realiza un proceso de selección, para luego prepararlos listos limpios para su consumo. Esta última actividad le es muy rentable, más que la venta de productos, puesto que la carne de cuyes tiene alto valor nutritivo y por ello tiene mucha demanda de su consumo. En adelante espera intensificar la crianza de este animal y para ello desea tener más galpones y un espacio amplio en donde pueda instalar su granja. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la construcción de sus galpones como madera, rejillas de metal, asimismo desea comprar más cuyes reproductores para incrementar la producción de este animal.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and has 2 children who live with their mother in her own house. For 15 years now she has had a store in her house, selling products of primary necessity. In addition, she raises guinea pigs, carrying out a process of selection, then preparing them for consumption. This latter activity is very profitable, more so than the sale of products, since guinea pig meat has high nutritive value and for this reason, is in great demand. In the future, she hopes to raise many more of these animals and for this, she will need more cages and an ample space to expand her facilities. This is Rosa's 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. Moreover, she thinks the loan will be very useful in advancing her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase materials for the construction of cages, including wood and metal grating. In addition, she wants to buy more reproducing guinea pigs in order to increase the production of this animal.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING REPRODUCING GUINEA PIGS AND MATERIALS TO CONSTRUCT CAGES

loans.name: Juana Brigida

texts.es: Juana Brígida es una buena cliente de Fundación y lo ha demostrado pagando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad es una pulpería. Ella tiene más 11 años de tener su negocio. Sus inicios se dan con muy pocos productos, pero así fue que dio inicio con las pocas ganancias que obtenía logro comenzar con su negocio y así decide establecer la pulpería en donde ofrece productos de uso frecuente. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, jugos y gaseosas. El deseo de Juana es incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juana Brigida is a good client of Fundación and she has demonstrated this by making her payments on schedule. She is a married woman with 2 children in her care. Her activity is her general store. For 11 years she has operated her business. Initially, it had very few products and she began with very little earnings. Then, Juana decided to open a general store, selling products frequently used. Juana requests this loan to buy merchandise such as treats, bread, natural drinks, juices, and soft drinks. Her desire is to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Aracelis

texts.es: Aracelis María R. O. tiene 42 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en La Paz, un  barrio muy comercial en el poniente de la ciudad y un sector que le gusta a Aracelis, porque como dice ella  “la gente está pendiente de uno y nos ayudamos mutuamente”.  Ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante los últimos 3 años con créditos individuales, aunque en su  inicio, hace 10 años, lo hizo en un grupo. Ella hace de todo un poco: tiene un negocio familiar en el que compra pescado en la costa del Caribe para  luego de venderlo en Maicao, ciudad fronteriza con Venezuela,  y en esta última compra mercancías, como ranchos y víveres  para cuando regrese a Barranquilla y venderla a sus clientes; como Aracelis nunca está quieta, trabaja desde hace 15 años vendiendo chance y  hace 6 años añadió mercancías que vendía mediante guías promocionales, este fue su negocio inicial.  Hoy Aracelis pasa  3 horas en las mañanas trabajando en una heladería cerca de su casa donde elabora deliciosas paletas y después se dedica a la venta de chance y a  su negocio actual, que es la  venta de ranchos y víveres y quiere agregar a su vida una nueva actividad y es el servicio de lavadora a domicilio, porque sueña con incrementar sus ingresos para  que cuando su hija pequeña  sea grande   “no le toque tan duro como le tocó a ella”. Ahora está aplicando a  un crédito para comprar esa lavadora y ofrecer el servicio de alquiler y poder iniciar el camino a cumplir su sueño , aprovechando la infraestructura de clientes de  la miscelánea de su hermana que aparece en la fotografía y el conocimiento de su hermano en el arreglo y mantenimiento preventivo de lavadoras.
texts.en:
Aracelis María R. O. is 42 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla in La Paz. It is a commercial area in the west part of the city, it is an area that Aracelis likes because, as she says - people are aware of each other and help each other. She has been connected with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for 3 years with personal loans, and originally, ten years ago, she was part of a group. She does a little of everything, has a family business where she buys fish on the Caribbean coast and later sells it in Maicao, a city on the border of Venezuela, and there she buys merchandise such as food and general supplies to sell to her customers when she returns to Barranquilla. Since Aracelis never stays still, she has been selling chances for 15 years and 6 years ago she added merchandise that she sold through promotional guides, these were her original businesses. Currently Aracelis spends three hours in the mornings working at an ice cream shop near her home where she makes delicious popsicles, and later she works selling chances and her current business of food and general supplies. She wants to add a new activity, which is providing washing services. She wants to increase her income for her daughter when she becomes bigger. She does not want her to have it as hard as her own life has been. She is currently requesting a loan to be able to buy the washing machine and be able to offer the rental service and get on the road to accomplishing her dreams. She will take advantage the customer base from her sister's store (she appears in the photo) and the knowledge that her brother has in the repair and preventative maintenance of washers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a washer and provide rental services.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Monsefú, ciudad conocida por sus festividades religiosas y turísticas, se encuentra ubicada a viente minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a trabajar como chofer de una unidad vehícular (combi) que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros cubriendo la ruta Monsefú – Chiclayo y viceversa. El realiza su labor todos los dias y los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar a su familia y solventar sus gastos personales. El trata de realizar su trabajo con la mayor responsabilidad ya que sabe que hay muchas vidas que dependen de el .

El continuo uso que se le otorga han hecho que la unidad vehicular empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo Victor se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Victor es un joven trabajador y que siempre trata de ayudar con el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y concidos le consideran una personas tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents in the district Monsefú. A city known for its religious festivals and tourism, it is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Over the past three years he has worked as a driver of a bus-van that provides passenger service covering the roundtrip Monsefú - Chiclayo route. He works every day and his income is used to support the family and meet his personal expenses. He treats his job with great respect because he knows that there are many lives depending on him. The continued use and wear of the bus-van requires some urgent repairs in order for it to continue to function properly. For this reason, Victor has applied for a first time loan from “Edpyme Alturnativa” for 1000 PEN soles which he plans to use for the repair and maintenance of the bus-van. Victor is a young worker and always tries to improve the welfare of his family. His greatest desire is to offer them a better quality of life. In his neighborhood, all of his neighbors and friends consider him to be a calm and reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Comidas Rápidas Pica Rica es el negocio que escogió Victoria Mejía González desde hace 12 años para tener más tiempo disponible con su familia. Ella estudió repostería y pastelería cuando se retiró de una empresa en el 2001 siendo operaria  y se inclinó por la elaboración de deditos, pastelitos, empanaditas y comidas para fiestas y banquetes como su emprendimiento y esto es lo que ahora prepara en su negocio ubicado, en el barrio Los Ángeles de Soledad, donde vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 23 a 28 años, ya convertidos en profesionales con los esfuerzos y persistencia de todos en el hogar.
Este es su crédito # 12 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, solicita un monto por valor de $ 2.000.000, el cual completará con su ahorro que realizó desde el 2009, para comprar su  batidora industrial y una moto como medio de transporte para sus repartos. Victoria dice que desde que ingresó a esta organización, su negocio ha cambiado debido a que con las nuevas inversiones  de los créditos, logró elaborar productos diversificados y adaptados a los requerimientos del mercado e impactarlo positivamente, por eso  ha conseguido nuevos  contactos  y con ello la ampliación de su negocio y el aumento de sus pedidos. Su meta ahora es formalizarlo y continuar expandiéndolo  porque  este es justamente su gran desafío.
Victoria es una mujer muy conocida en su barrio y aprovecha para su negocio el ambiente en que se desenvuelve la comunidad donde habita, que tiene como patrón de sus festividades a San pancracio y esto genera muchas festividades vecinales  como bingos, corridas, procesión y con ello  una multitud  de potenciales clientes.
texts.en:
Pica Rica fast foods is the business that Victoria M. G. chose 12 years ago in order to have more free time to spend with her family. She studied pastry and confectionery when she retired from a company in 2001 where she was a worker. She made pastries, cakes, small meat pies and catering for parties and banquets. That is her background and it's also what she does today in her store in the Los Angeles de Soledad neighbourhood, where she lives with her spouse. They have 3 children between the ages of 23 and 28. They are all professionals now, thanks to the efforts and persistence of everyone in the household. This will be her 12th loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and she is requesting $2.000.000. She will add it to the money she has been saving since 2009, and buy an industrial mixer and a motorcycle to use for her deliveries. Victoria says that since she invested in this organization, her business has changed due to the fact that with the injection of the new funds, she has been able to make a more diverse range of products, adapt them to the demands of the market, and positively impact it. In so doing she has made new contacts, which has grown her business and increased her orders. Her goal now is to formalize the business and continue to expand it because that is a great challenge. Victoria is a very well known woman in her neighbourhood and she benefits from the environment of her community, whose festivities' patron saint is St. Pancracio. This generates many local festivities such as bingos, races, and parades, and with them a multitude of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial mixer and a motorcycle for deliveries

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen C. está agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio. 
Está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, ya que pudo ampliar un poco más el negocio y quiere ponerle más variedad de producto a su negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo se encarga de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Del Carmen C. is very thankful for your assistance with her previous loan, which helped her improve her business. She is once again asking for a loan in order to invest in this business. The business still lacks variety in merchandise, as she was able to grow the business and now wants to offer a better variety of products for her business. She plans to pay back her loan with the earnings that she gets from her business, as her husband meets the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the variety of merchandise in Maria's store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa  propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de cuyes, cuya granja esta instalada en el patio de su casa. Esta crianza le es muy rentable ya que no realiza mucho el gasto de inversión, puesto que cuenta con campos de alfalfa que le sirve de forraje para sus animales, siendo ella misma quien la cultiva y corta para alimentarlas. De esta manera vive y se da tiempo para atender a sus hijos. Cada 15 días comercializa sus cuyes en gran cantidad, por lo que mucho de sus clientes son  comerciantes. Por otra parte su necesidad es obtener cuyes machos que sean reproductores para aumentar su producción. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, ella es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de un terreno que esta al costado de su casa para que  pueda instalar una granja de cuyes más grande, por lo que podrá pagar una parte del costo total y el resto lo pagará con sus mismos fondos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in her own house. For more than the past 10 years, she has worked raising guinea pigs. The pen is installed in the patio of her house. This is very profitable already as it does not require much capital expenditures as she has alfalfa fields that serve as fodder for the animals that she herself cares for and harvests alfalfa to feed them. In this way she lives and has time to care for her children. Each 15 days she sells her guinea pigs in large numbers, as many of her clients are commercial. For the future, she needs to get male guinea pigs to be stud animals in order to increase her production. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her repayments, and also considers that this contribution will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of land next to her house so that she can install a larger guinea pig farm, by which she will be able to repay a part of the total cost, and the rest she will pay with her own funds.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land to raise more guinea pigs

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna A. is married to a taxi driver and lives with her four children. She has no educational background.  Hanna sells fresh cassava at Abura. Hanna uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Hanna will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs such as groundnuts, okra, plantains and others for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Hanna plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs such as groundnut, etc. for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. smokes fish as well as frying fish for sale at Abura.  Ekua has not received any form of education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ekua has been selling both fried fish and smoked fish for some time now. She helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to fry and to smoke for sale. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to fry and to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school.  Mary sells varieties of biscuits and sweets at Abura. Her husband is a mason.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more biscuits and sweets for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a better shop for her business.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more biscuits and sweets for sale

loans.name: Lucia De Socorro

texts.es:
Cuando muchas personas del barrio La Paz de la ciudad de Barranquilla se casan, remodelan su hogar o tiene otra necesidad, es común que busquen a Lucía C. S. para encargarla de conseguir un vestido de bodas, un juego de cuarto u otro artículo de segunda mano. Lucía tiene más de 25 años negociando y desde un inicio comprando y vendiendo ropa y zapatos, ahora consigue tanto  motos y carros, como muebles. A pesar de sus años de negocio, no ha tenido un local donde vender su mercancía y es esto lo que quiere hacer con el crédito que ahora solicita: planifica hacer una remodelación enfrente de su casa para tener donde vender sus artículos.
Lucía comenzó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace alrededor de 25 años cuando reunió un grupo de mujeres del barrio y montó entonces una confección con su prima, antes de dedicarse por completo a la compra y venta de mercancía. Gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha podido construir su casa y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, que ahora tienen entre 26 y 30 años; y esto lo ha tenido que hacer sola, ya que es madre cabeza de familia. Su sueño mayor es dejar un negocio a cada uno de sus hijos para que no dependan de ella y con este fin, dos de ellos están estudiando en el SENA.
texts.en:
When many people in the neighborhood of La Paz in Barranquilla get married, remodel their home or have another need, it is common for them to look for Lucía C. S. in order to ask her to make a wedding dress, a bedroom set, or another second hand article. Lucía has spent more than 25 years working, from the beginning buying and selling clothing and shoes. Now she also has motorcycles, cars, and furniture. Despite her many years in business, she has not had a location to sell her wares, and this is why she wants to do with the loan she is asking for: She plans to remodel in front of her house in order to have a place to sell her merchandise. Lucía began with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo about 25 years ago when she met with a group of women from the neighborhood and began dressmaking with her cousin, before she dedicated herself totally to selling and buying merchandise. Thanks to the help of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she has been able to build a house and improve the lives of her three children, who are currently between 26 and 30 years of age. She has had to do this alone, as she is the female head of the family. Her greatest dream is to leave a business to each of her children so that they might not depend on her, and with this goal two of them are studying in SENA (a Colombian vocational college).

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of Lucia's Business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona G. es viuda, y con 12 hijos de los cuales 7 son mujeres y 5 son varones, bajo su cargo solo un hijo tiene y los demás están casados, 4 de ellos se encuentran residiendo en los estados unidos desde hace más de 15 años y de los cuales doña Petrona recibe remesa familiar cada mes.
Doña Petrona se dedica al comercio desde hace 36 años negocio que lo heredo de su mamá y el que ha mantenido hasta la fecha, actualmente tiene la pulpería en su casa de habitación pero su negocio lo inicio en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.
Cabe mencionar que doña Petrona ha sido muy responsable con  los 10 créditos que se le han otorgado ya que han sido para invertir aun más en su pulpería
texts.en:
La señora Petrona G. es viuda, y con 12 hijos de los cuales 7 son mujeres y 5 son varones, bajo su cargo solo un hijo tiene y los demás están casados, 4 de ellos se encuentran residiendo en los estados unidos desde hace más de 15 años y de los cuales doña Petrona recibe remesa familiar cada mes. Doña Petrona se dedica al comercio desde hace 36 años negocio que lo heredo de su mamá y el que ha mantenido hasta la fecha, actualmente tiene la pulpería en su casa de habitación pero su negocio lo inicio en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Cabe mencionar que doña Petrona ha sido muy responsable con los 10 créditos que se le han otorgado ya que han sido para invertir aun más en su pulpería

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de aceite, Arroz, Azúcar, Jabón, Gaseosas, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has received junior high education.  Ama prepares 'Fante kenkey' (boiled maize dough) and distributes it to her customers for sale at Abura. She has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for some time now. Ama uses her income she acquires from the sale of her 'kenkey' to help her husband in taking care of the family.  

Ama will use the new loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare her 'kenkey' to distribute to her increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to establish a 'kenkey' factory.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to use to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: John Francisco

texts.es:
John Francisco P. C. tiene 46 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos entre los 8 y 10 años de edad. En la vía Polonuevo, municipio de Santo Tomás de  gente amable, hospitalaria, jovial y sobre todo buenos anfitriones; John tiene su negocio de comprar, criar y vender cerdos y cabríos; él está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo por valor de $2.000.000 para invertirlo en cerdos jóvenes y alimentos para ellos, como purina, maíz y soya.
Antes John compraba cerdo en pie y cabríos por libras para poner su carne en vitrinas, pero poco a poco se dedicó a comprar para engorde, reproducción, selección y venta, proceso que ahora realiza en sus porquerizas. 
El sueña con tener un gran capital para comprar animales para el engorde y la posterior matanza, otro de sus sueños es tener adecuadas en un 100% las instalaciones de la porqueriza. Para John en el verano se presenta su mayor desafío, pues los cultivos como la yuca, maíz y el millo no prosperan y son la materia prima para el engorde de los animales, igualmente se pierden los pastos y se disminuye en un 70% la producción de este alimento, entonces John lo tiene que comprar de contado y más costosos para conservar en un estándar de calidad sus cabrios especialmente, de todas maneras siempre vive muy contento y disfruta de esta finca que está muy cercana a Santo Tomás, municipio famoso por el turismo de feligreses en su Semana Santa.
texts.en:
John Francisco P. C. is 46 and lives with his wife and 3 children, ages 8-10 on Via Polonuevo, town of Santa Tomás. There people are friendly, hospitable, happy and especially welcoming. John has a business of buying, raising and selling pigs and goats. He is using his first loan with the Santo Domingo Foundation of $2,000 to buy young pigs and food for them, such as purina, corn and soy. In the past John bought whole hogs and goats by the pound to sell the meat, but little by little he started buying the animals to fatten, breed, select and sell-which is what he now does on his pig farm. His big dream is to have the capital to buy animals to fatten and then slaughter. Another one of this dreams is to have aqueducts in 100% of his pens. For John summer gives him his biggest challenges for his crops of yucca, corn and millet don't do well, and these are the main foods needed to fatten the animals. He also loses the grass and his production drops 70% of the feed. Then John has to pay cash and it's more expensive to keep up the quality, especially of his goats. However, he always lives happily and enjoys his farm which is very close to Santo Tomás, a town famous for its religious tourists during Holy Week.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery A. processes palm oil and palm kernel oil for distribution at Abura.  Mery has no educational background.  She is divorced. She is responsible for her own upkeep. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to prepare her palm oil to be able to distribute it to her customers. She wishes to use the new earnings from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to use to make palm oil

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con tres integrantes quienes estuvieron en otro grupo, las mismas decidieron formar un nuevo grupo a causa de que ellas vivían muy lejos del lugar de reunión del comité al cual pertenecían, de esa forma se inicio el comité María Auxiliadora del María Auxiliadora - Isla Valle de la ciudad de Luque.
