 Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 22 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Higinia Céspedes es costurera, se dedica desde muy joven a esta actividad, ella confecciona ropas de todo tipo como trajes para damas, pantalones, uniformes, vestidos para novias y otros.
Ella solicita el préstamos para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
This group was formed by three members who were in another group but decided to form a new one because they lived far away from the other group's meeting place. Thus began the María Auxiliadora group of María Auxiliadora - Isla Valle in the city of Luque.

Now the group is in the third cycle of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya's program. It is made up of 22 members who all invest in different activities.

Higinia Céspedes is a seamstress. She has been a seamstress since she was very young. She makes clothes of all types, for example suits for women, pants, uniforms, wedding gowns, etc.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials like fabrics and thread to use in making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of many types of fabrics, buttons, linings, and clasps

loans.name: Jhon Silver

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JHON ES UN JOVEN SOLTERO, DEDICADO AL AMBITO DE LA PINTURA DESDE  SU NIÑEZ, YA QUE SU PAPA SE DEDICABA A LA PINTURA DE CASAS Y DEPARTAMENTOS, ESTE TRABAJO LO REALIZA JUNTO A SU HERMANO MAYOR CON EL QUE REALIZA TRABAJOS DE PINTURA EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLOS VIVEN, Y SIENDO ESTE SU UNICO INGRESO IMPORTANTE  PARA MANTENERSE Y MANTENER  A SUS HERMANOS  MENORES Y AYUDAR ASUS PADRES, EL TAMBIEN REALIZA TRABAJOS DE CONTRUCCION Y PINTURA AL MISMO TIEMPO. GRACIAS A SU EMPRENDIMENTO DURANTE ESTE TIEMPO ELLOS SON BUSCADOS PARA REALIZAR DISTINTAS OBRAS, EL ANHELO QUE TIENE JHON ES LA DE CREAR SU PROPIA EMPRESA QUE PRESTA SERVICIO DE PINTURA AL CLIENTE Y CONSOLIDARSE EN EL MERCADO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA PINTURA AL POR CANTIDAD Y ASI PODER REAÑLIZAR SU TRABAJO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACI0ON DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jhon is young and unmarried, and has worked in painting since he was a child. His father also worked painting houses and apartments. Jhon currently works alongside his older bother. They do painting jobs in the area where they live, and this is their main source of income to support themselves and their younger siblings, and to help their parents. Jhon also works doing jobs that involve both painting and construction. Thanks to their enterprising spirit, at this point in time the brothers are sought out to undertake various jobs. It is Jhon's wish to build up his own painting business and stake out a place for himself in the market. With the loan money he will buy paint in bulk in order to keep up with his work. He is very thankful to Emprender [the Kiva field partner] for the confidence it has shown in him by giving him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint

loans.name: Luisa Filomena

texts.es:
Luisa O. de 62 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso (lugar muy humilde, con casas de caña y los caminos son de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y caña. Esta separada de su esposo, con el tuvo hijos pero ya todos están casados. 

Ella empezó con unos pequeños víveres que había comprado con sus ahorros, pero sus hijos se preocuparon mucho por ella al verla vender esos víveres en la ventana de su casa y decidieron construir y adecuar la parte delantera de su casa para que Luisa se sintiera más cómoda.   

Por el apoyo incondicional que le dieron sus hijos ella ahora tiene una pequeña tienda, aunque trabaja todos los días sola. Vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.32, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.35, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, granos y enlatados para poder surtir mejor su pequeña tienda.

En el futuro quiere continuar con su tienda y poder tener salud necesaria para ver a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Luisa O. is 62 years old. She lives in the outskirts of el Paraíso (a very humid place with houses made of cane and dirt roads) in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and cane. She is separated from her husband, with whom she had children, but her children are all married.

She started with some small provisions that she had brought with her savings, but her children were very worried about her upon seeing her sell the provisions from the window of her house. They decided to build and adapt the front of the house so that she would be more comfortable.

Because of the unconditional support of her children, she now has a small store, although she works by herself every day. She sells a pound of rice for $0.32, a pound of sugar for $0.35, etc. With the loan she wants to buy drinks, grains and canned goods to better stock her small store.

In the future she wants to continue with her store and be healthy enough to see her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, grains, and canned goods

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El señor Mario José  tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales ambos son menores de edad estudiando uno en primaria y el otro en secundaria. El señor tiene un negocio de venta de medicinas, los cuales distribuye desde su casa y además de manera ambulante a pulperías y farmacias. Cabe señalarse, el señor empezó con este negocio desde hace 31 años, el empezó vendiendo medicinas con un hermano, después observo que el negocio era rentable y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Este crédito solicitado por el señor será invertido en la compra de mas mercadería, ya que actualmente tiene varios pedidos que necesita suplir, además que su negocio ha estado creciendo bastante por lo que necesita mayor inversión. Su sueño, es poner una pequeña farmacia que sea estable y que brinde las mismas ganancias que está recibiendo ahora que anda vendiendo ambulante.
texts.en:
Mario José is 53 years old. He is married and has two children who are both young in age. One is in primary school and the other is in secondary school. Mr. José owns a business selling medicine, which he distributes from his house and also traveling to local stores and pharmacies. It should be noted that Mr. José started this business 31 years ago. He started selling medicine with his brother, and then realized that the business was profitable and started working for himself.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in buying more merchandise, since he has many orders that he needs to fill. Also, his business has been growing so much that he needs to invest more. His dream is to have a small pharmacy that is stable and that brings in more income than what he is receiving now as a traveling salesman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity M. has one child and is married to a husband who is a driver by profession. She has received junior high education.  Charity sells bags of water and ice cream at Abura. She started her business last year. Charity uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Charity will use the loan to purchase more bags of water, ice cream, and also buy provisions which will serve as an additional trade to invest in for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Charity plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: purchase more bags of water, ice cream, and also buy provisions

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ORLANDO ES SOLTERO, ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, DEDICADO AL TRANSPORTE DIARIO EN DIFERENTES VEHICULOS Y DIFERENTES RUTAS DEL PAIS, SE DEDICA A ESTE SERVICIO DURANTE BASTANTE TIEMPO PARA SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE ES SU UNICO SUSTENTO PARA SUS HERMANOS Y SUS PADRES, SEL SEÑOR REALIZA ESTE TRABAJO DURANTE EL DIA YA QUE POR LAS NOCHES DEDICA SU TIEMPO A SUS ESTUDIOS YA QUE EL CREE QUE EL TRABAJO ACTUAL QUE EL TIENE SOLO ES POR UN TIEMPO CORTO Y ASI PODER EJERCER LA PROFESION, CLARO QUE EL TAMBIEN ENTIENTE QUE PARA ESTO DEBERA CONTINUAR TRABAJANDO CON MAS EMPEÑO, ES UN JOVEN RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADOR CON MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION, SU DESEO ES EL DE TERMINAR SU CARRERA UNIVERSITARIA Y A SI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA REPUESTOS PARA EL ARREGLO DE SU VEHICULO YA QUE ESTE TIEMPO ESTA PRESENTANDO ALGUNAS FALLAS Y ESO NO LE PERMITE BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Orlando is unmarried and is a college student. He also works as a driver of several types of vehicles, driving various routes around the country. He has had this job for some time in order to help him get ahead, because it is the only source of income for his siblings and his parents. He works during the day and studies at night. He believes that this current job will only be temporary and that he will eventually work in the profession he studies for. However, he also understands that in order to achieve that goal he must continue working hard. Orlando is a responsible and hard-working young man with a great desire to better his situation. He would like to finish his college degree and be able to improve his entire family's quality of life. With the loan money he will buy spare parts to repair his vehicle. It is currently having some mechanical problems and this does not allow him to offer the best level of service to his clients. He is very thankful to Kiva and Emprender [the Kiva field partner] for the confidence they have shown in him by giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. goes to Techiman to buy onions in sacks for sale at Abura.  Ama has received senior high education.  She is married and takes care of five dependents. Her husband is a laborer.  She helps her husband in providing quality education for her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more onions and tomatoes for sale. The tomatoes are going to serve as an additional vegetable to invest in. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to reinvest back into her business. 

To be able to preserve the onions, they are spread out to allow air to circulate around them. When kept in a sack for a long time, they may rot.

loans.use: buy more onions and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Juliana Antonia

texts.es: Juliana Antonia tiene 53 años, a su edad es una persona muy activa. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y gaseosas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella dio inicio a esta actividad en su vivienda ya que la mayoría de clientes la conocen de en su vecindario, por lo que es muy querida por sus clientes por el buen carisma que Juliana les proporciona. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juliana Antonia is 53 years old and is still active at her age. She sells sodas and has been working in this business for 3 years. She started this buisness in her home since the majority of her clients live within her neighborhood and know her. She is well liked by her clients for the charisma she offers them. She is requesting this loan to purchase fruits, juices, sodas, and sweets. Her desire is to extend her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fruits, juices, sodas, and sweets.

loans.name: Topoika Ole

texts.en:
Topoika Ole K. is a 30-year-old gentleman who is married to Nalakiti K.. Together they have three school-going children. Topoika has been a potato farmer for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area and most of his customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy his produce and then sell to the city residents.

He learned about KADET through an awareness program conducted by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be Topika's second loan and he is planning to buy a new species of potato called ‘shangi’ which research has shown can do very well in this area and generate higher yields. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet demand for his farm produce and eventually become a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To plant more potatoes on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama I. is married to a driver and blessed with a child called Mohammed. She has no educational background. Mariama sells onions in both smaller and larger quantities at Abura. Mariama uses her income to help take care of the home. Mariama will use the loan to purchase more onions and other foodstuffs such as cassava, plantains and sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariama plans to save to get a shop in the marketplace where she can sell more of her goods.

loans.use: purchase more onions and other foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Simon Simanko

texts.en:
Simon Simanko N. is a 24-year-old gentleman who is married to Kisalu N.. Simon, who also is called 'Sammy', has been in the cash crop farming business for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET from a friend in his locality who was already a KADET-registered client. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to plant more wheat as it normally does well in this area due to good climactic conditions. He also plans to buy some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming.

He has dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in his area.

loans.use: Plant more wheat and buy livestock

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa O. is married and has eight dependents. She has received junior high education.  Adjoa cooks 'banku' (a cornmeal-based staple) for sale near a school at Abura. She has been preparing 'banku' for sale for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  

Adjoa uses her income she acquires from her sales to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to use to prepare her 'banku' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare her 'banku' for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi D. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce at Abura.  Esi has no educational background.  She is a widow and lives with her four children. Esi has been selling cooked rice exactly two years now. She is entirely responsible for the welfare of her four children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice to be able to cook to meet the demand of her eager consumers. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: buy bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and a mother of six children. She lives in Chembulet in Eldoret and she sells second-hand clothes for her daily income. She normally gets a monthly income of Kshs 5,000, having been in this business for five years now. Elizabeth also has a poultry business where she sells eggs to her customers some of whom are her neighbors and people from the neighboring villages.

Elizabeth is a Kadet client and she has applied for a loan which she will use to buy more clothes for resale and also buy poultry feed. 

She has dreams of getting into dairy farming and buying land on which she will build rental houses. This will be so that she can get more income and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza del barrio San Carlos, se formo hace ya más de tres años. Cada ciclo culmina con mucho y ganas de continuar trabajando con el proyecto de comité de mujeres.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el décimo cuarto ciclo del programa y entre las integrantes se encuentra la señora Miguela R. quien se  dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Luque donde posee un puesto de venta. La forma de trabajo de la señora Miguela es muy sacrificada ya que se levanta muy temprano para llegar a su puesto de venta y comenzar a vender sus productos.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras (naranjas, papas, tomate, cebollas, manzanas y otros).
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza” (Enterprising Women with Hope) Committee is from the San Carlos neighborhood and was formed more than three years ago. As each loan cycle ends, the women of the Committee want to continue working on their projects. The group is currently in its fourteenth loan cycle with the program. One of the members is Sra. Miguela R. who sells fruits and vegetables at the Luque Market where she has a vending stall. Sra. Miguela’s work requires a great deal of sacrifice because she has to wake up early in order to arrive at her vending stall and begin selling her products. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables (oranges, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, apples, and other products).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Hellen Jepkogei

texts.en:
Hellen Jepkogei K. is a 35-year-old woman, married and blessed with three children.  She lives in Chembulet with her family. Hellen operates a retail shop in the same area where she sells things like cooking oil, flour and others. Most of her customers are her neighbors in Chembulet. She also does dairy farming as a secondary business.

Hellen was introduced to KADET by her neighbor who is also a KADET client. With the loan, Hellen will add more stock for her shop with items like cooking fat, washing soap, sugar and others. 

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop in the near future, diversify her business to farming, so that she can get more income to feed and educate her children. She also hopes to rear more cattle and  supply milk to one of Kenya’s biggest milk suppliers called Kenya Co-operative Creameries.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with things like cooking fat, flour

loans.name: Mujeres De Hoy Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de Marisol S. M., una integrante del grupo Mujeres de Hoy, que está ubicado en la comunidad de San Pablo Huantepec, Municipio de Jilotepec  en el Estado de México, en México.  Se ve el puesto de la nieve y las integrantes del grupo en la foto.   Ella se dedica a la venta de nieves naturales, negocio que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar botes y la materia prima necesaria para la preparación de su producto, explica que actualmente tiene poco material y por ello sus sabores son limitados, con este crédito ella espera diversificar su producto para atraer más clientes y contar con los recipientes necesarios para mantenerlo. Sus clientes son prácticamente los viajeros pues ella instala su puesto en la orilla de las carreteras y constantemente cambia de lugar en busca de puntos estratégicos para mejorar sus ventas. 
La señora María de los Santos M. S. es madre de Marisol, trabajaron juntas durante 3 años en la elaboración de nieve, lo cual les sirvió como experiencia para poner su propio negocio como lo hizo ya su hija, ahora ella también desea iniciar su negocio por su cuenta pues como ya sus hijos hicieron su vida independiente, piensa que tal vez en el futuro no puedan ayudarla económicamente y que mejor que tener su propio negocito para ahorrar y tener un patrimonio que llegada una edad en que ya no pueda trabajar, le permita junto con su esposo vivir dignamente. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo ella se siente entusiasmada porque desea ser autosuficiente por muchos años más y considera que este proyecto se lo permitirá.  Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el sexto año primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y un varón.  Quiere este crédito para comprar botes para la nieve, hieleras, vasos, palas, cucharas y la materia prima para echar andar su negocio.   También espera hacerlo crecer poco a poco con las ganancias e ir ahorrando para un mejor futuro. 

Maricela S. M. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 22 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 3 años de edad.  Ella tiene una pizzería que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un cancel para su negocio y poder mantener la higiene de su local. Ella quiere dar a sus hijas la oportunidad de estudiar más.

El grupo está conformado por  12 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita  un crédito a CrediComún.  Los otros integrantes son:

-	Sandra Saray Pérez H. (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Rosa Ana C. García (Venta de colchas por catalogo)
-	Lesli L. C. (Venta de lencería por catalogo)
-	Margarita García Zúñiga (Venta de Omnilife)
-	Erika Anell Martínez C. (Venta de Ropa)
-	Ernestina Pérez B. (Venta de Tortillas)
-	Ramona M. V. (Tienda de abarrotes)
-	Aurelia R. Domínguez (Tienda de abarrotes)
-	Fany Vianey C. M. (Venta de Tortillas)
texts.en:
This photograph was taken at the business of Marisol S. M., a member of the group “Mujeres de Hoy” (Women of Today). This group is from the community of San Pablo Huantepec in the town of Jilotepec, State of Mexico, in Mexico. The members of the group are photographed at Marisol’s snow cone stand. She started her natural snow cone business a year ago. Marisol is requesting a loan to buy containers and ingredients that are needed to make her product. She says that she currently has a limited supply of materials; therefore she only offers a few flavors. With this loan she hopes to diversify her product and attract more customers. However, she needs these items to maintain her business. Her customers consist of travelers, which explains why her stand is located on the side of the road and constantly changes location since she looks for strategic areas where she can improve her sales.

Sra. María de los Santos M. S. is Marisol’s mother. They have been working together making snow cones for three years. Just like her daughter, María started her working so that she could gain experience. She now wants to start her own business and live independently because she believes there may come a time in the future when her children won’t be able to support her financially. María thought it would be best to have her own small business so that she could save and build up some assets for when she is not able to work so that she and her husband can continue to live decently. Upon applying for this loan, María was very excited because she wants to be self-sufficient for many years to come and believes this project will help her do that. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children (three daughters and a son). María has a sixth grade education. She will use her loan to buy snow cone cups, ice chests, glasses, scoops, spoons, and raw materials needed to start her business. She expects to generate income gradually so that she can save for a better future.

Maricela S. M. is the group president. She is 22 years old, married, and has two daughters who are both 3 years old. Maricela completed her education through the third year of high school. She started a pizzeria a year ago. Maricela is requesting a loan to buy a screened door for her business so that her shop stays clean. She wants to provide her children with the opportunity to study.

The group consists of 12 members. This is the first time they have requested a loan from CrediComún. The other members are as follows:

- Sandra Saray Pérez H. (sells shoes through a catalog) - Rosa Ana C. García (sells bedspeads through a catalog) - Lesli L. C. (sells lingerie through a catalog) - Margarita García Zúñiga (sells Omni Life products) - Erika Anell Martínez C. (sells clothing) - Ernestina Pérez B. (sells tortillas) - Ramona M. V. (manages a grocery store) - Aurelia R. Domínguez (manages a grocery store) - Fany Vianey C. M. (sells tortillas)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making snow cones

location.town: San Pablo Huantepec, Municipio de Jilotepec, Edo d

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Esmeralda C. A. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de nueve años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien en su trabajo ,se le otorgo el crédito para la tramitación de titulo de su hija que salió de la universidad  ya que no contaba con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia 
Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica y cuidar niños.  
Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hija y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños fue darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada.

Rosa es una madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando la necesitan. Ellos trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos familiares de la casa.
 
Este es el cuarto crédito que rosa tiene con Ceprodel
Y espera no quedarlos mal y poder seguir trabajando con la institución para seguir mejorando su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Esmeralda C. A. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de nueve años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien en su trabajo ,se le otorgo el crédito para la tramitación de titulo de su hija que salió de la universidad ya que no contaba con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica y cuidar niños. Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hija y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños fue darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada. Rosa es una madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando la necesitan. Ellos trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos familiares de la casa. Este es el cuarto crédito que rosa tiene con Ceprodel Y espera no quedarlos mal y poder seguir trabajando con la institución para seguir mejorando su nivel de vida familiar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tramite de titulo de su hija

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M. is a 32-year-old married mother of four children. Her husband is called Khonde Thuma Menja. Rehema runs a food stall in Nyali and her business has been in operation for 12 years. The locals there refer to her stall as 'kwa mamake Hadija' and she is very popular with her customers. Her food stall has been doing well and manages to get a monthly profit of between Kshs 12,000 and Kshs15,000 in a good month.

This loan marks Rehema's first borrowing to finance her business from KADET and she plans to expand her food stall and purchase more foodstuff stock. 

Rehema hopes to improve her standard of living and to diversify to other business ventures in future.

loans.use: To expand her food stall, purchase more food stocks

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria Ofelia tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la venta y destace de cerdos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios se dan porque Maria no era una mujer muy humilde y la responsabilidad de sus hijos contribuyeron a que ella buscara un medio de medio de ingreso para su hogar, así fue que poco a poco ella fue creciendo con esta actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar cerdos. Su deseo es que sus hijos en futuro se hagan cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Ofelia is 54 years old and manages a business selling and butchering pigs. When she started her business more than six years ago, she was a very humble woman and took responsibility for her children. They, in turn, contributed toward half of the household income. Little by little, her business grew over time.

She is now requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy pigs. Maria hopes that her children will take over the business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus has been operating a small shop at Lenana trading center for the last 13 years. His area has low-income earners and most of the residents are workers in the nearby high-income KAREN estate. 

Onesmus got to know about KADET through a friend and he had no previous credit history. He wants to add more items to the shop so that it can bring in better returns. He repaid his first loan well and on time, and this is his second loan.

Onesmus is 35 years old and married to Rhoda, and they have a one-and-half-year-old baby. Onesmus and his wife plan to expand their business so that they can increase their family income.

loans.use: buy stock of items like, sugar, maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Rael Chesang

texts.en:
Rael Chesang K. is a married woman of 38 and a mother of four beautiful children. She lives in Lemoru in Eldoret where she is a farmer in the same area. She specializes in planting maize for resale. She also has a secondary business in dairy farming where she sells milk to her customers from the same area and neighboring areas.

Rael was introduced to KADET by another existing client. This will be Rael's first loan with KADET, and she plans to buy farm inputs like maize seedlings, fertilizer and also pay for the labor for the people who help in digging the farm. 

Rael's dream is to expand in farming, own a tractor to help with digging the farm, and also educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, maize seedlings

loans.name: Tormenta Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento TORMENTA esta conformado por 9 integrantes que viven en la misma zona del km 9 barrio 23 D. diciembre, balparaiso, 8vo anillo ,urbanizacion canan hace bastante tiempo todos los integrantes cuentan con negocio propio ya llevan bastantes años con su negocio, se dedican a la venta D. mercaderia como ser ropa, celulares, cosmeticos por catalogo, comida, etc,  la  gran mayoria D. los clientes son padres D. familia y como estado civil son concubinos o casados o separados  todos tienen el objetivo D. engrandecer su negocio y llegar muy lejos y tiene el sueño D. compra D. sus  casita ,moto, electrodomesticos ,vehiculo terreno viajes para poder rencontrarse con sus seres queridos este es un grupo muy unido y resposable.

La Presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana ella es casada tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. temporada con esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo se dedica a la venta D. repuestos D. automoviles, los dos trabajan para sacar a su familia adelante, su sueño D. la Sra. juana es la D. comprarse una casita y poder ir a vivir ahi con toda su familia, ya que ahora vive en la casa D. su suegra y siempre tiene inconvenientes con la suegra, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para asi poder surtir su negocio, es una persona responsable, dinamica y solidaria con sus compañeras por eso la elijieron como representante del banco.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Tormenta Enterprise Bank is maD. up of 9 members who live in the same area around kilometer 9 in the 23 D. diciembre neighborhood, located in the 8th anillo [a zone defined by Santa Cruz's circular avenues], in the Canan housing development. For some time the members have run their own businesses; for many years they have worked selling items such as clothing, mobile phones, cosmetics, food, etc. Most of the members have children and are either married, separated, or live with their partners. All share the goal of expanding their businesses and becoming successful. They dream of buying things such as a house, a motorcycle or other vehicle, appliances, or land, or traveling to visit loved ones. This is a very close-knit and responsible group. The president of the bank is named Juana. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She sells seasonal clothing and uses her earnings to help her husband cover the household expenses. Her husband works selling auto parts. They both work so that the family can get ahead. Juana's dream is to buy a little house and to be able to live there with her family. Currently she lives in her mother-in-law's house and this often creates conflicts with her mother-in-law. With the loan money she will buy merchandise in order to vary her sales stock. She is responsible, energetic and supportive of her fellow bank members. This is why they chose her as the representative of the bank. All of the bank members are very thankful to Emprender [the Kiva field partner] and to Kiva for the confidence shown in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Charles Kimani

texts.en:
Charles is a 58-year-old farmer. He is married to Eunice and they have four adult sons and three adult daughters. Charles is in the business of selling firewood to the tea factories and this he has done for the past six years. He also does dairy cattle farming as his other source of income. 

Charles was introduced to Kadet through a marketing outreach by Kadet staff members. Charles plans to expand his business by adding more firewood and dairy cattle with the loan he has applied for. His has intentions of buying another piece of land near his residential home with the extra profit expected from the business. 

 His future hope is to buy a piece of land and build. He describes himself as a hard-working businessman and farmer.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Félix Pedro

texts.es:
La señor Félix Pedro M. O. es originario del departamento de Estelí comunidad de santa Adelaida trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área porcina y avícola  tiene mas de diez años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo en su área, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra una refrigeradora ya que su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio como venta de comida a estudiantes de la universidad ucatse.
Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer otras labores en la agricultura trabajando con su padre. 

El plantea que la refrigeradora  le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá y le ayudara a mejorar más sus ingresos al aumentar sus ventas.
Félix es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar de los cuales uno de ellos esta en la universidad y los otros en secundaria a los que les brida su apoyo uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos preparados ya que a él se le fue negada la oportunidad 
 
Este es él sétimo crédito que Félix tiene con ceprodel
Y espera no quedar mal, expresa que estará agradecido con ceprodel ya que se le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar  y se ha superado a través del crédito.
texts.en:
La señor Félix Pedro M. O. es originario del departamento de Estelí comunidad de santa Adelaida trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área porcina y avícola tiene mas de diez años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo en su área, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra una refrigeradora ya que su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio como venta de comida a estudiantes de la universidad ucatse. Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer otras labores en la agricultura trabajando con su padre. El plantea que la refrigeradora le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá y le ayudara a mejorar más sus ingresos al aumentar sus ventas. Félix es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar de los cuales uno de ellos esta en la universidad y los otros en secundaria a los que les brida su apoyo uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos preparados ya que a él se le fue negada la oportunidad Este es él sétimo crédito que Félix tiene con ceprodel Y espera no quedar mal, expresa que estará agradecido con ceprodel ya que se le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar y se ha superado a través del crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Refrigeradora

loans.name: Salaton Ole

texts.en:
Salaton Ole K. is a 30-year-old gentleman. He is married to Ann K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Salaton is a farmer who has been farming on his own piece of land for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET, a Kiva partner, from a colleague who was already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant 20 acres of wheat, which has proved to be doing very well in this area, and keep some sheep for fattening to sell at a later date. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production and sheep rearing.

He hopes to become a large-scale farmer in both wheat production and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To prepare farm for wheat planting and to buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 45 años de edad es  madre de familia, realiza la actividad de venta de ropa usada.  Ella se dedica a ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante, por lo que algunos clientes le solicitan que  lleve sus productos hasta donde ellos viven, lo que ha salido factible para Maria ya que tiene una gran variedad de clientes. Esta solicitando un crédito por el motivo que se acerca  las celebraciones de la comarca, y ya tiene un pedido muy grande. Su esposo también contribuye con las gastos del hogar trabaja en una planta eléctrica por lo que juntos han sabido sobrellevar las situaciones. Su deseo es  mejorar cada día sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria De Los Ángeles is a 45 year old mother who sells used clothing. She offers her products as a traveling merchant and has a few customers who ask her to deliver her products to where they live. This is practical for Maria because she has a wide range of customers.

She is requesting a loan because many celebrations are being held in the region and she has a very large request. Her husband also contributes to the household expenses by working at a power plant. Together they have been able to cope with all situations. Her desire is to improve her earnings each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 Años, es separada, tiene 3 hijas, D. las cuales una D. ellas vive cerca D. su casa, actualmente la apoya en el negocio. Rosa vive sola su casa propia. Hace mas 15 años que decidió tener su propia fuente D. ingreso mediante la agricultura, la crianza D. animales y también con la venta D. productos necesarios para el consumo humano, siendo este último negocio compartido con su hija, que es casada e independiente. Durante las mañanas Rosa sale al campo para verificar sus terrenos D. cultivo, lo que pueda cosechar lo lleva a vender a su tienda o a la ciudad para venderlos al por mayor, paralelamente a esta actividad lleva su vaca y sus ovejas a espacios abiertos donD. puedan comer pastos frescos, así consigue mantenerlos sanos y vigorosos para luego venderlos. D. esta manera alterna sus dos trabajos primarios. Durante todo ese tiempo D.  trabajo ha visto sus beneficios en las rentas, por lo que esta planeando incrementar su producción e intensificar más la venta D. animales. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil este aporte en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su próxima siembra y en la compra D. 2 ovejas más.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives alone in her own home. She has three daughters, one of whom lives near her and currently helps with her business. Rosa has been earning her own income by farming, raising animals, and selling products for human consumption for more than 15 years. Her daughter, who is married and independent, later joined her in her business venture.

In the mornings, Rosa leaves for the fields so that she can survey her farmland. What she is able to harvest she sells either at her store or to wholesalers in the city. At the same time, she also takes her cows and sheep to the open spaces where they can graze on fresh grass that keeps them healthy and vigorous prior to being sold. She divides her time between these two activities. Throughout all the time she has been working, Rosa has been able to generate a profit. She now plans to increase her production and sell more animals.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Rosa promises to be responsible with her payments since she considers the loans to be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of sacks of compost for her next crop. She will also buy two more heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & two heads of sheep

loans.name: Julius Kibiwot

texts.en:
Julius Kibiwot M. is a man of 38. He is married to Anna M. and together, they have three beautiful children. Julius is a cash-crop farmer in Lemoru in Eldoret, where he plants maize for resale. He has been in this business for two years now.

Julius was introduced to Kiva's partner KADET by his friend, who is also a KADET client, and this will be his first loan from KADET. With the loan, Julius will buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seedlings, etc.

His dream is to become a prime supplier of maize to different markets within Eldoret and neighboring towns. He also hopes to educate his children to the highest level possible and buy a pick-up truck to make his distribution work easier.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, maize seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El Sr. Silverio A.  vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque,  el mismo  es casado y vive con su conyuge.
 El titular cuenta con un comedor  hace 10 años en su domicilio, prepara desayunos, media mañanas, almuerzos y meriendas para personales de una fabrica de costura que se encuentra frente a su domicilio contando ya con una buena clientela formada a la fecha.
 Cabe resaltar que el mismo opera solo con  la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2002  siempre abonando en forma excelente sus prestamos. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de alimentos para la venta(carnes vacuna, porcina, de aves, fideos, harina, arroz).
texts.en:
Sr. Silverio A. is married. He and his wife live in their own home in the city of Luque.

Silverio opened a diner in his home ten years ago. He prepares breakfasts, brunches, lunches, and snacks for employees of a sewing factory located in front of his home. Silverio has built up a good customer base since he started. He has only done business with Fundación Paraguaya and has been a client since 2002. He has always been in excellent shape when paying his loans.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase ingredients for preparing the meals that he sells (beef, pork, poultry, noodles, flour, and rice).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Daniel Lelei

texts.en:
Daniel Lelei M. is a gentleman who is 35 years old. He is married to Priscilla M. and together, they have five beautiful children. They live in Sinonin in Eldoret, where their farm is. Daniel is a maize farmer who sells maize mostly to his neighbors soon after harvest. He has been farming for 10 years now and this has enabled him to feed, clothe and provide shelter for his family since his wife is a housewife.

Daniel was introduced to KADET by a KADET client and this will be his first loan with KADET, a Kiva partner. He is planning to use the entire loan on his farm by buying three bags of fertilizer worth 7,500 Kenyan shillings and maize seedlings worth Kshs 2,750. He will use the rest for plowing.

Daniel is also a mason in addition to farming. His dream is to improve in farming and also own more land so he can get more income to feed, clothe and provide shelter for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize seedlings

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 33 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Fernando de 40 años y su hijo Daniel de 13 años. Ellos son una familia unida y viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella viene dedicándose a la venta de productos por campaña, esto quiere decir que Edith según la oferta del mercado vende variedad de productos. Por ejemplo en las fiestas patronales vende Turrones (postre limeño), adornos, prendas de vestir y actualmente se encuentra vendiendo CDS musicales. Siendo una mujer muy creativa, siempre encuentra los productos indicados para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos y de esa manera lograr buenas ventas. Sus ingresos son buenos porque ella se dedica mucho a su trabajo, pues casi todo el día para ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes y realizando las cobranzas. Es por ello que logra sacar adelante su negocio y en un futuro vender mercadería al por mayor. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para esta próxima festividad que es el día de la madre, donde comprará adornos y regalos, esperando lograr buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is 33 years old and shares her life with her husband Fernando (age 40) and her son Daniel (age 13). They are a close family and live in their own home. Edith sells seasonal products, which means she sells a variety of merchandise based on what the market has to offer. For example, during the patron saint festivals, she sells “turrones” (nougat candy) from Lima, decorations, and clothing. At the moment, she is selling musical CDs. Being a creative woman, she always finds the right products that will make her customers happy and is able to achieve good sales. Her earnings are good as a result of great dedication to her work. Almost every day she offers her products to her customers and collects payments. This explains why she has succeeded in her business and, in the future, she wants to sell merchandise in bulk.

Edith is requesting her sixth loan from MFP and promises to be punctual with her payments. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for the next holiday, which is Mother’s Day. She plans to buy decorations and gifts in hopes of generating good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell for Mother's Day

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet Kabura is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Kiembeni, Mombasa where she runs a grocery store. She has been in the business for five years.

Harriet has been with KADET and is now taking out her second loan after successfully servicing her first loan of Kshs 10,000. With this current loan Harriet plans to purchase potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages for resale in her grocery store. She also hopes to expand her store into a retail shop selling different foodstuffs like sugar and flour.

Harriet has been able to improve her living standards over the years and hopes to even improve more.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Amina Wanja

texts.en:
Amina, aged 32, and has one daughter. She has loaned her car to a car hire company that operates with it and pays her a monthly income of Kshs 32,000. She has been in this business for a period of three years now. 

She has never borrowed from other financial institutions but this is her third loan with KADET. With this loan, she plans to renew the insurance for the car and do some minor repairs on the vehicle. She has paid off her previous loans well and on time. 

She plans to buy some more vehicles for the car hire business so that she can increase her monthly income so as to support her child.

loans.use: renew the insurance for her car and do minor repairs

loans.name: Peninah Jerotich

texts.en:
Peninah Jerotich K. is a married woman of 27 years and a mother of one beautiful child who is in nursery school.  She sells sewing thread to tailors around Kitale shopping centre where her shop is and has been in this business for four years now. She also manages some rental houses in Kitale and gets monthly income of Kshs 18,000. 

Peninah was introduced to KADET by another KADET client who is in a different group in Kalyet in Eldoret. This will be her fourth loan in KADET. With this loan Peninah will add more stock in her shop like buy sewing thread, ribbons, and fabrics.

Her innermost dream is to educate her child to the highest educational level, also to open another shop of the same kind.

loans.use: To add more stock in the shop like buy sewing thread, ribbons, etc. for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo Saúl de 36 años y sus hijos Alexandra de 10 y José de 05 añitos de edad. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de zapatillas por pedido. Su forma de trabajo consiste en ofrecer los variados y bonitos diseños de una marca de zapatillas por catalogo a sus posibles clientes para luego realizar pedidos y venderlos según los gustos de cada uno de ellos. A Elena le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le da libertad para realizarlo, ella usualmente ofrece las zapatillas por la mañana y en las tardes realiza cobranzas a las personas a las que ya les vendió su mercadería, puesto que a algunas de ellas se las deja al crédito. Su esposo José también trabaja en el rubro de las zapatillas pero él lo hace para una empresa, es por ello que ambos en un futuro quisieran tener un gran puesto en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona en la que vive. Elena es una clienta muy antigua en MFP y en su larga trayectoria a demostrado mucha responsabilidad con los pagos, este es su séptimo crédito y se siente seguro de seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo derivará en la compra de zapatillas para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene en el colegio de su hija y de otros clientes que tiene, donde sabe obtendrá buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and lives with her husband Saúl José (age 36) and their two children, Alexandra (age 10) and José (age 5). They live together in their own home. Elena has been selling athletic shoes upon request for four years. Her work involves offering different designs and brands of athletic shoes through a catalog to potential customers based on their personal tastes and delivering the merchandise to those who decide to order them. Elena enjoys her work greatly because it gives her freedom. She usually offers her products in the morning and then collects payments in the afternoon from people who have already received their merchandise, since she extends credit to some of her customers. Her husband Saúl José is also in the same line of work selling athletic shoes, except he is employed by a company. In the future, both of them want to open a large vending post at one of the busiest markets in the area where they live.

Elena is a long-time client of MFP and has demonstrated great responsibility with her payments throughout this period. This is her seventh loan and she feels confident that she will complete it as she has done with the others until now. The loan she requested will be used to buy athletic shoes so that she can fulfill pending orders from her daughter’s school and her other customers. She knows this will generate good earnings for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase athletic shoes

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old and married to Herman who is a farmer. They have two adult daughters and one son. 

Mary was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach done by Kadet staff members. Mary has been selling soft drinks for the past 10 years and does farming with the help of her husband as her other source of income. She has applied for a loan with which she plans to add more stock of soft drinks in her shop. She intends to buy a car with the extra profit generated from the business. 

Her future hopes are to own a big soft drink company and employ more staff. Mary describes herself as a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: To add inventory to her soft drink shop

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother, 49 years old. She sells soft drinks in Chomo, her home town in central Kenya. She is blessed with two adult daughters and one adult son. 

Mary was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach by Kadet staff and she plans to purchase more soft drink stocks for her business. Mary has been selling soft drinks for the past 17 years and also does farming as her other source of income. She intends to open another soft drink shop with the extra profit expected from the business. 

Her future hopes are to buy a piece of land and build a permanent residence. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of soft drinks

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años, ella vive con su esposo Cesar de 42 años, quien se dedica a la fabricación de zapatos y su hijo Gian de 15 años de edad. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica al sembrío de arroz en una chacra que le alquila su padre. Es así que lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, por lo que tiene que viajar constantemente, lo cual a veces le resulta muy cansado. Lo bueno de todo es que sus esfuerzos son recompensados con las ganancias que obtiene con la venta del arroz que es cosechado y llevado en sacos a la ciudad para la venta, siendo un negocio muy rentable. En un futuro desea crecer su negocio, invirtiendo en sus cosechas. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser un cliente muy puntual con todos los pagos.
Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en lo próxima siembra de arroz.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and lives with her husband Cesar, who is 42 years old and works as a shoemaker. They have a 15 year old son named Gian. María and her family have their own home. She grows rice in a field that she rents from her father. María has been doing this for 15 years and, since she has to travel constantly, she occasionally gets tired of the work. The good news is that her efforts are rewarded with income she generates from the sale of her harvested rice. Once she brings the sacks of rice into the city to sell, her business becomes very profitable. In the future, she wants to grow her business by investing in her crops.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she requested, María will invest in her next crop of rice.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the planting of more rice

loans.name: Sueños De Cajón Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Sueños de Cajón y está conformado por 14 socios pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Sus principales negocios son la venta de verduras, abarrotes, comida china, carbón, diario, ropa, huevos y la crianza de pollos.
La socia entrevistada fue Cecilia, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra sentada en la segunda silla de izquierda a derecha. Su negocio consiste en vender ropa de adultos, puerta a puerta y en colegios.  Además, debido a que han bajado mucho las ventas, ahora también hace chocolates para vender.  Su motivación es lograr su propio desarrollo personal  y algún día ser autodependientes en sus negocios.
El préstamo lo invertirá en comprar materiales para hacer chocolates.
A Cecilia le gusta el sistema de trabajo grupal (bancos comunales) que entrega Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha servido mucho escuchar las experiencias de sus compañeros y también aprecia mucho que la entrega de los préstamos sea sin inconvenientes para ella.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank is named “Sueños de Cajón” (Chest of Dreams) and consists of 14 members who are from the city of Temuco. Their main businesses include selling vegetables, groceries, Chinese food, charcoal, newspapers, eggs, and chickens.

The member who was interviewed was Cecilia, who is the group president. In the photograph, she is the woman sitting in the second chair on the left side. Her business involves selling clothing for adults, door to door and at schools. Since her sales have plummeted, she now makes chocolates to sell. She is motivated by her desire for personal development so that one day she can be self-reliant in her businesses. Her loan will be used to buy supplies for making chocolates.

Cecilia enjoys the system of work groups (Communal Banks) that is implemented by Fondo Esperanza. She has benefitted from hearing about the experiences of her fellow group members and also appreciates that the process for securing a loan has been convenient for her.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region and is located 670 km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). The area has several lake resorts and picturesque views of native flora and fauna. Half of the population in this region is of Mapuche descent, an indigenous group that lives in Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making chocolates

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi N. is a businesswoman who has operated a food kiosk for the last 12 years. Her kiosk is in the Reef Majengo area. She is 38 years old and a single mother. She has seven children.

Chizi was introduced by a fellow member to KADET. This is her first experience with a microfinance organization. She joined KADET three months ago and she is now ready to access her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 after undergoing training with KADET. She intends to expand her business by buying flour and sugar and renovating her premises with this loan.

Her dream is to own a classic hotel along the coast of the Indian Ocean.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar and renovate her premises

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi G. is a businessman who runs a carpentry store in the Longo mhongwe area. He supplements his income by selling secondhand clothes to area residents. He has been in the carpentry business for the last five years and is proud of his work. He is 45 years old. He and his wife, Binti Omar Mohamed, 30 years old, are blessed with four children, all of whom attend school.

Hamisi has been a member of KADET for some time, and he is now accessing his second loan after successfully completing repayment of the first one, which was in the amount of Kshs 11,000. With this second loan, Hamisi intends to devote Kshs 15,000 of the money to restocking timber for his carpentry business and to use Ksh.7,000 to buy clothing supplies.

He hopes to be very successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his carpentry business and secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 30-year-old businessman operating a charcoal store. He operates his business along the Mtopanga area. He has no children yet but he is married to one wife. He has been in the same business for the last four years, and his monthly profit minus all other expenses is Kshs 5,000. He is also employed, which is to say that he has a basic salary at the end of the month.

Geoffrey has never borrowed from any other institution and was introduced by other members to KADET. He has currently been a member of KADET for three months and now he is ready for his first loan of Kshs10,000. He plans to expand his business by buying three more sacks of charcoal worth Kshs 10,000.

He hopes to become a big supplier of charcoal in Mombasa town.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 57 años de edad, él vive en su casa propia a lado de su hija quien ya es independiente. Hace más de 7 años trabaja en el servicio de transporte en su motocarro, logrando adquirir su moto, única herramienta de trabajo, gracias a su esfuerzo. Es así que desde tempranas horas de la mañana va rumbo a su paradero, lugar que ya se estableció, puesto que se encuentra en una zona de mayor concurrencia de clientes. En todo este tiempo ha ganado la confianza de sus pasajeros. A Juan le gusta su trabajo, pero debe procurar siempre mantener su motocarro en buen estado, ya que el constante uso hace que presente algunos contrariedades en su funcionamiento. Es  por ello que desea comprarse un auto, para que pueda brindar más comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual como en anteriores veces. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro y dejarlo en óptimas condiciones y poder trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man who is 57 years old. He lives in his own home along with his daughter, who is independent. For more than 7 years he has worked providing transportation services with his motocar (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle.) He managed to buy his own motocar, the only tool of his work, thanks to his own efforts. He gets up early in the morning and heads for his taxi stop, a place that he already established, because it lies in an area where there are large numbers of customers. Over time he has gained the confidence of his passengers. Juan likes his work, but he has to always maintain his motocar in good condition, since with constant use the vehicle will tend to have some problems. That is why he wants to buy himself an automobile, so that he could provide more comfort to his passengers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments as he was the last time. With the loan he requests, he will invest in maintaining his motocar, leaving it in optimal condition so that he can work without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his motocar

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, el comparte su vida con su pareja y su hijo. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 16 años él se dedica a brindar servicio de albañil en la zona en la que vive, actividad que le ha resultado muy rentable para mantener a su familia. Los largos años de experiencia se encargaron de darle a Juan un buen prestigio y por ende buenos contratos, sus clientes siempre terminan contentos con el buen acabado que deja en sus obras y eso le da mucha satisfacción. Ahora quiere mejorar su negocio comprando mejores herramientas, pues las que actualmente posee están desgastadas por el constante uso que les da. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos los pagos.
Con el crédito que solicita, espera comprar mejores herramientas que le faciliten el trabajo y así poder cumplir con los contratos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working man who is 45 years old. He shares his life with his partner and son. They all live together in their own home. For the last 16 years, he has made his living has a builder in the area where he lives. This work has been very profitable and helped him support his family. His many years of experience have given Juan a lot of prestige and consequently good contracts. His customers are always happy with the finished product, which gives him a lot of satisfaction. He now wants to improve his business by purchasing better tools. The ones he currently owns are worn out from their constant use. This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be on time with all payments. With the requested loan, he hopes to purchase better tools, which will make work easier for him, and thereby enable him to fulfill his pending contracts.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 27 años, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hija de 6 años, fruto de su primer compromiso. Actualmente vive con su nueva pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 meses de nacido.     

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo de lechuga, maíz, papa y arvejas; su esposo sólo le ayuda en sus tiempos libres, pues trabaja en la municipalidad de su provincia.
Los terrenos que siembra son propios y algunos heredados por su padre, quien le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas que practica en la actualidad. A Elena le gusta plantar lechuga por lo rentable que resulta y la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Por lo que para el futuro se proyecta a construir una casa propia para que sus hijos tengan una adecuada calidad de vida, sin dejar de incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y desde ya asegura que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, donde se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota para no quedar mal con su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja y dos sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Elena is 27 years old. She lives in her parents’ home with her 6-year-old daughter (who was the child of her first marriage), her current husband, and their 5-month-old son. For 5 years Elena has made a living growing lettuce, corn, potatoes, and peas; her husband can only help her during his free time, since he works for their province’s council. She cultivates her own fields, including some that she inherited from her father, who taught her all of the agricultural techniques that she now uses. Elena likes planting lettuce because it is profitable and there is much demand for it in the market. In the future she plans to construct her own house to that she and her children will have an adequate quality of life, while also increasing her production. This is Elena’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she assures us that she likes working in the communal bank, where she promises to make each of her payments on time so that she won’t give the other members of her group a bad impression. She will use the 1000 soles she is requesting to purchase a bag of pea seeds and two bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials to celebrate Mother's Day and to have greater security.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 44 años, está casada con Porfirio de 47 años; tienen 4 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos. Su casa es propia y está construida de material rústico (ladrillos de adobe, calaminas y madera).
Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la cultivar productos oriundos de su zona con la ayuda de sus hijos y operarios. Su esposo es transportista de carga pesada y labora en diferentes ciudades y llega a su casa cada semana. 
Sus terrenos son propios y produce papa, arveja y lechuga, y lo que más le gusta hacer es atender sus plantas cuando empiezan a brotar los frutos. Por otro lado, le disgusta tener que trasladar sus pesados sacos al mercado para su comercialización.
Para más adelante, planea construir una casa en la capital (Lima), para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles, ya que desea cambiar de fuente de ingreso a una actividad más tranquila porque quiere cuidar su salud.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y resalta la labor de su banco comunal, pues está conformado por personas responsables que buscan sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que los buenos logros siempre contagian a los demás. Con el dinero que solicita comprará diez sacos de guano de corral para sembrar tubérculos.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 44 years old, and is married to 47 year old Porfirio; they have 4 children but only have 3 living with them. They own their house, which is made of traditional materials (adobe bricks, smithsonite rock, and wood). For 17 years, she has cultivated products native to her area with the help of her children and workers. Her husband is a heavy matrerials carrier and works in different cities, returning home weekly. They own their land and produce potatoes, peas and lettuce. What she likes best is to see the plants when they begin to bear fruit. On the other hand, she does not like having to transport her heavy bags to the market for sale. Later on, she plans to build a house in the capital (Lima), in order to set up a food store, and earn income from a less physically demanding source because she wants to take care of her health. This is the second loan she will have with MFP. That is a credit to the work of her communal bank. It's made up of responsible people who want their families to get ahead, and the successes of each member always inspire the rest. With this money, she will buy ten bags of guano fertilizer to plant root vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guano fertilizer

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides tiene 52 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Marcelino de 72 años y el último de sus hijos. Anteriormente, con su primera pareja tuvo 2 hijas mujeres que trabajan independientemente.

Se caracteriza por tener un espíritu emprendedor y desde hace 30 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, maíz y lechuga en sus terrenos propios. Eventualmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo, quien también trabaja como operario ganando a diario 20 soles. 
Como otra fuente de ingresos crían dos vacas, que les generan leche para elaborar diariamente quesos que venden entre sus vecinos. 
Para el futuro, piensa instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en una casa que tiene en una zona céntrica de su localidad, pues quiere dejar de realizar trabajos pesados.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como es una mujer muy activa y luchadora a diario ahorra para que puntualmente pague sus aportaciones en la fecha indicada. Además, asegura que le agrada laborar con su banco comunal, ya que todos son puntuales. Con el dinero que solicita comprará 30 sacos de guano de corral, 10 sacos de papa y otros sacos de fertilizante.
texts.en:
Leonides is 52 years old and lives in her own home along with her spouse, 72 year old Marcelino, and the youngest of her children. With her first partner she had 2 daughters who work independently. She has a very enterprising spirit, and for 30 years she has grown potatoes, peas, corn and lettuce on her own land. Her husband also helps her by working as a labourer and earning 20 soles a day. Another source of income is raising cattle, which gives them milk every day to make cheeses with, which they sell to their neighbours. In the future, she's thinking of setting up a food store in a house she has in a central location, as she would like to do less heavy labour. This is the second loan that she's had with MFP and, as she is a very active and hard working woman, she saves up to be able to make all of her payments on time. Moreover, she tells us that she enjoys working with her communal bank, since everyone pays on time. With the money she's requesting, she will buy 30 bags of guano fetilizer, 10 bags of potatoes, and some other bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guano fertilizer, seeds, and other fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
A sus 29 años, Marcelina está casada con Javier de 33 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de “Tongo” en Tarma.

Ella se muestra muy orgullosa de los logros obtenido hasta ahora, más aún porque su esposo siempre está con ella apoyándola. Es por eso que juntos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, con la esperanza de brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos: “lo que más quiero en la vida es que mis hijos sean mejores que yo, sobre todo que sean profesionales”.

Lo que le gusta es cosechar sus productos, tales como la lechuga, papa, arveja y maíz; paralelamente le agrada cuidar de los animales que tiene. Para el futuro anhela sembrar en mayor cantidad y comprar sus propios terrenos, pues ya no quiere cultivar en chacras arrendadas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y anhela tener otros más, es por eso es muy puntual en cada pago. También señala que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas responsables que desean progresar. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una vaca, una lata de semilla de lechuga y el resto será para el pago de los operarios.
texts.en:
At 29 years of age, Marcelina is married to Javier who is 33 years old. They have 3 children and live in their own home located in the town of “Tongo” in Tarma. She is very proud of the success she had made up to this point, and now even more because her husband is always there to support her. They have been farming for 10 years with the hopes of offering a better future to their children: “What I want the most in life is for my children to do better than myself, most of all for them to become professionals.” She enjoys growing their products such as lettuce, potatoes, peas and corn. She also enjoys taking care of the animals they own. For the future she wishes to grow a greater amount and purchase her own land since she does not want to grow on rented farmland. This is the second loan she has with MFP and wants to request more which is why she is punctual with every payment. She also likes working with her communal bank because it consists of responsible people who desire to make progress. With the loan she will purchase a cow, a can of lettuce seeds, and the rest will be for the worker’s payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a cow and seeds.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita vive en su casa propia y a sus 42 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y así ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo de 23 años. Ella desde muy joven ha venido trabajando en la venta de ropa a domicilio, actividad en la que ganado mucha experiencia y también buenos clientes. Su forma de trabajo consiste en comprar ropa al por mayor en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de su ciudad y entregarla por pedidos a su clientela de casa en casa. Marlita se siente contenta con lo que hace, porque se siente muy útil, aunque algunas veces es muy agotador, aún así ella piensa mejorar su negocio.  En un futuro desea instalar un negocio más estable y así evitar caminar tanto, de esa manera pueda sacar adelante a su hijo. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual en todos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa, puesto que tiene mucho pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
42-year-old Marlita lives in her own home and supports her 23-year-old son. From a young age, Marlita has been selling clothes. She has gained a lot of experienece and plenty of good customers along the way. He business works something like this: she buys clothing from one of the busiest markets in her city and delivers it to her customers, door-to-door, on foot. Overall, Marlita is happy with what she does, because it's useful work. It can be quite tiring, however, which is why she wants to improve her business. She wants to make her business more stable and avoid walking quite so much, which will give her more time to spend with her son. This is Marlita's third loan with MFP, and she has pledged to repay it promptly. With this loan, she plans to buy more clothing because she has many orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more clothing.

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita tiene 34 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general.  Por lo que  tiene muchos créditos con Fundación y le han sido beneficiosos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se levanta muy temprano, para ir a comprar sus productos que son muy importantes para así ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Actualmente ella está solicitando el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballeros, cosméticos, ropa para damas y para niños. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita is 34 years old. She runs a general store. Yesenia has had a number of loans with Fundación, and they've been extremely helpful. She has been in business for nine years, and she has three children to care for, as well. Yesenia gets up early to buy the products that are most important to her customers. She has applied for a loan so that she can buy men's clothing, cosmetics, women's clothing and items for children. All she hopes is that she'll be able to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Forjando Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Forjando Sueños y está conformado por 16 socias dedicadas principalmente a la venta de ropa usada, joyas, perfumes, verduras, leña, carbón y costuras.
La socia entrevistada fue Teresa, quien es la presidenta del grupo. En la foto se encuentra sentada en 2º lugar de izquierda a derecha, y usa lentes. Ella vende productos lácteos, mantequilla y quesillos artesanales, los cuales distribuye puerta a puerta. Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en un lugar
céntrico de la ciudad, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.Ella invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, bolsas y envases.
Teresa comenta que aprecia en gran manera la rápida entrega de los préstamos en  Fondo Esperanza. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Forjando Sueños (Forging Dreams) and is made up of 16 members who sell used clothing, jewellery, perfume, vegetables, firewood and coal, as well as offering dressmaking services. Kiva interviewed Teresa, the president of the group. In the photo she is seated second to the left, wearing glasses. Teresa sells milk products, butter and artisanal cheeses, which she distributes from door to door. Her dream is to have an established business in the city centre so that she can improve her quality of life. She will invest this loan in merchandise, bags and containers.
