Luz es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector El Lentejal, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, caracterizado por tener bastante población situada en zonas rurales, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, ella cría gallinas, patos, chanchos y una raza especial de cuyes denominada Tipo Perú, caracterizada por tener ejemplares bastante grandes y de carne muy exquisita. Usualmente los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona para adquirirlos y revenderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Luz trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja como peón agricola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar sus ingresos. Ella desea mejorar la calidad de crianza de los animales con los que cuenta, por lo que desea adquirir alimento como granos y pastos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada. En la imagen nos muestra uno de los ejemplares de los cuyes Tipo Perú.
texts.en:
Luz is a 24 year old mother, who lives with her husband and their young son in El Lentejal, an agricultural region of the Pitipo district, in the province of Ferreñafe, known for having a large part of its population living in rural areas. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years she has been raising and selling small animals in her home. She raises hens, ducks, pigs, and a special breed of Peruvian guinea pigs, known for being quite large and with delicious meat. Usually she sells them to the businessmen who visit the region to buy and re-sell them in the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo.

Luz tries to give her best in order to get ahead in her business, since her husband works as a farm worker and the income that he receives is not sufficient to clear their income. She hopes to improve the quality of animals that she raises so therefore she hopes to buy food such as grains and grass. In order to achieve her objetive, she needs to request a loan of 800 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa

Luz is a happy and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to give her family a better quality of life. In the region where she lives, she is very well-respected. In the picture she shows us one of her Peruvian guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and grass for maintaining her business raising and selling small animals.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Flor de María M. P. es comerciante de este mercado tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en el sector salones tiene 6 años de tener su negocio tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que es por lo que ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante.
Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de  $ 500 dólares aporte de su esposo, el financiamiento lo solicito  para comprar unos tintes y unas pinturas que le vendian, es su primer crédito pero espera que no sea el último ya que le ha gustado la modalidad de estos créditos y la gentileza con que se le ha atendido.   En la fotografía  la señora M. P. es la que viste de café la otra muchacha es trabajadora de ella y la señora que esta sentada es clienta de ella le estan haciendo un corte de cabello
texts.en:
La Señora Flor de María M. P. es comerciante de este mercado tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en el sector salones tiene 6 años de tener su negocio tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que es por lo que ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante. Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de $ 500 dólares aporte de su esposo, el financiamiento lo solicito para comprar unos tintes y unas pinturas que le vendian, es su primer crédito pero espera que no sea el último ya que le ha gustado la modalidad de estos créditos y la gentileza con que se le ha atendido. En la fotografía la señora M. P. es la que viste de café la otra muchacha es trabajadora de ella y la señora que esta sentada es clienta de ella le estan haciendo un corte de cabello

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para acondicionar mi negocio realizarle mejora

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel A. R. de 39 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos mayores de edad, tanto su esposo como sus hijos trabajan en conjunto con Maribel. Ella posee un taller de marroquinería, en el cual se encargan de elaborar carteras y bolsos de cuero, los cuales comercializan en el centro de San Salvador, así mismo elaboran pedido hecho por clientes los cuales vende las carteras en el centro de Soyapango. Tanto Maribel como toda su familia son personas muy trabajadoras quienes siempre entregan su trabajo a tiempo, los cuales han salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo. Maribel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de hilo y cuero, por medio del cual pueda elaborar más carteras, y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, lo cual es de mucha importancia para ella y toda su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Maribel A. R., aged 39, lives in the municipality of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and their two adult children. Her husband and her children work together with her. Maribel owns a leather workshop in which they produce leather wallets, purses and handbags, which they sell in downtown San Salvador. In addition, they produce wallets and purses on request for customers who sell them in the center of the city of Soyapango. Both Maribel and the rest of her family are very hardworking people who always deliver their finished products on time and have been successful thanks to their efforts. Maribel applies for a loan to buy large quantities of yarn and leather, which well enable her to produce more wallets and purses and thus increase her turnover. This is very important to her and the whole family, since it is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and yarn to produce wallets and purses

loans.name: Erlinda Isabel

texts.es: La señora Erlinda Isabel C. U.  tiene un negocio en el Mercado central de venta de verduras y frutas con 10 años de experiencia es Madre soltera de tres hijos solo el pequeño en edad escolar, la señora C. U. solicito financiamiento por que deseaba surtir su negocio mas ahorita que para ella es temporada buena por verano,  empieza a vender a las seis y media de la mañana se esfuerza en su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos, con los financiamientos que le han otorgado ha surtido más su negocio ha venido mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
La señora Erlinda Isabel C. U. tiene un negocio en el Mercado central de venta de verduras y frutas con 10 años de experiencia es Madre soltera de tres hijos solo el pequeño en edad escolar, la señora C. U. solicito financiamiento por que deseaba surtir su negocio mas ahorita que para ella es temporada buena por verano, empieza a vender a las seis y media de la mañana se esfuerza en su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos, con los financiamientos que le han otorgado ha surtido más su negocio ha venido mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para mi negocio  como: tomate, cebolla, jocote, mangos,

loans.name: Rhina Deysi

texts.es: Rhina Deysi M. de 34 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive en casa propia junto a su madre, la cual trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar. Rhina posee una venta de llaveros, encendedores, perfumes, llaves y otros productos más. El negocio está ubicado sobre la calle principal de San Francisco Goteras, la cual se encuentra frente al parque del mismo municipio. Sus ventas son muy estables, y cuenta con varios clientes los cuales son constantes en sus compras. Rhina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su negocio y de esta manera contar con más clientes, ya que este trabajo es la única fuente de ingresos que posee ella para poder salir adelante junto a su madre, es por ello que es de mucho importancia mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Rhina Deysi M., aged 34, lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the department of Morazán. She lives in her own house with her mother who takes care of the household chores. Rhina owns a store in which she sells key rings, cigarette lighters, perfumes, keys and similar items. Her store is located on the main street of San Francisco Goteras and faces the city park. Her turnover is very stable; she has a diversified clientele with regular purchases. Rhina applies for a loan to have sufficient means to bolster her business and thus get more customers. This activity is indeed her sole source of income. It allows her and her mother to progress, so improving her business is a matter of great importance to her.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy key rings, lighters, perfumes and similar items

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina M. S. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 20 años tiene un negocio de venta de comida,  ahí ella trabaja con sus dos hermanas anteriormente ellas le ayudaban a su mamá pero su mamá falleció y decidieron seguir con el  negocio con la condición de juntas pero no revueltas cada quien hace su comida lo único que es el punto que la clientela las busca.
Tiene de trabajar con ceprodel seis años y en el trayecto de este tiempo le han ayudado bastante  ya  que ha salido adelante  y en su calidad de vida tambien.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Argentina M. S. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 20 años tiene un negocio de venta de comida, ahí ella trabaja con sus dos hermanas anteriormente ellas le ayudaban a su mamá pero su mamá falleció y decidieron seguir con el negocio con la condición de juntas pero no revueltas cada quien hace su comida lo único que es el punto que la clientela las busca. Tiene de trabajar con ceprodel seis años y en el trayecto de este tiempo le han ayudado bastante ya que ha salido adelante y en su calidad de vida tambien.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para la elaboración de sus comidas ejemplo: aceite, arroz

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino S. G. de 54 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El señor Faustino posee una venta de frutas, jugos, agua y fruta pelada y cortada en trocitos la cual vende acompañada de sal, limón y chile. Él es un señor muy alegre y querido por sus vecinos ya que es muy amable y trabajador, el cual se dedica a su esposa por quien se esfuerza a diario. Faustino solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar sodas, gatorade, agua embotellada y más fruta, ya que su negocio se encuentra a las afueras de su hogar sobre la calle principal en donde transitan muchas personas y en su mayoría le solicitan algo para tomar y refrescarse del inclemente sol, por lo que Faustino posee muchos clientes lo cual lo incentiva a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Faustino S. G., aged 54, lives in the department of Morazán with his wife who takes care of the household chores. He owns a store in which he sells fruit, juice and water as well as peeled and cut fruit served with salt, lemon and chili. He is a very cheerful man and his neighbors like him because he is always very kind and hardworking and is dedicated to his wife for whom he makes all these efforts day in, day out. Faustino applies for a loan to buy soda, energy drinks, bottled water and fruit. His store is located outside of his home on the main street, where many passers-by stop and ask for refreshments when the sun is blazing. Therefore Faustino has many customers and this encourages him to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda, bottled water and fruit

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es:
La señora B. S. tiene 4 años de trabajar con ceprodel es Madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, esta señora antes era ama de casa pero su esposo le regaló cinco mil córdobas para que ella se ayudara y pusiera algún negocio en su casa decidio venirse a vender al mercado en el callejon de las verduras frente al sector cerdo puso un negocio de verduras y marisco.
Ella empezo su negocio con poca mercaderia poco a poco ha salido adelante ahora tiene una ventesita en su casa que esa la administra su hija la mayor su casita la ha mejorado poco a poco tambien. Ahora solo  ella es  el sustento de su casa ya que no cuenta con su esposo por que falleció hace poco.
texts.en:
La señora B. S. tiene 4 años de trabajar con ceprodel es Madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, esta señora antes era ama de casa pero su esposo le regaló cinco mil córdobas para que ella se ayudara y pusiera algún negocio en su casa decidio venirse a vender al mercado en el callejon de las verduras frente al sector cerdo puso un negocio de verduras y marisco. Ella empezo su negocio con poca mercaderia poco a poco ha salido adelante ahora tiene una ventesita en su casa que esa la administra su hija la mayor su casita la ha mejorado poco a poco tambien. Ahora solo ella es el sustento de su casa ya que no cuenta con su esposo por que falleció hace poco.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mariscos y verduras para  mi negocio

loans.name: Ana Rogelia

texts.es: Ana Rogelia M. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre, la cual se dedica a la elaboración de desayunos y almuerzos. Ana posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, detergente, huevos y otros más, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado regional de Morazán, en donde posee muchos clientes en especial las personas que trabajan en el mercado haciendo comida, ya que son los que más le compran productos como granos básicos y aceite. Su negocio es muy estable, ya que sus ventas son diarias y posee muy buenos ingresos. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cereales, bebidas y otros productos de primera necesidad los cuales son de mucha importancia para el hogar. El poder mejorar su negocio es vital para Ana ya que es así como ella se gana la vida.
texts.en:
Ana Rogelia M. is 50 and lives in the province of Morazán with her mother, who prepares breakfast and lunch food for a living. Ana sells staples such as rice, beans, sugar, detergent, eggs and other items, and her business is located in the regional market of Morazán where she has many clients, especially those that work in the market selling foods, who are among those that buy the most staple products from her, such as grains and cooking oil. Her business is very stable, with daily sales and good profits. For this reason she seeks a loan to buy greater quantities of stock, such as cereals, beverages and other staple products for the home. Improving her business is vital for Ana as it sustains her family.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory of staple items for sale

loans.name: Daniel Humberto

texts.es: Daniel Humberto D. G. de 25 años de edad reside en el municipio de Osicala, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a ayudarle a Daniel en el negocio. Él posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, ropa interior y zapatos deportivos. La venta esta ubicada frente a al parque de Osicala, un lugar de mucho comercio ya que a sus alrededores se encuentra el mercado y el supermercado, así como también otras comerciales, esto es de mucho beneficio para Daniel ya que muchas personas transitan el lugar lo que lo hace más visible. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y calzado, de manera que sus ventas aumenten, ya que es esta la única forma en que se gana la vida. Tanto Daniel como su esposa son muy admirados en el lugar ya que ha pesar de su corta edad se esfuerzan en gran manera por obtener una vida estable.
texts.en:
Daniel Humberto D. G. is 25 and lives in the municipality of Osicala, in the province of Morazán. He lives with his wife, who assists him with his business. Daniel sells assorted clothing for men, women and children, including underwear and sports shoes. He sells from a location in front of the park in Osicala, where many people gather for shopping, as there is a market and supermarket nearby along with other stores, which helps Daniel and makes his business more visible to passerby. He seeks a loan in order to buy additional inventory of clothing and footwear so as to increase his sales, as this is his family's sole livelihood. Both Daniel and his wife are well-regarded in his town as they are hard-working young people who have attained a stable living through their own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie, anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía pero se tuvo que renunciar ya que tanto desvelo le estaba afectando demasiado mejor solo se que da viendo su negocio en su casa.
Su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa  para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es  una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 29 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar y su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie, anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía pero se tuvo que renunciar ya que tanto desvelo le estaba afectando demasiado mejor solo se que da viendo su negocio en su casa. Su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 29 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar y su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para mi negocio  ej: granos básicos, bisutería  lácteos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory of staple goods

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Maria A. N., tiene una fritanga en su casa de habitación en el barrio Roberto González, y a la vez la señora A. hace enchiladas (enfrijoladas) que las elabora y las entrega a las escuelas el crédito la señora lo utilizo para comprar una mesa en donde pueda colocar las enchiladas fritas esto con el fin que su trabajo se le haga más fácil y mas cómodo para ella.
Ella antes trabajaba como domestica en una casa y luego ella decidio tener su propio negocio sacando a vender enchiladitas en su casa con C$ 200.00 que fueron ahorro.
texts.en:
La Señora Rosa Maria A. N., tiene una fritanga en su casa de habitación en el barrio Roberto González, y a la vez la señora A. hace enchiladas (enfrijoladas) que las elabora y las entrega a las escuelas el crédito la señora lo utilizo para comprar una mesa en donde pueda colocar las enchiladas fritas esto con el fin que su trabajo se le haga más fácil y mas cómodo para ella. Ella antes trabajaba como domestica en una casa y luego ella decidio tener su propio negocio sacando a vender enchiladitas en su casa con C$ 200.00 que fueron ahorro.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para su fritan guita

loans.name: Gilman

texts.es:
El Sr. Gilman M. es un joven que se ha dedicado al campo de la agricultura, el ha viajado a estados unidos en busca de otra vida actualmente tiene 10 años de trabajar en ese país para mejorar su nivel de vida.
El ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de un lote de terreno que comprara y construir una vivienda.
texts.en:
El Sr. Gilman M. es un joven que se ha dedicado al campo de la agricultura, el ha viajado a estados unidos en busca de otra vida actualmente tiene 10 años de trabajar en ese país para mejorar su nivel de vida. El ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de un lote de terreno que comprara y construir una vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un lote de terreno para construir

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Capital to buy wash basins wholesale and to sell them

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Joven Maria de los Ángeles B. R. es comerciante del Mercado Santa Ana su negocio es venta de ropa usada y esta ubicado en los módulos de Santa Ana, el financiamiento lo solicito porque nesecitaba surtir su negocio y comprar unas pacas que le vendian a precio favorable con el fin de vender y obtener  ganancias para reinvertirlo.
Su negocio lo administra con la ayuda de su mamá no tiene a nadie a cargo le gusta atender su negocio y estudiar.
Es su primer crédito con ceprodel espera que todo le salga muy bien para seguir trabajando con nosotros por un buen rato y así poder ver su negocio crecer.
texts.en:
La Joven Maria de los Ángeles B. R. es comerciante del Mercado Santa Ana su negocio es venta de ropa usada y esta ubicado en los módulos de Santa Ana, el financiamiento lo solicito porque nesecitaba surtir su negocio y comprar unas pacas que le vendian a precio favorable con el fin de vender y obtener ganancias para reinvertirlo. Su negocio lo administra con la ayuda de su mamá no tiene a nadie a cargo le gusta atender su negocio y estudiar. Es su primer crédito con ceprodel espera que todo le salga muy bien para seguir trabajando con nosotros por un buen rato y así poder ver su negocio crecer.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para mi negocio  pacas de niño y de niña

loans.name: Vanesa De Jesús

texts.es: La Sra. Vanesa R. es comerciante en en venta de diferentes productos ella actualmente tiene que reparar su vivienda la cual se presento a solicitar un préstamo  y terminar con su vivienda su marido tiene remesas de estados unidos de un hermano que lo apoya.
texts.en:
La Sra. Vanesa R. es comerciante en en venta de diferentes productos ella actualmente tiene que reparar su vivienda la cual se presento a solicitar un préstamo y terminar con su vivienda su marido tiene remesas de estados unidos de un hermano que lo apoya.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Martin Felix

texts.es:
MARTIN TIENE 31 AÑOS Y ES UNA PERSONA BASTANTE RESPONSABLE Y CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN. 
CUENTA CON UN AUTOMOVIL QUE ALQUILA PARA LA RUTA DE MANCO CAPAC- SANTA BARBARA – ICA. 
DICHA UNIDAD LA ADQUIRIO CON SUS AHORROS, YA QUE TAMBIEN TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE DESDE 
HACE MAS DE 10  AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU CONYUGE Y DOS MENORES HIJOS. REQUIERE EL CRÉDITO PARA REGULARIZAR DOCUMENTACION DE AFILIACION A UNA EMPRESA DE COLECTIVOS DE LA ZONA. SU ESPOSA SE 
DEDICA A LAS LABORES DE SU HOGAR Y AL CUIDADO DE SUS DOS MENORES HIJOS. ELLOS SON PERSONAS MUY AMABLES   
Y  CORDIALES, QUE DESEAN BRINDAR BUENA EDUCACIÒN A SUS HIJOS Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA, POR LO QUE HAN 
INCREMENTADO SU FUENTE DE TRABAJO.
texts.en:
Martin is 31 years old. He is quite responsible and wants to improve his situation. He owns a car that he rents out as part of a taxi service for the route from Manco Capac to Santa Barbara and Ica. He bought this vehicle with his savings, as he has also worked for ten years as a security guard. Martin lives in his own home with his wife and their two youngest children. He needs the loan to formalize the paperwork to join a collective taxi company in his area. His wife works at home and cares for the two children. Both Martin and his wife are very friendly people who want to offer their children a good education and a better quality of life. This is why they have found ways to supplement their work income.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Documentation to join a collective taxi company

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el sector Las Pampas, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pimentel, conocido principalmente por sus playas que siempre son frecuentadas por turistas, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas (agricultura y ganadería) desde que era muy joven, empezó apoyando a su padre y luego, con sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un terreno agrícola propio, donde siembra maíz chala (un tipo de maíz utilizado como forraje para ganado) con el que alimenta a sus vacas de las cuales se vale ahora para ganarse el sustento. El extrae diariamente la leche que producen sus animales y la comercializa con un acopiador de la zona. 

Este negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que el trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible, actualmente desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz chala aplicándole fertilizantes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/ 1,000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

José Luis es un hombre trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Luis is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and son in the Las Pampas area, which is an agricultural zone in the Pimental district. It is mostly know for its beaches, which are always visited by tourists, and is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture (agriculture and ranching) since he was very young. He started off helping his father and later, with his savings was able to buy his own land where he plants "chala" corn (a type of corn used for livestock feed), which he uses to feed the cattle from which he makes a living. Every day he milks the cows and sells that to a middleman. This business is his only source of income so he tries to maintain it as best he can. He would like to care for his crop of corn by applying fertilizers. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use for that purpose. José Luis is a hard worker and very devoted to his family. His greatest dream is to keep growing as a businessman so that he can provide them with a better standard of living. He has previously worked with Edpyme Alternative and has show punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilzers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells vegetables for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband sells ice-cream in the province, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike to transport ice-cream to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng Y., 42, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells hand-made brooms for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase wood from an old house for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy wood from old house for resale

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem C., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase wood to repair their old house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to repair house

loans.name: Moises Anibal

texts.es:
Moises tiene 21 años, es conviviente y vive en casa propia de material noble, la cual 
ha construido con ayuda del estado y con sus ahorros. Su unidad familiar la conforman 
su conviviente y su hijo de 2 años. Cuenta con una mototaxi propia la cual maneja con 
mucha responsabilidad y presta un servicio cordial y amable a sus pasajeros. Requiere 
el crédito para ponerle puertas y ventanas a su vivienda que requiere de varios 
acabados, ya que esta es una construcción nueva. Su sueño es brindarle seguridad y 
bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Moises is 21 years old and lives with his common-law partner and their 2-year-old child. They live in their own sturdy home, which Moises was able to build with government help and with his own savings. Moises owns a mototaxi [motorcycle taxi] which he operates responsibly, offering his passengers good and friendly service. He needs the loan to add doors and windows to his home, which is newly built and still needs many finishing touches. His dream is to offer security and a good life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem N., age 31, is employed at a local garment factory and earns an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband (pictured) sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Between the two of them, they try to cover the family expenses. They live with their five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase salt in bulk for her husband to offer in resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies. 

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk for resale

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Chourn Sokhy, 26, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He sells mobile phones for an income of about $3 per day. His wife provides hairdressing and clothing services for wedding parties, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Sokhy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more mobile phones for resale. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand his business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mr. Meas P., age 28, is a fisherman who lives in the village of Peam Ta Aek in Kandal province. His wife is a grocery seller. Between the two of their businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. 

Since the grocery business is going well, Mr. Meas P. wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand his wife's business. 

The couple has four children: two are very small and two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa T. is from the city of Dicayas. She is 60 years old. Generosa is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Generosa owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables and spices for sale. Generosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Generosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Generosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Generosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: María Elvira

texts.es: María Elvira A. D. P. D. 54 años, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a sus dos nietas D. 11 y 5 años D. edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad la cual esta ubicada en su hogar, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración D. piñatas, las cuales también comercializa en su casa D. habitación. María es una persona que lucha ella sola por contar con una vida estable para ella y sus nietas quienes son las que la incentivan a querer seguir adelante y a esforzarse mucho más. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. elementos para la elaboración D. las piñatas ya que estas cuentan con muy buenas ventas ya que sus precios son razonables. Ella desea poder mejorar su negocio y D. esta manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Elvira A. D. P. is 54 years old. She lives in Ciudad Arce, in the department of La Libertad, together with her two granddaughters, aged 11 and 5, who are in school. María operates a store, located in her home, where she sells basic products. In addition, she works making piñatas, which she also sells from her home. María is a person who is struggling on her own to ensure a stable life for herself and her granddaughters, who are her main motivation to try to get ahead and put forth even more effort. María is requesting a loan which she will use to buy a larger quantity of materials to make piñatas, since they sell very well, thanks to her reasonable prices. She would like to improve her business and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for her store and materials to make piñatas

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinuon Y., age 49, is the leader of a group loan consisting of five members. Each member of the group loan will use the loan for different business purposes. 

Mrs. Sinuon Y. is from Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province. She is a widow, and she stays at home to take care of her children. One of her children works in construction and the other two are employed as seamstresses in a garment factory.

She is requesting a loan in order to build a kitchen for her home.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Jeamaly

texts.en:
Jeamaly V. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba. She is 21 years old, married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jeamaly owns & operates an agricultural business. She plants different crops to sell in the local community. Jeamaly has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. She is also a day care worker for their barangay.

In 2009, Jeamaly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jeamaly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jeamaly is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned cocoland. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jeamaly from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned cocoland.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Transito

texts.es: Guadalupe del Transito D. D. M. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a sus dos hijos D. 20 y 15 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una venta D. granos básicos, platos y cucharas desechables, café y todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa en su puesto el cual esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. San Vicente, en donD. ella venD. sus productos por mayor y por unidad. Este negocio representa la mayor parte D. ingresos para su hogar por lo que ella desea mantenerlo estable, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería la cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe del Transito D. D. M. is 49 years old. She lives in the Department of San Vincente, where she lives together with her husband, who works as a businessman, and her two children who are 20 and 15 years old. Her children are studying. Guadalupe has a business selling basic grains, disposable plates and silverware, coffee, and many types of basic household goods. She sells these in her stall, which is located in the municipal market in San Vincente, both wholesale and individually. This business provides the large part of the household income and allows her to maintain stability. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan, with which she would be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise and in this manner achieve larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer Z., 34 years old, operates a specialized retail store in the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Rainer has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. He is married and has a school-aged child.

In 2009, Rainer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Rainer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rainer is requesting a second loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily-use goods to sell in his store.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia A. de 29 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus dos hijas de 13 y 11 años de edad quienes estudian educación básica. María posee una venta de golosinas, sodas y agua, la cual esta ubicada frente a la Universidad Nacional de San Vicente, en donde obtiene ganancias bastante aceptables. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, ya que para aumentar sus ganancias debe invertir en más mercadería, la cual pueda ofrecer a los clientes, es por esto que ella deposita sus esperanzas al préstamo hecho a Integral, deseando contar con el dinero necesario para mejorar también su economía familiar.
texts.en:
María Eugenia A. is 29 years old. She lives in the department of San Vicente, together with her family, which includes her husband who works as a mason, and her two daughters, aged 11 and 13, who are in primary school. María has a stand where she sells snacks, sodas and water, located in front of the National University of San Vicente. This business provides her with quite acceptable earnings. María is requesting a loan which she will use to stock her business, since in order to increase her profits she needs to invest in more merchandise to offer to her customers. For this reason, she is placing her hopes in the loan provided by Integral, so that she can earn the money she needs to raise her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying snacks, sodas and bottled water

loans.name: Sanat

texts.en:
Sanat H. is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She lives with her husband and four children in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Sanat and her family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). They have been living together in their current home for 21 years. 

Sanat operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. She purchases her products two or three times per month. Sanat spends 2,000,000 tugrugs (about $1,430 USD) per purchase. She pays 10,000 tugrugs (about $8 USD) for a rented counter.  She has been operating her business since 2000 and has built a stable operation and loyal customer base. 

Sanat operated her business at a market called Koshagash in Russia between 2001 and 2007. Since she started her business, her family's living conditions have been improving. With her earnings, she was able to pay her daughter's university fees until she graduated. 

Sanat is a very hardworking and open person. She says, “I would like to continue to successfully operate my business with the loan, and be financially able to pay the education fees for my children.” 

Sanat is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing from Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Fátima Cristina

texts.es: Fátima Cristina Z. D. R. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda con el negocio, y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos D. 12 y 4 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Fátima posee una panadería, en la cual junto a su esposo se encargan D. elaborar pan francés, nombre el cual se le da al pan bagette en este país, desD. hace 10 años que se dedican a este trabajo lo que les ha permitido ser muy conocidos por su excelente servicio. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración del pan, tales como: harina, azúcar, manteca y otros más, así mismo Fátima desea poder elaborar también pan dulce, D. manera que sus clientes se aumenten, lo cual sería D. gran beneficio para su hogar, ya que este es un negocio familiar, en cual es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Fátima Cristina Z. D. R. is 37 years old. She lives in Mejicanos, in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who helps her with her business, and her two children, aged 12 and 4, who are in school. Fátima operates a bakery, where, together with her husband, she prepares French-style bread, which is called "pan bagette" in this country. She has done this work for the past 10 years, and during this time she has become well-known for her excellent service. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the necessary ingredients to prepare bread, including flour, sugar, shortening, and more. Fátima would also like to start making sweet pastries, in order to attract more customers. This would be of great benefit to her household, since the bakery is a family business and their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B., age 55, operates a tailoring business in the village of Panalsalan Plaridel. Aida is married and has two adult-aged children. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing clothing alteration and tailoring services to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for sewing. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to meet the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for food business

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en:
Bayarbat is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in his mother-in-law's yard. 

Bayarbat operates a taxi-service business in his town. He is also a drawing teacher and an interior decorator. One of his dreams is to create his own interior-decorating business in the future. He has a great wife who supports his businesses. 

As a young couple, both of them have been working hard to improve the family's living conditions. With his earnings, he has been providing money for his family expenses. Bayarbat is an intelligent and hardworking person. He is a good father and husband to his family and says, “I would like to purchase my own place to live with my family and to live on our own.” 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to repair his taxi car, which was recently damaged in an accident with another car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Soth S. is from Preak Ta Choar village in the Kandal province. He is 62 years old and the leader of this group loan, which consists of four members. Each member of the group will use the loan to support a different business. Mr. Soth S. and his wife are laborers. With their jobs, they can receive a small salary to support their family.

Mr. Soth S. is requesting a loan to build a cow stable for cow breeding. This couple has three children; one is a laborer while the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To build a cow stable

loans.name: Lunita

texts.en: Lunita J. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 54 years old. Lunita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Lunita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products, such as candies, snacks, salt, coconut, vinegar, etc., in the local community. Lunita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,200 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Lunita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lunita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Lunita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lunita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Hoh

texts.en:
Hoh, age 47, works as a technician in a private company called Koshelik LLC. He earns 200,000 to 250,000 tugrugs monthly. He also used to trade products at a market called Yoshagash in Russia. Currently, his wife operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. She has been operating her business since 1990, and has gained much experience over the years as a trader. Her daily revenue is between 40,000 and 60,000 tugrugs. Hoh supports his wife's business as well as his own work. 

Hoh and his wife have four children. The family lives in an apartment in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Their two oldest daughters, ages 20 and 23, are university students in Turkey, and the two youngest children attend a local secondary school. The family has been living together in their current home for 22 years. With their combined earnings, they have been managing to pay their two daughters' university fees. 

Hoh is a very hardworking person and his family is the most important thing to him. He says, “I am working hard to pay my two daughters' university fees in order to provide a good education for them.” Hoh is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more clothing from Ereen and Taikeshken, two Chinese border towns, to sell at his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory for sale at market

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita F. is a 70-year-old widowed woman who lives with her two children named Mosies and F.. The two children are 24 and 32 years of age and are very supportive and loving children to their mother. Mosies works sporadically as a hired laborer who earns a small amount of money. F. is a fisherman who goes to fish with other fishermen in their village, for he doesn’t have his own fishing boat to use for fishing anytime he wants to earn money for supporting their daily needs. 

Despite the economic status of her family, Enriquita feels fortunate to have children as responsible as her children. For her, being old is not a reason to not be productive, especially to help her loved ones. As a matter of fact, she joined ASHI in 2008 wanting to partner with her fisherman son to grow his business. The loans she has been requesting and is requesting now is her source of capital to achieve the desire of her heart. 

Despite her old age, Enriquita is still capable of selling the fish caught by her son to people around their village. The profits she earns provide her family with simple things they really enjoy; though for Enriquita, those things they have may not be enough. Her sons still have some desires for their lives kept in their hearts, yet she has never heard them complain about the kind of life they have. Through ASHI, Enriquita hopes that one day her business will flourish and bring improvements in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn M. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 28 years old. Charlyn is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Charlyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional construction materials for house improvements. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for house completion. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Charlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House completion

loans.name: Hurtsbaatar

texts.en:
Hurtsbaatar S. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His 19-year-old daughter attends university. His youngest son, Byambabaatar, attends a local primary school. 

Hurtsbaatar earns his living by selling television antennas at Narantuul, the biggest market in Mongolia. He operates his business with his wife. Most of his customers are countryside residents. Hurtsbaatar's sales increase during the spring, when residents from the countryside sell cashmere and earn money which positively affects their consumer capacity. He purchases his products from Ereen, a Chinese border town with cheap prices, to sell to his many customers. 

Hurtsbaatar has been operating his business since 2005 and has steadily expanded it. In addition, he has been planning to expand his product line to include selling electrical products. With his earnings, he purchased a plot of land with a house and yard for his family. He also purchased a car with his previous loan which he successfully paid in full. 

His wife operates a mobile candy, gum and beverage trading business as well for extra income for her family. 

Hurtsbaatar is a very hard working person. He is working hard to provide a good education for his children and to expand his product line in the future. Hurtsbaatar is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of television antennas from Ereen for the anticipation of the upcoming spring, when the product demand will be very high.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul T., 24 years old, runs a bakery shop at a local market called Bayangol. She has been operating her business since 2005, and has built a loyal customer base. Her husband, Batsaihan, helps at his wife's business, except during summer when he manufactures blocks to sell. They own their own house and live with their two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their two-year-old daughter attends a local kindergarten. 

With her earnings, Munhzul was able to purchase a car for her family. She has been using it to transport her products as well as using it for her family's transportation needs. 

Munhzul is an industrious person and has many plans for the future. She and her husband have been planning to expand their product line at the shop in order to sell ham and eggs at an additional counter. She would also eventually like to support her husband in an effort to create his own block manufacturing workshop. 

Munhzul is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more baked goods and cakes for resale at her bakery shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her bakery

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Due to being poor since birth, 67-year-old Betty V. is used to working so hard the whole day to earn money for supporting her needs. When she became a mother to her three children, she worked harder; even more so when her husband died, leaving her so much to bear financially and emotionally. Despite her poverty, Betty somehow feels happy because her children now are grown-ups and one of them has his own family. Through her love, support and hard work, they were able to enjoy life in its simplest way. Nevertheless, Betty still wants to give her children and grandchildren the best things she can offer through the profit she can earn in growing her small variety store business. For now, she wants to help her youngest child (24 years old) to graduate from college to be able to have a better career and future. She hopes that her child will have a life unlike her own, which is very poor.

Through the loan Betty is requesting now through ASHI, she wishes her small variety store to become a mini grocery store which sells several types of grocery items and would have a huge volume of inventories for people in their village to access, rather than going to market where they would be spending on travel expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of grocery items and other commodities.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van C., 35, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. She produces Cambodian traditional cakes (usually cooked in bamboo) for a gross income of about USD 20 per day. Her husband is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M., from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is a 49-year-old married mother of 13 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia has sold firewood to local community members for over seven years, earning approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business, Virginia is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 15000 PHP to purchase more wood to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional wood to sell

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en:
Baasanhuu, age 46, operates a clothing and consumer goods trading business in his town. He started out by manufacturing winter hats to sell, and since 2000 his business has expanded to include variety of clothing and accessories including hats, scarves, and sunglasses. He sells these to his many customers at a rental counter at the local market. He has gained much experience over the years and has been planning to further expand his business. Baasanhuu is focused on the future and says, “My dream is one day to open my own trading center.” 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large assortment of hats, scarves, and sunglasses for summer, spring and autumn in Ereen, a Chinese border town. He will resell these for a profit at market.			

Baasanhuu lives with his mother in Zavhan province in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent dwelling. His mother operates a vegetable trading business on her own plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen K., 26, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 10 per day, while her husband, a barber, earns an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou S., 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. She produces rice wine for an income of about USD 11 per day, while her husband, a motor-taxi driver, earns USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase rice to produce more wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice to produce rice wine

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., age 45, is a tailor and earns an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband (pictured) is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 10 per day. They work together to cover the family expenses. They live with their four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its high-quality rice products. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction materials to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s studies.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials to expand the business

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van K., 61, is married and resides with his wife and five children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. He is a security guard and is able to earn an income of about USD 2 per day, while his wife produces traditional lamps, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase construction material to repair the house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair house

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia C., from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is a married mother of five adult-aged children. To make a living, Alecia provides transport services to local community members. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts for better service, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle spare parts for better service

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chouk

texts.en: Chouk C., 43, is married and resides with his wife (shown  here) and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and is able to earn about USD 3 a day. His wife prepares fabrics at home, earning an income of USD 1 a day to help cover the family expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a sewing machine and repair the house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and repair the house

loans.name: Elona's Group

texts.en:
Elona R. is from the village of Balatacan Tangub City. She is 45 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elona is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elona is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from  to pay her children's tuition fees.

The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rental apartment. His oldest daughter, Anuujin, is 13 years old and attends high school. His 6-year-old son, Hishigten, attends a kindergarten. 

Batjargal manufactures Mongolian traditional souvenirs to sell to his many customers and his profit is very high, especially during the summer, between June and October. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~357 USD). After years of successful operations, he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 10,000,000 tugrugs (~7,140 USD) today. 

His family is the most important thing for him and he says, “As a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up, and also I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future." He is requesting a loan to purchase more materials for his business. 

About Credit Mongol:
Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro and SME clients and to become the best performing company in micro and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making souvenirs

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Aside from being poor, Rosalia M., all by herself, faces the challenges of supporting the needs of her only child who is studying in college until she graduates. Her husband, who works abroad hoping to improve their lives by providing her enough financial support, left her for another woman. Despite that painful event in Rosalia’s life, she has never thought of giving up her dream for her child. Instead she became tough and determined to face challenges in achieving her goal. 

Rosalia had started her own small variety store in 2008, financed by a loan through Kiva's field partner, ASHI. Since then she has her own source of income for supporting her needs, and most especially her child’s. Though sustainability has been a challenge for her because income is not yet liquid for supporting her family’s entire needs, Rosalia still clings to her dream of making her store profitable and successful. Because of that, she is now requesting a much larger loan through ASHI. 

Although Rosalia fails in her love life, she still has a lot of things to feel fortunate about in her life. She enjoys her career as a business woman and being a mother to her only daughter, Louela Jean.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other commodities to sell.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use and to transport goods from the market. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

Sok N., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice products. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
