H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20202980032) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Mơ (20202980033) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20202980034) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20202980035) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub Y., age 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Sa Ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugar cane plantations. She raises and sells pigs and earns an income of about USD $1.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns an income of USD $2.00 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Y. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase pig food and piglets. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980026) is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the leader of a 5-member L. group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn nhóm 05 (5).


H. is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, H. providing repair services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting a L. from SEDA for the first time. She isr equesting a L. of 5.152.000 VND to purchase equipment to improve the business. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Đào Thị T. (20203980027) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her service-based business.


2. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203980028) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her specialized retail store.


3. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203980029) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support livestock business.


4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980030) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980026) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn nhóm 05 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.   Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. Đào Thị T. (20203980027) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203980028) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203980029) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980030) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Pathma

texts.en:
Pathma is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Telijjawila in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has three sons and three daughters. 

Pathma has managed a spice business for one year with the help of her daughters and sons. She is very enthusiastic about her business.

Pathma has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy spices

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po S., age 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Sa Ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells Cambodian traditional cakes and earns an income of about USD $2.50 per day. Her husband sells ice cream, earning an income of USD $3.00 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase a fruit-blending machine to produce many kinds of ice cream to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. and her husband are pictured together.

loans.use: To buy a fruit-blending machine

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 34-year-old married man with two children in school.  He runs a taxi business and also does farming to earn a living.  He uses part of his income to pay his three workers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard by his group members who share business ideas. George is fortunate to be in this group because its members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers.  He hopes to own a fleet of vans for a transportation business. He sees himself expanding his business in a few years.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Ahunbaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мархила лидер этой группы. Ей 41 год, она занимается  розничной реализацией молока и айрана. Молоко закупает у народа с села и реализует в г. Ош, а из молока готовит айран для реализации. Ее супруг строитель. У нее двое детей. На кредит она закупит доенную корову для реализации молока и молочной продукции.

Гульмира, 28, замужем. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. У нее 3 детей. Старшая дочь ходит в школу, остальные дома. На высланные деньги от супруга с РФ, клиентка закупила телку, откормив телку продала и закупила доенную КРС и начала реализовать молоко. На кредит планирует закупить доенную корову и увеличить реализацию молока.

Октамхон, 37, замужем. Супруг работает мебельщиком, в месяц зарабатывает около 150 долларов. 'Клиент занимается выпечкой и реализация лепешек. Клиентка каждый день выпекает с одного мешка 75 лепешек и реализует в г. Ош по 10 сом. На кредит планирует закуп доенной коровы.

Чынара, 37, замужем. У нее 4 детей, сыну 15, дочерям 14,12 и 11 лет. Сын занимается наемной работой, дочери идут в школу. Клиент ежемесячно получает пособие в размере 15 долларов. В настоящее время клиентка занимается наемной работой (сеет картофель). кредит будет потрачен чтобы построить ворота.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Marhila is a leader of this group. She is 41 years old and sells milk and ayran (a yogurt drink) in retail. She buys the milk from the village population and resells in the town of Osh, and also makes ayran from the milk to resell it. Her husband is a construction worker. They have two children. She will use the loan to buy a milk cow for selling of milk and milk products. Gulmira is 28, she is married. Her husband is working in Russia. She has three children. Her oldest daughter goes to school and the rest of the children stay at home. She used the money which her husband sent from Russia to buy a cow and after feeding it she sold it and bought a milk cow and began to sell milk. She plans to use the loan to buy another milk cow to increase the milk sales. Oktamhon is 37, she is married. Her husband makes furniture and earns around $150US a month. She bakes and sells flat breads. Every day she makes 75 flat breads from one bag of flour and sells them in the town of Osh for 10 soms each. She plans to use the loan to buy a milk cow. Chinara is 37, she is married. She has four children. Her son is fifteen and her daughters are fourteen, twelve and eleven. Her sons works for hire and her daughters go to school. Chinara receives an allowance of $15US a month. At this time she also works for hire, she sows potatoes. She will use the loan to build a gate.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk cow

loans.name: Theoung

texts.en: Theoung B., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells Cambodian traditional cakes for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. B. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Salieva`s Group

texts.ru:
Ырыскан 60 лет. Она вдова с 2 сыновьями. Старший сын на заработках в Казахстане, младший сын член крестьянского хозяйства.Она занимается жЖивотноводством: откорм и разведение КРС и реализация молочных продукциию. В основном младший сын помогает в бизнесе. На кредит клиент планирует закупить 1- бычка и доенную корову.

Айнуре 37 лет. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. Старшая дочь находится на заработках в Казахстане, работает продавщицей. Вторая дочь учится в местной школе в 9 классе. Третья дочь учится в 6 классе. Младшая дочь дома. Она на кредит планирует закупить строй материалы (древесину и  500 кг цемента) для постройки конюшни.

Кыздархан, 47, замужем. Ее супруг работает частным строителем. У нее 3 детей: старшему сыну 21, младшему 16, дочке 14 лет. Она вместе с детьми занимается откормом и разведением КРС и реализацией молочной продукции. Кроме этого у нее имеется земельный надел, где она выращивает технические культуры. На кредит клиентка планирует закупить 500 кг. минеральных удобрений, 28 кг. семена хлопчатника и ГСМ для транспорта.

Уулхан, 60, замужем. Ее супруг пенсионер, получает пенсию в размере около 70 долларов. Сын Нурлан на заработках в Бишкеке, сын Нурбек на заработках в Алма-Ате (Казахстан), сын Жылдыз член крестьянского хозяйства. 'В 1994 году заемщица переехала на новый дом с земельным участком 0,15га и стала самостоятельно с супругом выращивать с\х продукцию, в основном сажали хлопок и получали хороший доход. На кредит она закупит минеральные удобрения на 1,30 га земли и семена хлопчатника.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Yryskan is 60 years old. She is a widow with 2 sons. The oldest son works in Kazakhstan, and the youngest son is a member of a farm collective. Yryskan is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding of cattle and sales of dairy products. The youngest son primarily helps her with the business. The client plans to use the loan to buy 1 bull and a dairy cow. Aynura is 37 years old. Her husband works in the Russian Federation. The oldest daughter works as a salesperson in Kazakhstan. The second daughter attends 9th grade at a local school. The third daughter goes to 6th grade, and the youngest daughter is at home. Aynura plans to use the loan to buy construction materials (wood and 500 kg of cement) in order to build a horse stable. Kyzdarhan is 47 years old, married. Her husband works as a construction contractor. She has 3 children: the oldest son is 21, youngest is 16 and the daughter is 14 years old. Together with the children, Kyzdarhan is involved in fattening and breeding cattle and sales of dairy products. Besides this business, she has a plot of land, where she grows agricultural crops. The client plans to use the loan to buy 500 kg of mineral fertilizers, 28 kg of cotton seeds and fuel for the transport. Uulhan is 60 years old, married. Her husband is retired and receives a pension in the amount of about 70 dollars. Her son, Nurlan, works in Bishkek, son, Nurbek, works in Alma-Ata (Kazakhstan), and son, Jyldyz, is a member of a farm collective. In 1994, Uulhan moved to a new house that had a 0.15 hectare plot of land, and she and her husband started to grow agricultural crops. They primarily planted cotton and received a good income. Uulhan will use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers for 1.30 hectares of land and cotton seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy N., 51, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She is a housewife. Her husband carves wood into sculptures for sale, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family'S expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more wood for her husband, to expand his business. In the future, she would like to use aN. additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Noy's husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy wood to carve and sell.

loans.name: Kameme Bakyara Kweterana Group

texts.en:
A determined and very hardworking N. Moses, aged 40 years, is the married father of ten children and two helpless dependents.

Moses has operated a retail shop business for fifteen years, selling general merchandise in Kihihi town. At the end of every month he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings.

Moses’ main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in his business that cannot match the consumption rate of his customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods that will satisfy his customers’ high demand and also transform his enterprise into a wholesale business.

Being very committed to the business with good customer care, Moses hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business and enable him to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his family requirements.

loans.use: To stock more home products in his business

loans.name: Omurzakova`s Group

texts.ru:
Арзикан 47 лет. Она замужем ее супруг работает в Кыргызтелекоме. У нее 4 детей. Сыновьям 21,19,16, а дочке 14 лет. Старший сын на заработках в РФ, младшие дети  учатся в школе. Она занимается животноводством, откармливает 2 коровы и одного теленка, также занимается реализацией молочной продукции. Переехав на новый дом через 6-7 лет начала этот бизнес. На кредит она хочет закупить овец для откорма и разведения.

Айсулуу 34 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг работает начальником службы, зарплата составляет около 180 долларов. Клиент хочет купить одну телку для откорма и разведения.


Гулмира, 44, замужем и мать 2 сыновей. Супруг работает в районной гелогобазе. Клиент занимается откормом и разведением КРС. В настоящее время откармливает одну корову с теленком, также занимается реализацией молока, в день продает 8 лт. На кредит клиент планирует закупить минеральные удобрения, семена хлопка и обработать землю.

Кызан, 80 лет. Она вдова. Она проживает с сыном и его семьей. 'Сын является частным строителем, в месяц зарабатывает около 120 долларов.В настоящее время откармливает корову с теленком, на пастбище отправила 1 телку и 5 овец. На кредит она закупит телку для откорма и разведения.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Arzikan is 47 years old. She is married, and her husband works at Kyrgyztelecom. She has 4 children. The sons are 21, 19 and 16, and the daughter is 14 years old. The oldest son works in Russia, and the younger children go to school. Arzikan is involved in animal husbandry, fattens 2 cows and one calf. She started this business 6-7 years after she moved to a new home. She wants to use this loan to buy sheep for fattening and breeding. Aysuluu is 34 years old. She is married, and her husband works as a service manager, whose salary is about 180 dollars. The client wants to buy one heifer for fattening and breeding. Gulmira is 44 years old. She is married and is a mother of 2 sons. Her husband works at the district geology base. The client is involved in fattening and breeding of cattle. Currently, she is fattening one cow with a calf. She is also involved in milk sales and sells 8 liters of milk per day. Gulmira plans to use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers, cotton seeds and treat the soil. Kyzan is 80 years old. She is a widow. She lives with her son and his family. Her son is a construction contractor, who earns about 120 dollars per month. At the present time, Kyzan is fattening a cow with a calf and sent 1 heifer and 5 sheep off to a pasture. She wants to use the loan to buy a heifer for fattening and breeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Raeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Алийма, 44, разведена. Она в одиночку воспитала 4 детей: Сыновьям (22,16,14), дочери 20 лет. Старший сын и дочь находятся на заработках в РФ, младшие сыновья школьники. Клиент в настоящее время откармливает 2 корову, телку и 7 овец. На кредит она планирует закупить овец для откорма и разведения.

Кундузхан 61 лет. Ее супруг член крестьянского хозяйства, а также получает пенсию около 70 долларов. Она сама занимается животноводством. В настоящее время откармливает одну корову с теленком. На кредит она планирует закупить 2-х бычков.

Сардальхон 67 лет. Ее единственный сын ранее работал на хлопкозаводе, на данный момент в столице на заработках. Клиент откармливает для продажи 18 овец и 2 козы. На сумму получаемого кредита она закупит 2-х козлят для откорма и разведения.

Райма, 58, вдова. У нее 3 детей, сыновьям 21 и 24 лет, дочери 18 лет. Сыновья на зароботках в РФ, дочь помогает в бизнесе. Клиент дома откармливает одну корову.На кредит клиент планирует закупить овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. texts.en:
Aliyma is 44 years old, divorced. She raised 4 children on her own. Her sons are 22, 16 and 14 years old, and daughter is 20 years old. The oldest son and daughter work in the Russian Federation, and the younger sons are school students. The client is currently fattening 2 cows, a heifer and 7 sheep. She plans to use this loan to buy sheep for fattening and breeding. Kunduzhan is 61 years old. Her husband is a member of a farmers’ collective and also receives a pension in the amount of about 70 dollars. Kunduzhan is involved in animal husbandry. Currently, she is fattening one cow with a calf. She plans to use the loan to buy 2 bulls. Sardalhon is 67 years old. Her only son previously worked at a cotton factory and is currently working in the capital. The client is fattening 18 sheep and 2 goats for sale. She will use the loan to buy 2 goats for fattening and breeding. Rayma is 58 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. Her sons are 21 and 24 years old, and daughter is 18 years old. The sons work in Russia, and the daughter helps her with the business. The client is fattening one cow at home. Rayma plans to use the loan to buy sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun Y., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells fruit for an income of about USD 10 per day. Her husband produces traditional plows and wooden beds, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy wood to produce more plows for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy wood to produce plows for sale.

loans.name: Chandrika

texts.en:
Chandrika is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband.  She has one son and one daughter.  Her husband is doing various different jobs. They are very close and work well together.  

Chandrika cultivates tea and bananas and she has a paddy field. She is managing these cultivations with the support of her son. Six years ago, she started these cultivations. She is a hard working woman.

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help purchase seeds and manure. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy manure and seeds

loans.name: Phai

texts.en: Phai O., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband raises pigs and produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family's expenses. O. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to buy rice to produce more wine and pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To buy rice and pig food.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother to 4 children. Dilorom owns a successful clothing sales business at the market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 11 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and the constant demand for her products. Dilorom tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Dilorom has requested a loan of $1500 USD to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Dilorom will be better prepared to meet increased demand and to earn a good income. We believe that her perseverance, hard work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Malikakhon

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Malikakhon, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Malikakhon is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is divorced and the mother of three children. For more than 16 years, she has operated a store where she sells children's and women’s clothing. Her store is well-known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. 

Malikakhon hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose, Malikakhon requests $1200 USD. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
D. Askar is 31 years old. He is married and has a child. His mother and father are living with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses too. He has a butcher shop and has been running meat-selling business for 9 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Now Askar is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Askar is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase meat to expand his business.

loans.name: Zakirova`s Group

texts.ru:
Айтикан,53, разведена. У нее трое детей:двое старших сыновья на заработках в России, а самый младший учится работает официантом в кафе, дополнительно обучается в ВУЗе на заочном отделении. клиент занимается малым производством: пошив и реализация "Чия" - аксессуара для юрты. Этим она начала заниматься два года назад, до этого она работала учительницей в школе. Вынуждена была бросить свою профессию, т.к. зарплата была слишком маленькой чтобы содержать семью. Кроме этого у нее есть 70 соток земли, кредит будет потрачен для закупа удобрений и посеян рис.

Кызжибек, 24, вдова. У нее осталась одна 6 месячная дочь. Клиент в данное время проживает со своими родителями, они и присматривают за внучкой. Кызжибек  занимается оптовой торговлей потребительских товаров, а также торгует фруктами. Кредит будет использован для закупа 8 коробок яблок, 8 коробок груши, 10 коробок мандаринов и 10 коробок бананов для реализации. 

Зуура, 45, разведена. У нее есть дочь, которая в данное время работает в РФ. Клиентка также занимается малым производством. Этот кредит она потратит на закуп скота, который далее будет отправлен на пастбище. 

Ыкыбал, 32. Она вместе с сестрами шьет "Чий". Этим бизнесом она начала заниматься год назад, как только вернулась с России. Сейчас она хочет купит корову, чтобы получить дополнительный доход после ее перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aytikan is 53 years old, divorced. She has three children. Two of the older sons work in Russia, and the youngest works as a waiter at a café and additionally attends an evening program at a university. The client is involved in small-scale manufacturing: sewing and sales of “Chiy” – an accessory for a yurt. She started this business two years ago and previously worked as a school teacher. Aytikan had to abandon her profession because her salary was too low to support her family. Besides this business, she has 70 hectares of land. The loan will be used for the purchase of fertilizers to plant rice. Kyzjibek is 24 years old, a widow. She has one 6-month-old daughter. The client currently lives with her parents, who look after their granddaughter. Kyzjibek is involved in wholesale sales of consumer goods and also sells fruits. The loan will be used for the purchase of 8 boxes of apples, 8 boxes of pears, 10 boxes of tangerines and 10 boxes of bananas for sale. Zuura is 45 years old, divorced. She has a daughter, who currently works in the Russian Federation. The client is also involved in small-scale manufacturing. She will use this loan to purchase livestock that will subsequently be sent to a pasture. Ykybal is 32 years old. She and her sisters sew “Chiy”. She started this business a year ago, soon after returning from Russia. Now she wants to buy a cow in order to get a supplemental income after its resale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to plant rice

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo describes herself as an enterprising woman with the goal to achieve successes in the future. She decided to start a tailoring business to help her family with household expenses 15 years ago. During long years of her activity she gained a rich experience and increased her clientele. Now Zebo is requesting a loan of $1500 USD, which she will use to purchase materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests. Now it is spring season and that is when demand is at its highest. Zebo and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing materials for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Rano has sold women’s clothing at “Ganjina” market in Dushanbe. Rano is married and the mother of three children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Rano is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Rano has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1500 USD to purchase a new vending facility and to expand her business. With the increased income, Rano plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.en:
Seventeen years ago, Gulrukhon started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Gulrukhon has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last 2 years, IMON has provided ongoing assistance to Gulrukhon’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Gulrukhon has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1400 USD to purchase additional goods for her business. The well being of Gulrukhon’s family and her business are in your hands. Gulrukhon and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
K. Gulchehra has an established business selling children's clothing in her store. She started her business about 10 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from neighboring country China, where she can get better prices, is the way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Gulchehra is married, and she has two children. She is requesting a loan of $2600 USD in order to purchase more clothing. With additional clothing, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, cette femme vit dans le quartier Lomnava à baguida qui est une ville à 15 km de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de produits génériques, en ce moment elle fait face à une dimunition de son stock de marchandises, étant une vieille cliente de WAGES, elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 5 prêts qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un 6ème prêt pour l’achat de divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
This lady is married with four children and lives in the Lomnava neighborhood of Baguida, a town 15 km from Lomé [Togo's capital]. To earn her living she sells a variety of merchandise at retail. Currently her innventory is low. As a longtime client of WAGES she has had five loans, all repaid timely, and is now seeking a sixth loan to build up her inventory.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for resale at retail

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
K. Gulbahor is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and has 4 children. Twenty years ago, Gulbahor started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity to help her husband with family expenses. Gulbahor works in a tailoring shop where she produces national dresses for women. Now all of her children are going to school. She wishes for her children to continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. Gulbahor asks for a loan of 4500 Somoni that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and to cover her customers' demands. Help this family with improving their quality of life by contributing to the growth of Gulbahor’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing women's national dresses.

loans.name: Bakirova`s Group

texts.ru:
Токтогул,60, вдова. У нее 5 детей; 4 дочери и 1 сын. Все взрослые и живут отдельно. Клиент занимается животноводством: разведением и откормом скота. До распада СССР она работала в колхозе дояркой. После распада начала заниматься этим делом самостоятельно. Кредит будет потрачен для закупа коров. 

Анаркан 71 лет. Она также как и предыдущий участник группы вдова. Она проживает вместе с внуком. Вместе с внуком она содержит маленькое домашнее хозяйство. Ежемесячная прибыль от животноводства составляет около 45 долларов. Кредит будет использован для закупа овец, которые будут переправлены на пастбище. 

Темиржан, 55, женат. У него 5 детей: сыновьям 32 и 28 лет. Дочерям 27, 25 и 20. Вместе с супругой они разводят скот на протяжении 5 лет. Он тоже планирует закупить скот на полученный кредит. На фотографии также снялась супруга Темиржана.

Майрамкан 54 года. Ее супруг занимается пассажирскими перевозками. У нее 7 детей. На кредит она планирует закупить овец для откорма.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 60 years old, a widow. She has 5 children: 4 daughters and 1 son. All of them are grown and live separately. The client is involved in animal husbandry: breeding and fattening of livestock. Prior to the breakup of the USSR, Toktogul worked as a milkmaid at a collective farm. Then, she started to run this business on her own. The loan will be used to buy cows. Anarkan is 71 years old. Just like the previous group participant, she is a widow. She lives with her grandson. Together, they run a small home business. The monthly income from animal husbandry is about 45 dollars. The loan will be used for the purchase of sheep that will be sent off to a pasture. Temirjan is 55 years, married. He has 5 children: the sons are 32 and 28 years old, and the daughters are 27, 25 and 20. Together with his wife, Temirjan have been breeding livestock for 5 years. He also plans to buy livestock, using this loan. The photograph also shows Temirjan’s wife. Mayramkan is 54 years old. Her husband is involved in passenger transportation. She has 7 children. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
K. Norbibi is 50 years old. She and her husband purchase and resell cows as their business. She has 6 children. Norbibi would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase additional cows. This will increase her inventory and meet her customers' demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Norbibi would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan into her business to purchase additional cows and to increase their income further. They also plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part in Norbibi's family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle and baby calves, to expand the business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 39 years old. She is married and is mother to 6 adorable children. Saodat has a grocery store which she attends to herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She began her business 7 years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income. The business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests for a loan of $3000 US Dollars. Saodat is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of inventory. She promises to repay her loan on time and thanks everybody who decide to support her.

loans.use: To purchase the goods for selling to increase the range of inventory.

loans.name: Kibimbiri Development Group B

texts.en:
For the last eight years, N. Abdul, aged 35 years, has been selling cows and goats to earn a living in the Kihihi area in western Uganda. Abdul deals with farmers directly to purchase their livestock and then finds a ready market for them. His main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices of cattle and low capital input.

With determined resolve and efficient customer-care skills, Abdul has managed to keep his business going. In a month, he says, he makes profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings.

Abdul’s future plans are to fully expand his transactions, which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s educational requirements. With this loan, he anticipates great strides in achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to match the demand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards and to add more local currency to his business.

loans.name: Mumindjon

texts.en:
Mumindjon is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Mumindjon wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. For this reason, he is asking for a loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his loan request.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
T. Gulmurod is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. Gulmurod is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising large livestock and their sale at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises the heifers with the help of his wife and young son. He then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today, Gulmurod is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $1200 USD in his business. In order to receive this amount, Gulmurod has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Be Faithful Group

texts.en:
Mary N. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Be Faithful. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven children who range in age from 9 to 29 years old. She was only able to attend school through the 7th grade and then began to have children.

For 5 years, Mary has been selling vegetables on Benson Street downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pineapples, tomatoes and some fruits.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples, tomatoes and some fruits.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon, a livestock breeder with 10 years experience, was born in Djabbar Rasulov district in 1975. He is married and responsible for 3 people, including his wife and two children (pictured, one of the children) who are all engaged in Odiljon’s business. 

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and to repair his enclosure. This will meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and from neighboring villages. Some of his clientele come to buy animals from as far away as more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Odiljon is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. Part of the loan, he is planning to spend for his farming business. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and he will also make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en: Tolib B. is 50 years old. He has been operating a tractor service at local farms since 1999. At the same time, in order to make additional profit, he has been raising and selling cattle at the local market. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has two children whom he needs to support and give a proper education. Tolib has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivatives (as in dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. At the same time, he wants to repair his tractor and for that, he needs to purchase spare parts. Therefore, Tolib is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni, counting on your generosity. loans.use: Purchasing cattle and spare parts to repair his tractor

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
H. Yunus is 24 years old. From the time he was young, Yunus was learning to work in the small business of sheep breeding with his parents. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. In the photo, you can see his mother who helps him with his business. In addition to the sheep breeding business, he also runs a taxi business. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his family. For this reason, Yunus is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to purchase young sheep and spare parts for his car. Be an important part of the growth of Yunus’s business.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and spare parts for his car

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Madame Salimata D. habite dans le quartier de Gibraltar à Guediawaye. Elle est âgée de 34 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse du centre de sauvegarde depuis 2004. Elle a déjà rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle est mariée  et mère de 3 enfants. Madame D. évolue  dans le commerce et la vente d’habillements ou de prêt a porter pour enfants et adultes. Elle a toujours voulu faire du commerce pour gagner sa vie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour acheter quelques habits de prêt à porter mais aussi des sacs  à main, des parfums et des déodorants  pour diversifier ses produits. Les bénéfices  générés  par son activité lui permettront de gérer  certaines petites dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Salimata D. lives in the Gibraltar neighborhood of Guediawaye. She is 34 years old, and has been a member of the credit association of the Centre du Sauvegarde since 2004. She has repaid two previous loans. Married with three children, Mme D. is developing a business selling ready-to-wear clothing for children and adults. She has always wanted to do business so as to earn her own living. She is asking for a loan of 150,000 Fr to buy not only ready-to-wear clothing but also handbags, perfumes and deodorants, in order to diversity her product lines. Her business earnings will allow her to take care of small household expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement fond de roulement

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
S. Olimjon is 24 years old. He is a livestock trader. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last eight years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Olimjon is married and has a little kid. His wife and mother (pictured) are also engaged in his business. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. Olimjon plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Yunuskhuja

texts.en:
Yunuskhuja is 46 years old. He is a farmer. Since his marriage, he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes, onions and carrots. Yunuskhuja leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables Yunuskhuja to purchase goods for his home. However, the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like Yunuskhuja must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. Yunuskhuja is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
S. Navbahor is 33 years old. She purchases and resells cows with her husband. She has three children. Navbahor would like to request a loan of 6,100 Somoni in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Navbahor would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part in Navbahor family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle .

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh is 43 years old. He is married and has a little kid. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hard working person and he has been providing taxi services for more than six years. In addition, together with his friendly family, Farrukh also runs a cattle-raising business. Farrukh wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. Farrukh needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. He will also spend part of the loan to purchase young cattle.
